post.summary: Create a new applicant or candidate for new hires
post.description:
This operation creates a new job applicant and returns a new applicantId. You can review applicants and their data on the Job Candidates form in PrismHR; to look up information for the applicant you created, enter the applicantId value in the Candidate Number field.

This operation enables import of applicants/new hire candidates into PrismHR from an external source, such as an applicant tracking system. Since these external systems may vary substantially, this operation is designed to be as flexible as possible, with minimal restrictions and validations on the input fields.

requestBody.description: new applicant object

get.summary: Get a list of job applicants
get.description:
This operation returns an array of all the job applicants/candidates for the specified client or clients. To retrieve applicants from multiple clients, pass a comma-separated list of values for the clientId.
This operation also returns paginated results. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of applicants. count specifies the number of applicants to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the applicant list. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of applicants.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: client identifier--up to 20 IDs can be passed, separated by commas

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: number of records returned per page

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: unique list name required when multiple client ids are passed

post.summary: Adjust benefit adjustment cyles for an employee
post.description: Use this operation to calculate benefit plan adjustments related to changes in the benefit adjustment cycle. The writeAdjustment parameter determines whether the system will write the recalculated values to the adjustment record. If this parameter is false (default value), the method returns calculation data without writing it to the adjustment record. To obtain the checksum for this method, call the BenefitService.getBenefitAdjustments method.

writeAdjustment.description: whether or not to write recalculated benefit data to the Benefit Adjustment record. If false (default), the method returns the recalculated benefit data but does not update the database

get.description:
This operation returns web enrollment configuration details for a specified client. You can filter the response to a specific employee ID or enrollment type (Benefit Enrollment, Open Enrollment, Anytime Enrollment, Life Event).

This operation also returns paginated results. Use the count and startpage request parameters to navigate through the list of records. count specifies the number of records to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the list of enrollment records. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of records. If the total is greater than 5000, the initial response will include the first 5000 records with the value of the startpage as '0'. To collect the remaining records you must enter a new startpage until all the records are returned.

parameters.name: employeeId
parameters.description: return only records for the specified employee

parameters.name: enrollmentType
parameters.description: return only records from a specific enrollment type; if empty, all enrollment records are returned; allowed values: "BE" (Benefits Enrollment), "OE" (Open Enrollment), "AE" (Anytime Enrollment), "LE" (Life Event)

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: number of enrollment records returned per page (default: 5000)

get.description:
This operation returns a list of absence journals for a specific date range for a specific client. You can filter the response to a specific employee ID. The maximum date range will be a year (for example 2024-04-01 to 2025-03-31).Both the journalDateStart and journalDateEnd fields are required.

This operation also returns paginated results. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of absence journals.count specifies the number of absence journals to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the absence journal list. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of absence journals.

If the number of absence journals returned from the query is greater than 5000, you will be required to enter a count value of 5000 or under and a startpage.

parameters.name: employeeId
parameters.description: return only records for the specified employee

parameters.name: journalDateStart
parameters.description: absence journals date range starting date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: journalDateEnd
parameters.description: absence journals date range ending date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: number of absence journal records returned per page

get.description:
This method returns a client's Benefit Rules information. Benefit rules establish the conditions that a client's employees must satisfy to enroll in a benefit plan: group benefit plans, retirement plans, flexible spending, and so on. To retrieve a list of current client benefit groups, use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes and use BenefitGroup as the option.If you do not specify a groupPlanId, then the method returns benefit rule information for all groups and any employee benefit rule overrides. Note that, for an employee override, the employee ID populates the benefitGroupId field in the response.

By default the benefitRule array data will use the most recent rates <= todays date for all rules irrespective of the effective date of the rule. If useActualEffectiveDate is set to true then the billing and contribution rates will use rate data <= the rules effective date and be returned in the historicalRule array.

For future dated rules or billing rates we will return the future billing and contribution rate information for a rule with an effective date >= the future rate date.

In the case that there are only future dated rates in the system, we will use these rates for all benefit rules with an effective date <= the rate date.

parameters.name: groupPlanId
parameters.description: identifier for client's benefit group, or employee ID if the rule is an employee-specific override

parameters.name: planId
parameters.description: identifier for the group benefit plan

parameters.name: useActualEffectiveDate
parameters.description: when calculating contributions, whether to use the current effective date (false, default behavior) or the effective date of each individual benefit rule (true) which will be returned in the historicalRule array when there are rates subsequent to the effective date

get.summary: Get client benefit work flow grid
get.description:
Use this operation to retrieve the fields in the client benefit workflow grid. Depending on the input, this method can return data for workflows with specific start dates at the client level and/or the system level.

Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

This operation is used to retrieve client work flow grid data from PrismHR for use by external programs To use this API, provide a client ID(optional) and desired oe start/end date range(optional). This will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the compiled JSON data object may be retrieved.

The JSON object obtained at the URL in dataObject will have the following structure:

{
  "data": [
    {
      "clientWorkFlowGrid": [
        {
          "clientId": "string",
          "workflowEffDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
          "betWFId": "string",
          "beWFDesc": "string",
          "windowLength": "string"
          "oeWFId": "string"
          "oeWFDesc": "string"
          "anytimeWFId": "string"
          "anytimeWFDesc": "string"
          "oeStartDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
          "oeEndDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
          "minOverlapDays": "string"
          "endEffDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
          "enableNotifications": "string"
        }
      ],
      "systemWorkFlowGrid": [
        {
          "workflowEffDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
          "betWFId": "string",
          "beWFDesc": "string",
          "windowLength": "string"
          "oeWFId": "string"
          "oeWFDesc": "string"
          "anytimeWFId": "string"
          "anytimeWFDesc": "string"
          "oeStartDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
          "oeEndDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
          "minOverlapDays": "string"
          "endEffDate": "YYYY-MM-DD"
         }
       ]
    }
  ]
}

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: identifier used to check status of / download data

parameters.name: workflowLevel
parameters.description: workflow level: system-level (S), client-level (C), or both (B)

Use this operation to return monthly employee ACA data, as calculated by the system for the current year. This method does not return official Form 1095-C data.

Note that the coveredSsn and coveredDob fields contain Personally Identifiable Information and are masked by default. To unmask the values in this field, use the NOMASKSSN and NOMASKDOB permissions, respectively.

For definitions of these terms and information about ACA processing in general, please see the ACA User Guide.

In order to activate this data in Prism you need to run Rebuild ACA Data and add the following Custom Feature Code ACADATABUILD to System Parameters in Prism. Moving forward, the custom feature code will run a process which automatically builds the ACA data each month.

post.description:
The benefits/import401KData method uploads 401K import data, performs validations against the data, and then writes the new data to PrismHR. The response identifies those lines in the import data that did not pass validation, with error messages for each line. Rows that do pass validation are imported even if some rows contain errors.
This method can be called repeatedly, and overwrites the previous upload. This allows the client application to review the response, correct problems, and then upload the method again without duplicating records; note employees not included in subsequent uploads are not deleted.
The provider parameter determines which import utility is used. Currently, the only supported provider is Slavic 401K, so this operation defaults to that import utility if no provider is specified.
The allowedEmpStatusClasses is optional and allows the user to specify which employee status classes (active, terminated, and leave) will pass validation. For example, providing "AL" for allowedEmpStatusClasses will allow the import on employees with status classes of A (active) and L (leave). Omitting this parameter will default allowedEmpStatusClasses to A.
The 401K plan ID may be provided via the planId input parameter (if the entire import is for the same 401K plan) or in the comma separated import data. If no planId is provided in the input, then an error will be returned for each import line that does not contain a valid planId. if a planId is provided in the input, then this is the plan under which all import lines will be imported ignoring any plan ID data provided in the import data.
ProviderRequired Import DataExample Import Data
Slavic1. The client ID
2. The employee's social security number
3. Plan effective date (MM/DD/YY)
4. Plan deferral type (D - Pre-Tax, R - After Tax, N - Non-Elective)
5. Plan contribution type (1 - Flat Amount, 2 - Percent)
6. Flat amount (if contribution type = 1)
7. Percent (if contribution type = 2)
8. (Optional) Line item 401K plan ID
9. (Optional) Match Starts On Date (MM/DD/YY)
10.(Optional) Take Flat On Supplemental (valid values for "true": true, T, Y , 1. Valid values for "false": any other value, or empty.)
11. Unused
12. Catch-up override deferral type (D - Pre-Tax, R - After Tax) If used, you must also specify the contribution type and set the flat and percentage amounts.
13. Catch-up override contribution type (1 - Flat Amount, 2 - Percent).
14. Catch-up override flat amount (if catchup contribution type = 1).
15. Catch-up override percent (if catchup contribution type = 2).		000123,012345678,02/01/20,D,1,25,,401KPLANA
000123,123456789,02/01/20,D,2,,3,401KPLANB
123456,234567890,02/01/20,R,1,25,,401KPLANB
123456,345678901,02/01/20,R,2,,3,401KPLANA
123456,456789012,02/01/20,N,,,,401KPLANA,02/01/20,Y
123456,456789012,02/01/20,N,,,,401KPLANA,02/01/20,Y,,D,1,10,,
123456,456789012,02/01/20,N,,,,401KPLANA,02/01/20,Y,,R,2,,10

planId.description: 401K plan identifier; if not provided here, then should be provided with import data

loanPaymentCycle.description: loan payment cycle - (P)er pay period or (M)onthly

importData.description: text block containing the formatted 401K import data

allowedEmpStatusClasses.description: employee status classes to allow in the import. Options are: (A)ctive, (T)erminated, (L)eave, and (P)rismHR Settings. If P, the API allows any status classes listed in the eligibility settings of the client- or system-level retirement plan. If no status classes are listed in the retirement plan setup, then all classes are included in the import. P overrides any other value passed in this field. If this field is empty, the default value is (A)ctive.

get.description:
Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

This operation is used to generate and download a retirement census report. To use this API, provide a report format (Census, Participants, or Eligibility) and any other desired filter criteria. This will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the compiled CSV formatted report may be retrieved.

Note 1: Access to this API's report formats can be controlled using option-level access control. See the Option-level Access Control article in the API documentation for details.

Note 2: By default, this operation masks certain personally identifiable information (PII) in its response, such as employee social security number and date of birth. Please refer to the API documentation article Unmasking PII to learn how to unmask this data.

Note 3: The web service user client restrictions for this operation are handled differently from other PrismHR Services API operations. If the web service user has any client restrictions the user is required to provide a clientId up to 10 separated by commas.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: identifier used to check status of / download data

parameters.name: reportFormat
parameters.description: report format: Census, Participants, or Eligibility

parameters.name: planId
parameters.description: retirement plan identifier; enter a single retirement plan ID or ALL for all plans

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: pay date range starting date (formatted YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: pay date range ending date (formatted YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: includeLoans
parameters.description: Include retirement loan payments even if client no longer offers retirement plan (true/false)

post.summary: Create a new Prism client contact
post.description:
Use this endpoint to create a new contact for a client managed in the PrismHR product.

Note: This endpoint validates contact addresses against internal Geolocation codes. To enter a contact address, you must provide at least a ZIP code and a two-character state code. You can also provide a city name, but the endpoint will return an error if this does not match the internal city value for the GeoCode. To obtain a list of valid cities, states, and Geolocation codes for a particular ZIP, call ClientMasterService.getGeolocations.

If the provided ZIP and state correspond to multiple unique Geolocation codes, this endpoint returns an error stating that the Geolocation data was ambiguous. To resolve this error, obtain the correct GeoCode from getGeolocations and pass that value in the geolocationCode request attribute.

post.description:
Use this operation to set the E-Verify override flag for multiple worksite locations, such that any employees hired to that location do not go through the E-Verify process in spite of the client-level E-Verify setting. This is the equivalent of enabling the "Exclude this Location from E-Verification" option on the Worksite Locations form in PrismHR.

You can also call this method with the "UNFLAG" option if you want to disable this setting for the specified worksite locations.

This method returns a 400 HTTP response code if you only enter one locationId, or if none of the specified locations are recognized by the system. If certain entered locations are recognized and others are not, this is reflected in the "Success" and "Warn" messages returned by this method.

locationId.description: ID(s) of the worksite location(s) you want to flag for E-Verify override

option.description: if UNFLAG is entered then the method will set everify flag for any listed locations to false, otherwise it will set everify flag to true

get.summary: Get code tables for the specified client
get.description:
This method returns one or more code tables as arrays (lists) for the specified client. Within the Options string parameter, specify one or more of the option names in the table below. Note that the names are not case sensitive. Note that with shift codes, many of the data elements will be empty depending on whether the client is configured to use mileage mode or shift mode as configured in the Client Master/Detail parameters.

This operation also returns paginated results for the option Project. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of projects. count specifies the number of projects to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the project list. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of projects. We will be implementing pagination for other client code types in the future.

Note: This endpoint returns client-level codes by default. You can return system-level codes for certain options by prefixing the option name with SYSTEM. For example, SYSTEM.Status returns system-level status codes.

OptionOption for System-level CodesData Returned
BenefitGroup company benefits groups
COBRA COBRA qualifying events/reason codes
Deduction SYSTEM.Deduction deduction codes (company-specific unless system option is passed)
Department department codes
Division division codes
Ethnic ethnic codes
I9docs valid I-9 documents and citizenship status codes
Job job/position codes
Location (worksite) location codes
Pay SYSTEM.Pay pay codes (company-specific unless system option is passed)
PGroups client's pay groups
PositionClass job/position classes
ProjClass project class codes
Project project records, including checksum for updates (does not include certified payroll details)
Reason SYSTEM.Reason H/R action reason codes
Relation relation codes
RetirementPlan retirement plan(s)
Shift shift codes
Skill skill codes
Status SYSTEM.Status employee status codes
Type SYSTEM.Type employee type codes
Union union codes
Workgroup employee work groups

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: single string containing one or more of the options mentioned in notes section

parameters.description: use to exclude obsolete codes. Flag only applies for BenefitGroup, Deduction, Department, Division, Job, Location, Pay, Project, Reason, Relation, Status, Type , Work group options

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: number of codes returned per page (currently only available for Project option)

parameters.name: startpage
parameters.description: pagination start location (first page = '0') (currently only applies for Project option)

get.description: This operation returns a list of all retirement benefit plans set up under the Benefits tab on the Client Details form in PrismHR for all or up to 10 selected clients. This operation also returns paginated results. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of retirement benefit plans. count specifies the number of clients to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the client list. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of clients. If the number of clients returned from the query is greater than 5000, you will be required to enter a count value of 5000 or under and a startpage. Note: The web service user client restrictions for this operation are handled differently from other PrismHR Services API operations. If the web service user has any client restrictions the user is required to provide a clientId up to 10 separated by commas. If there are no client restrictions then clientId can be passed as ALL to return all active clients or client cancelling (status C or A). If you have access to all clients, pass ALL to get a list of all retirement benefit plans for all active clients or client cancelling (status C or A) or provide one or more clientIds (up to 10) separated by commas. If some of the clients are passed for which you do not have access, then the retirement benefit plans for those restricted clients will not be returned. If you do not have access to all the clients passed, then you will receive an HTTP Response Code 403 with an infoMessage stating Company clientId is not allowed and data has not been returned for the company. If an invalid clientId is passed, then you will receive an errorMessage stating Company Id clientId not found.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: client identifier; if the web service user has no client restrictions, enter ALL to return this information for all clients

get.description:
This operation returns information about client-level and (if allowed) employer-level state unemployment tax rates (SUTA rates). You can enter "ALLCLIENTS" or "ALLEMPLOYERS" to return SUTA rates for all entities.

Enter an effectiveDate to return SUTA rates effective on that date. Otherwise, provide a fromDate, which returns SUTA rates that are effective on or after that date.

Note: This endpoint has option-level security applied to the employerId field. To use this field, in the Allowed Methods grid for the web service user, enter ClientMasterService.getSutaRates#EMPLOYER. For more details, see the Option-level Access Control article on the API documentation website.

This operation also returns paginated results when the total of client and employer SUTA records exceeds 500. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of SUTA rates. count specifies the number of SUTA rates to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the SUTA rates list. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of SUTA rates.

Certain states have additional state-specific taxes. These rates are set in the stateMiscRate fields (1, 2, and 3). State-specific employee-paid tax rates are set in the stateMiscEmpRate2 and stateMiscEmpRate3 fields. See the online PrismHR documentation for up-to-date details about these fields.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: client identifier; required if employerId is empty; enter a client ID or enter "ALLCLIENTS" to return SUTA rates for all clients

parameters.name: employerId
parameters.description: employer identifier; web service users client access must include clients of this employer; this field is restricted by option-level access control (see implementation note); enter an employer ID or enter "ALLEMPLOYERS" to return SUTA rates for all employers

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: enter a date (format: YYYY-MM-DD) to return only SUTA rates with that effective date

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: required if effectiveDate is empty; enter a date (format: YYYY-MM-DD) to return SUTA rates that are effective on or after that date

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: enter a state code to return SUTA rate information for that state, or enter "ALLSTATES"

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: number of SUTA rates returned per page

post.description:
Use this method to create or update a benefit group for a client company. Clients use benefit groups when they need to define different benefits for different employees, such as setting up benefits for most employees and different benefits for executives. When updating an existing benefit group, this method requires a checksum attribute, which is used to avoid a conflict with other transactions that might be in flight. To obtain the checksum, call the ClientMasterService.getBenefitGroups operation. When creating a new benefit group, pass an empty string for the checksum.

This API requires that all data retrieved from the corresponding get operation be supplied in the request object along with the provided checksum. Any omitted data will be deleted from the database. The checksum is used to ensure that the data retrieved from the database is up-to-date when writing the updates back to the record.

post.description:
The operation creates a new worksite location.

Note 1: Certain messages related to the creation or update of a worksite location may be returned in the updateClientResult.updateMessages array. These messages will have a corresponding errorType of either ERROR, WARNING, or ADDRESS_MISMATCH. The worksite location can be assumed created/updated unless "errorCode" is non-zero.

Note 2: ClientMasterService.setClientLocationDetails support Symmetry geocodes and address lookup. This feature can be enabled by setting the useSymmetry flag in the input object to true. If the street address provided in the input does not match the address obtained from Symmetry, the following object will be returned in the updateClientResult.updateMessages array:

{
  "errorType": "ADDRESS_MISMATCH",
  "errorString": "123 Fake St Apt 123"
}

The worksite location may be updated to use the Symmetry address by calling ClientMasterService.setClientLocationDetails with the address provided.

post.description:
Use this operation to update individual client fields without the requirement of providing a checksum. The API will ignore any fields excluded from the input, as well as any fields set to null.
The operation returns a checksum for the client master record updated.

Note: If you pass a value in the invoiceNotes request field, include all existing invoice notes unless you want to delete them. Any notes omitted from the request will be deleted.

Security

This operation supports field-level security: for any web service user, you can grant or deny access to a subset of the supported client fields.

To set up these access settings, use the Allowed Methods grid on the Web Service Users form in PrismHR. Create a new row and add the name of this method. Then, to grant access to certain fields, append # or #GRANT, followed by a list of the accessible fields. Separate each field name with a pipe symbol. (|). The web service user will have access to only these fields.

If you want to deny access to certain fields instead, append #DENY and a list of fields as described previously. The web service user will have access to any fields not specified in the list.

Example grant access:

ClientMasterService.updateClientMasterFields#GRANT|serviceType|costCenter
ClientMasterService.updateClientMasterFields#|serviceType|costCenter

Example deny access:

ClientMasterService.updateClientMasterFields#DENY|serviceType|costCenter

requestBody.description: object containing the record to update client master fields

post.description:
Use this endpoint to update the information for an existing contact at a specific client managed in PrismHR. A checksum is required to avoid a conflict with other transactions that might be in flight. To obtain the checksum, call the ClientMasterService.getAllPrismClientContacts or ClientMasterService.getPrismClientContact endpoints.

This endpoint requires that all data retrieved from the corresponding get operation be supplied in the request object along with the provided checksum. Any omitted data will be deleted from the database. The checksum is used to ensure that the data retrieved from the database is up-to-date when writing the updates back to the record.

Note: This endpoint validates contact addresses against internal Geolocation codes. To enter a contact address, you must provide at least a ZIP code and a two-character state code. You can also provide a city name, but the endpoint will return an error if this does not match the internal city value for the GeoCode. To obtain a list of valid cities, states, and Geolocation codes for a particular ZIP, call ClientMasterService.getGeolocations.

If the provided ZIP and state correspond to multiple unique Geolocation codes, this endpoint returns an error stating that the Geolocation data was ambiguous. To resolve this error, obtain the correct GeoCode from getGeolocations and pass that value in the geolocationCode request attribute.

get.description:
This operation returns client state unemployment tax (SUTA) billing rate information. Provide a fromDate to return all rates for a particular client and state from that date onward.

To return data for a specific date or location code, provide a value for effectiveDate or location.

Note: You cannot provide values for both effectiveDate and fromDate at the same time.

This operation returns paginated results. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of billing rates. count specifies the number of billing rates to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the billing rate list. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of billing rates.

parameters.name: stateCode
parameters.description: two-character state identifier; enter ALLSTATES to return billing rates for all states

parameters.name: locationCode
parameters.description: optional identifier for a specific location within the state; enter ALL to return billing rates for all locations

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: specify a date when the SUTA billing rate goes into effect (format: YYYY-MM-DD) to return only billing rates for that date; to use this field, fromDate must be empty

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: specify a date in YYYY-MM-DD format to return all billing rates from that date onward; to use this field, effectiveDate must be empty

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: number of billing rates returned per page

get.summary: Get user-defined fields for the specified field type
get.description:
Use this operation to retrieve user-defined fields from any part of the system where they exist. Use the **fieldType** input parameter to specify which type of user-defined fields you want to return (for example, enter Divisions if you want to return user-defined fields associated with a specific division).
The fieldType parameter accepts the following values:
* GroupBenefitPlans (Benefit Groups)
* ClientDetails
* DeliveryMethods
* EmployeeDependents (typeId = employeeId.dependentId)
* Departments
* Divisions
* RetirementPlanEnrollment
* EmployeeBenefitsEnrollment (typeId = employeeId.benefitplanId)
* EmployeeDetails
* Positions
* WorksiteLocations
* OshaCases
* Projects
* PayGrades
* Shifts
* LaborUnions
* WorkersCompensationCases

In the **typeId** parameter, enter the appropriate, corresponding entity ID (for example, if you entered Division in your fieldType parameter, enter a Division ID for the specific division entity you want to query). The operation will return any user-defined field data for that entity.

parameters.name: fieldType
parameters.description: type of user-defined fields you want to return (see the implementation notes for details)

parameters.name: typeId
parameters.description: list of type identifiers (for example, department or worksite location IDs) associated with the fieldType. A maximum of 20 typeId values can be entered to retrieve user defined fields except ClientDetails which only allows one at a time.

post.summary: Set user-defined fields for the specified field type
post.description:
Use this operation to update any user-defined field for any entity in PrismHR. You must provide the checksum value returned by the getUserDefinedFields operation.
Use the **fieldType** input parameter to specify which type of user-defined fields you want to update (for example, enter Divisions if you want to update user-defined fields associated with a specific division).
The fieldType parameter accepts the following values:
* GroupBenefitPlans (Benefit Groups)
* ClientDetails
* DeliveryMethods
* EmployeeDependents (typeId = employeeId.dependentId)
* Departments
* Divisions
* RetirementPlanEnrollment
* EmployeeBenefitsEnrollment (typeId = employeeId.benefitplanId)
* EmployeeDetails
* Positions
* WorksiteLocations
* OshaCases
* Projects
* PayGrades
* Shifts
* LaborUnions
* WorkersCompensationCases

In the **typeId** parameter, enter the appropriate, corresponding entity ID (for example, enter a Division ID for the specific division entity you want to update).

requestBody.description: object containing list of user-defined field values to update

get.description: This service manages what can most easily be described as the "rules" for employee payroll deductions, rather than precise values (which must be determined by looking at payroll vouchers after payroll is completed). There are three groups of deductions. Voluntary deductions, such as uniforms or movie tickets, are fixed amounts or percentages. These are added immediately to the deductions file when they are added to the system. The first group of non-voluntary deductions, such as garnishments and loans, are immediately added by the respective modules in PrismHR. The final group of deductions are those for enrolled benefit plans. The process for computing these is more complex, and it is not added to deductions immediately when the enrollment changes or benefits plan is altered. Instead, the deductions are updated at the time the organization processes payroll.

parameters.description: the employee ID used to retrieve the deductions

Use this operation to download an employee's 1095C form for the provided year or to batch download a range of employee's 1095Cs. Provide only one employee ID to download a 1095C for a single employee, provide two employee IDs to download 1095Cs for all employees of the provided client within the given range (e.g. providing clientId 123 and employeeIds A00000 and Z99999 will provide all 1095Cs for all employees of client 123).

get.summary: Get employee(s) information by employee ID
get.description:
This operation retrieves between 1 and 20 employees using the specified employee IDs. If the Options parameter is unspecified, the operation will return only the employee data attributes that fall into the Person class. The table lists all of the options.

This operation masks certain PII in its response by default, such as employee social security number and date of birth. Please refer to the API documentation article Unmasking PII for instructions on unmasking this data.

This operation also supports option-level security, including the ability to remove pay rate information from the Compensation and Client option (NOPAYRATE) or to limit what options are allowed by the specific API user. See the article on Securing Access to Pay Data in our API documentation at https://api-docs.prismhr.com . Please Note that the "Disable Method Restrictions" flag will override all method- and option-level restrictions defined in the Web Service User Allowed Methods table . Any unmasking or masking options, however, will still be applied.
Option Description
Personattributes that are not client specific such as marital status
Clientattributes that are specific to the employing client, such as hire date, job code, work email address, and benefits email address
Compensationclient-specific attributes such as pay rate, tax information
DirectDepositclient-specific direct deposit (ACH) transfer attributes
EmployeeEventsclient-specific events such as user conferences
Healthclient-specific health related attributes such as drug tests, exams
Skillsclient-specific skills and education and certification related attributes
AbsenceJournalabsence journal IDs; use with BenefitService.getAbsenceJournal to retrieve details
BenefitEnrollStatuswhether the employee has completed the benefit enrollment
ScheduledDeductionsone-time or temporary deductions for the employee; does not include standard deductions or garnishments
NewHireQuestionsnew-hire questions related attributes
EnrollmentInprogresswhether the enrollment for employee is in progress
ContactInformationattributes that are not client specific such as home address, and personal email address
HSAdirect deposit (ACH) attributes related to health savings account (HSA) deferrals

parameters.description: a string containing zero or more of the keywords in the options table

get.description:
This operation retrieves an array of historical events for an employee: pay rate changes, job/position changes, leave of absence, status changes, and employment termination.

You can also use the type option to return the history of any changes made using EmployeeService.updateFutureAssignment, or through PrismHR forms like HR|Action|Department Change and HR|Action|Location Change.

Please note that entity history data is associated with the PrismHR features mentioned above, which can update future entity assignments for employees. Because of this relationship, the history only extends back to June 2019 (when these features were released) and only includes changes that were made using these features.

This endpoint supports option level security for type. Please refer to the API documentation article Option-Level Access Control for information about applying option level security. The Disable Method Restrictions" flag will override all method- and option-level restrictions defined in the Web Service User Allowed Methods table.

post.description:
Use this operation to rehire an employee. If you are rehiring this employee for a client managed in PrismHR, you must also have a PrismHR user account with the exact same user ID as your web services user account. See Using the API > Setting Up PrismHR and Web Services User Accounts in the documentation.

Note 1: If the onboarding flag is set to true, and once the onboarding process has started, changes to the employee's data are not allowed. Therefore, all changes to the employee's information should be done prior to calling or during the call to rehireEmployee. The onboarding flag will have no effect if the client is not setup to use nextgen onboarding.

Note 2: The following properties may be omitted from the request or set to null (not "null", which would be interpreted as a string) without affecting their corresponding database values: personalEmail, workEmail, mobilePhone, location, position, benefitGroup, retirementBenefitGroup, division, department, shift, project, workGroup, unionCode, reportsTo, payGroup, payMethod, payRate, payRateBasis, and standardHours. Many of these properties which are not required in the system may be cleared by providing an empty string ("").

post.description:
The EmployeeService.setI9Data method updates an employee's form I-9 information. Note that a checksum attribute is required and is used to avoid a conflict with other transactions that may be in flight. To obtain the checksum, call the EmployeeService.getI9Data method. The I9Filed flag when set to "true", indicates that the employee's I-9 form has been filed. However, this value may not be set from "true" to "false" using the API. When the I9Filed flag is "true," section 1 of the form I-9 can no longer be updated unless the overrideI9FiledFlag is set to true. The phrI9Version and phrFromOB parameters also cannot be updated using the API.
I9 document codes and document issuing authority codes may be found by calling ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the I9Docs option. For certain I9 documents that do not have any issuing authorities specified, either provide "N/A" as the code or omit the phrIssuingAuthorityCode parameter; in either case the API will save "N/A" to the database as the issuing authority code.

This API requires that all data retrieved from the corresponding get operation be supplied in the request object along with the provided checksum. Any omitted data will be deleted from the database. The checksum is used to ensure that the data retrieved from the database is up-to-date when writing the updates back to the record.

The terminateEmployee operation also fires the validateEmployeeTerminate operation to check for fatal errors; see validateEmployeeTerminate for a list of error messages that operation might return and stop the termination. It does not prevent the termination if there are only warnings, however, even if those issues might cause problems later. It is strongly recommended that you use validateEmployeeTerminate before terminateEmployee to check for warnings and resolve any possible issues, such as outstanding garnishments.

This operation updates employee address information. Note that a checksum attribute is required, which is used to avoid a conflict with other transactions that might be in flight. To obtain the checksum, call the EmployeeService.getAddressInfo operation. Important note: If the zipCode, city, or county has changed for the home address, the API will attempt to adjust the GeoCode automatically; however, if there is a conflict or ambiguity in the geo location information, then an error will be returned. Refer to 'clientMaster/getGeoLocations' for a list of possible GeoCodes and repeat the API request providing the 'homeGeoCode' attribute to update employee address.

This API requires that all data retrieved from the corresponding get operation be supplied in the request object along with the provided checksum. Any omitted data will be deleted from the database. The checksum is used to ensure that the data retrieved from the database is up-to-date when writing the updates back to the record.

requestBody.description: object containing the properties to update address information

post.description:
This operation updates direct deposit account information for checking and savings accounts as well as pay cards. This will not modify other ACH types such as FSA (flexible spending accounts). Changes to those other direct deposit settings must be made in the PrismHR product. Note that pay card accounts must be specially configured (in either product) as a pay card in Bank Routing and then set up as a checking account.
The updateDirectDeposit operation replaces the entire record, specifically checking and saving account information, therefore you must ensure that you include any existing accounts that are not changing as well as any new accounts. Pay cards cannot be deleted using updateDirectDeposit, only marked inactive. You will not be able to change a direct deposit account to active if there are existing active line items for the account. Please contact your administrator if you want to make it active. Also, a checksum attribute is required, to avoid a conflict with other transactions that might be in flight. To obtain the existing direct deposit record (achVoucher) and the directDepositChecksum, call the EmployeeService.getEmployee operation with the DirectDeposit option.

requestBody.description: object containing the properties to update ACH account information

post.description:
Use this operation to update individual employee fields without the requirement of providing a checksum. The API will ignore any fields excluded from the input, as well as any fields set to null. Sub-Objects like vehicleDetails, autoPolicy and localTax must include all fields and their values when updating any field within that object.

The operation returns checksums for any employee record files that were updated. For example, it returns a compensationChecksum value for any changes to fields in the Employee Pay record.

Security

This operation supports field-level security: for any web service user, you can grant or deny access to a subset of the supported employee fields.

To set up these access settings, use the Allowed Methods grid on the Web Service Users form in PrismHR. Create a new row and add the name of this method. Then, to grant access to certain fields, append # or #GRANT, followed by a list of the accessible fields. Separate each field name with a pipe symbol. (|). The web service user will have access to only these fields.

If you want to deny access to certain fields instead, append #DENY and a list of fields as described previously. The web service user will have access to any fields not specified in the list.

Example grant access:

EmployeeService.updateEmployeeFields#GRANT|firstName|lastName
EmployeeService.updateEmployeeFields#firstName|lastName

Example deny access:

EmployeeService.updateEmployeeFields#DENY|firstName|lastName

Warning: Sub-Objects like vehicleDetails, autoPolicy, property and localTax must include all fields and their values when updating any field within that object. If all fields and arrays within the sub-object are not included then those values will be removed from the record.

requestBody.description: object containing the properties to update employee's fields

post.description: Use this method to change an employee's employment status or type. Statuses indicate whether the employee is active, on leave, or terminated. Types indicate things such as full- or part-time employment. This requires that the user has a PrismHR user account; see Set Up a PrismHR Web Services User Account in the documenation. The updateEmployeeStatusType operation also fires the validateEmployeeStatusType operation, which first makes sure there are no issues; see validateEmployeeStatusType for a list of error messages that operation might return. If there are no issues, the employee's employment status and/or type at the specified client is changed. It does not prevent the change if there are only warnings, however, even if those issues might cause problems later. It is strongly recommended that you use validateEmployeeStatusType before updateEmployeeStatusType to check for warnings and resolve any possible issues.

requestBody.description: object containing the properties to validate employee status/type change

Use this method to update one or more of an employee's scheduled deductions. These are one-time or temporary deductions and do not include standard deductions or garnishments. 
The updateScheduledDeduction operation replaces the entire record, therefore you must ensure that you include any existing scheduled deductions that are not changing along with the new deductions. The checksum required to update an employee's scheduled deductions, along with the list of existing scheduled deductions, may be obtained by calling employee/getScheduledDeductions. post.description:
This operation updates employee address information. Note that a checksum attribute is required, which is used to avoid a conflict with other transactions that might be in flight. To obtain the checksum, call the EmployeeService.getAddressInfo operation.

Important note: If the zipCode, city, or county has changed for the home address and the API can determine a single matching geolocation code, it will update the geolocation code automatically. The endpoint will return an update message with a warning regarding any other address details that were changed as part of the geolocation match. If multiple geolocation options exist for the provided address, this endpoint returns an error and populates address suggestions that meet the provided criteria in the matchingValues array. In this case, update your request with the appropriate address details and call the endpoint again. If no geolocation matches exist, the endpoint will update the address information as provided in the request and will return a warning message similar to the one described above.

This API requires that all data retrieved from the corresponding get operation be supplied in the request object along with the provided checksum. Any omitted data will be deleted from the database. The checksum is used to ensure that the data retrieved from the database is up-to-date when writing the updates back to the record.

get.description:
This operation retrieves a list of outstanding invoices across multiple clients. To retrieve outstanding invoices for a specific client, call GeneralLedgerService.getOustandingInvoices.

Note: If the web service user has client restrictions, the clientId is required. You can pass up to ten client IDs per call.

The first call will initialize data retrieval; the endpoint responds with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls should be formatted exactly as the initial call, plus the downloadId returned by the initial call. The returned status will be "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the data can be retrieved.

Note: Web service users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this endpoint. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this endpoint again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

Note: To grant access to this endpoint, you must explicitly list it in the Allowed Methods grid for each web service user (the Disable Method Restrictions option is ignored).

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: identifier used to check status of / download data

parameters.name: showOnlyDepositMatch
parameters.description: enter a deposit value for the system to match; the endpoint returns the invoice with a balance that matches this value, if it exists

get.description:
Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

This operation is used to retrieve PEO client accounting data from PrismHR for use by external programs. To use this API, provide a client ID and either a pay date or post date range (you cannot use both filters). To retrieve all data on or before a specific date, enter an end date and leave the start date empty. To retrieve all data on or after a specific date, enter a start date and leave the end date empty.

This API will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the compiled JSON data object may be retrieved.

The JSON object obtained at the URL in dataObject will have the following structure:

{
  "clientId": "string",
  "startDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "endDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "data": [
    {
      "payDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
      "batchId": "string",
      "onlineVoucherNo": "string",
      "annotation": "string",
      "period": "string",
      "consolidated": "string",
      "consolJrnlId": "string",
      "postFlag": "string",
      "batchJrnlIds": [
        "string"
      ],
      "glDivision": "string",
      "dosFilename": "string",
      "postDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
      "postTime": "HH:MM:SS",
      "editDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
      "editUserId": "string",
      "periodEndDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
      "detailAnnotation": [
        "string"
      ],
      "sumDebitAmt": "string",
      "sumCreditAmt": "string",
      "glInfo": [
        {
          "glAccountNumber": "string",
          "debitAmount": "string",
          "creditAmount": "string",
          "hoursWorked": "string",
          "hoursUnitsPaid": "string"
        }
      ],
      "id": "string",
      "clientId": "string",
      "journalId": "string",
      "invoiceNo": "string"
    }
  ]
}

This operation is used to generate and download an accounting G/L detail report. To use this API, provide a payroll batch ID or payroll date range and any other desired filter criteria. This will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the compiled CSV formatted report may be retrieved.

Please note: The web service user method and client restrictions for this operation are handled differently from other PrismHR Services API operations. Web service users need to be given explicit access to this API in the Allowed Methods list and they cannot have any client restrictions (similar to SystemService operations).

get.description:
Use this operation to retrieve G/L data about cash receipts that are still pending (not yet paid). You can retrieve data about a specific batch, or set the cashReceiptBatchId to "ALL" to return all pending cash receipts. If desired, you can also include G/L post and deposit information for the batch; this data can still be returned even when no pending cash receipts exist.
Note: Web service users cannot call this endpoint if they have any client access restrictions. In addition, to call this endpoint, a web service user must have it listed in their Allowed Methods.
This operation returns paginated results. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of receipts. count specifies the number of receipts to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the cash receipt list. The operation returns these parameters in the response object as well, along with the total number of cash receipts.

get.description:
Use this operation to download a JSON object summary of onboarding tasks for clients.

You can also filter the results by clientList (comma separated client ids), task, or fromDate.

Note 1: For information about properly using this operation to keep third-party application data synchronized, please see the getData Best Practices documentation.

Note 2: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of 'DONE', retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

To use this API, provide a valid session token and any desired filter criteria. This will initialize the data retrieval and the API will respond with 'buildStatus': 'INIT'. Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either 'buildStatus': 'BUILD', 'buildStatus': 'ERROR', or 'buildStatus': 'DONE'. If buildStatus is DONE, then 'dataObject' will contain the URL where the compiled JSON data object may be retrieved.

If there are client restrictions on the web service user, at least one clientId must be passed in the clientList field. Up to 10 client IDs may be passed at a time, separated by commas. If no clientList is entered and no client restrictions exist for the web service user, only data from active clients will be returned.

The JSON object obtained at the URL in dataObject will have the following structure:

{
  "clientId": "string",
  "task": "string",
  "prehireId": "string",
  "newHireName": "string",
  "performer": "string",
  "dueDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "submitDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "workflowDueDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "workflowCompleteDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "status": "string",
  "forms": [
    {
      "formId": "string",
      "formName": "string",
      "formDueDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
      "formCompleteDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
    }
  ]
}

parameters.description: used to check status of and eventually download the onboard tasks data

parameters.name: clientList
parameters.description: comma separated list of client ids

parameters.description: only return tasks from the date entered to the current date

parameters.description: only return tasks for the task id. Valid task ids are 1 -> I9 section 1, 2 -> Employee information, 3 -> I9 Section 2 or 4 -> All other forms

post.summary: assign pending approvals from one PrismHR user to another
post.description:
This API operation reassigns pending approvals from one PrismHR user to another. Pending approvals may be obtained by calling HumanResourcesService.getAssignedPendingApprovals. All valid approval IDs provided will be assigned from the fromUser provided to the toUser. If any invalid approval IDs are provided, an error message and error code will be provided for the applicable approval ID in the updateResult array. Error codes are defined in the following table.
Error codeDescription
0 Approval record successfully reassigned.
NOT_FOUND Approval ID not found.
NOT_ASSIGNED Approval is not currently assigned to any user.
WRONG_ASSIGNED Approval is not currently assigned to the provided fromUser.
RECORD_LOCKED Approval record is currently locked by another user and cannot be updated.
UNKNOWN_ERROR An unknown server error occurred which prevented this approval record from being updated.

fromUser.description: the PrismHR user currently assigned approval(s)

toUser.description: the PrismHR user to which approval(s) should be assigned

post.summary: Import a batch of employee records
post.description:
The PrismHR API employee import is a file-based utility similar to the PrismHR expanded employee Import.
Please note that the "errorCode" parameter will only be non-zero if there is a problem with the entire employee import operation. If there are errors pertaining to an individual employee in the import, the "validFlag" parameter in the "importedHire" array for that employee will be set to false. It is possible that all employees in the import might have errors, in which case the "validFlag" for each employee would be false, but the "errorCode" would still be zero. Detailed error and/or warning messages pertaining to imported employees will appear in the "importError" array.
This service has one important usage restriction: you can only have one import "batch" within each API session. If you need to perform concurrent new hire imports, you must use the LoginService to create a unique session for each concurrent thread. The reason for this is so that the API can isolate the batch to which the operations will apply. 
After you successfully import the new hire(s), you must commit the batch to add the employees to the database using NewHireService.commitEmployees. Please note that the required fields in the schema indicate only the minimum required fields. The service provider or client might have additional required fields set up in the system. Use the NewHireService.getNewHireRequiredFields method to retrieve a list of the fields required to hire new employees.

requestBody.description: an array of new hire employee objects

post.summary: Import a batch allowing a cross hire
post.description:
The PrismHR API employee import is a file-based utility similar to the PrismHR expanded employee Import.The NewHireService.importEmployeesAllowingCrossHire operation is very similar to the importEmployees operation, with the additional option to hire an existing employee into an additional company. Your organization should consider restricting its use, instead of using it in place of the importEmployees operation. 
 | Note: It is recommended that you restrict the use to service providers only. Typically, client companies would not import employees using this method because service providers must ensure the security and privacy of employees' data. A possible exception is when service providers decide to allow their franchise clients to enter cross-hires because those clients already have legitimate access to the employee information. | 
 The key to the importEmployeesAllowingCrossHire operation is the crossCompanyEid parameter in the NewHireEmployee object, which you use to confirm to the system that you know the employee record already exists. This parameter is required; if you try to hire the existing employee into the company without this parameter, the system rejects it because it does not allow two employee records that use the same Social Security number. 
 Please note that the required fields in the schema indicate only the minimum required fields. The service provider or client might have additional required fields set up in the system. Use the NewHireService.getNewHireRequiredFields method to retrieve a list of the fields required to hire new employees. 
 After you successfully import the new hire(s), you must commit the batch to add the employees to the database using NewHireService.commitEmployees.

post.description:
The PayrollService.calculateManualCheck operation calculates the taxes for the provided manual check, generates a voucher that the system includes in the client's next payroll batch, and returns the calculated check amounts. The payroll registers are updated when the payroll processor posts the batch. If calculationOnly is set to false, the check will not be saved to the payroll system. To delete a manual check prior to payroll batch processing, use the PayrollService.deleteManualCheck API operation; once manual checks have been initialized in a batch, they may not be deleted.
Note about calculationOnly parameter: It is recommended that this operation be called with calculationOnly set to true and then, once the calculation results have been verified, called again with calculationOnly set to false in order to save the manual check.
Note about payCodes parameter: If only the hoursUnitsPaid field is set, hoursWorked and payAmount will be calculated automatically. If these parameters are provided, the provided values will override the calculated values.
Note about optionalTaxCalculationOverrides parameter: This array allows the calculated payroll taxes to be overridden with the provided static values. The check created will include only those payroll taxes provided in this array and will not include any calculated taxes.

post.summary: Calculate gross payment amount for a target net check amount
post.description:
Please note that this API operation requires Prism and will not work in HRP.
The PayrollService.calculateNetToGross method computes the gross amount that, after taxes and deductions, results in the amount of the check specified in targetNetPay. You can review the Batch Payment record for this employee and then write to batch by setting writeBatch to true. This updates the batch payments record.
Note: the batch record associated with this payment should still be in Time Sheet Entry mode. If the batch has been initialized, it must be initialized again to retrieve this payment.

payDate.description: pay date for the check issue date in YYYY-MM-DD format. This must be after the last processed payroll batch pay date. If this payment should be attached to a batch (such as an Other Payments Batch), enter the pay date of the batch.

voucherType.description: voucher type. Valid values are R (Regular), V (Vacation), S (Supplemental)

payPeriod.description: pay period that applies to the payment. The system calculates taxes based on the pay period. Valid values are W (Weekly), B (Biweekly), S (Semi-monthly), M (Monthly), Q (Quarterly), A (Annually)

deductPeriod.description: indicates the deduction period that the system should use for calculating standard deductions, benefits, and garnishments. Valid values are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Select zero (0) if you do not want to include deductions in the calculation.

workShift.description: work shift. See clientMaster/getClientCodes with the Shift option for a full list of valid work shift codes.

estPeriodsRemaining.description: the number of benefits deduction periods remaining; if not provided, the system will calculate the value based on the next scheduled regular batch

payCode.description: pay code that applies to the selected voucher type

payrollNumber.description: payroll number. Defaults to the next regularly scheduled payroll batch for the selected employee.

writeBatch.description: when set to false, this allows you to initially review the report details. To write this payment to the batch, run the method again with writeBatch set to true.

get.description:
This operation will return the current status of a payroll batch initialization. This operation should be called repeatedly following a call to /payroll/initializePrismBatch in order to retrieve the updated status until batch initialization is complete; the 'initStatus' field will be either 'UNINITIALIZED,' 'PROCESSING,' or 'COMPLETE.' Any errors or warnings generated during payroll batch initialization are provided in the 'errorDetail' and 'warning' arrays.
The following are internal payroll initialization statuses that may be returned by this operation. Note that this is not a complete list of payroll batch statuses but rather a list of payroll batch initialization statuses.
Status Code Description
INITOK Payroll calculation in progress or completed (check progress field).
INITWARN Payroll calculation completed with warning(s).
INITFAIL Payroll calculation completed with error(s).
AP.PEND Payroll calculation completed and pending approval.
INITCOMP Payroll calculation completed and client approval step not required.

get.summary: Get bulk year to date values
get.description:
Use this operation to download a JSON object summary of year-to-date values for different payroll variables, such as total deductions or total hours worked.

You can also filter the results by client, employee, or a particular 'as of' date. If you submit a value in the voucherId input parameter, any value in the asOfDate parameter will be ignored. In addition, please note that this method only returns year-to-date data for up to one year, starting from January first of the current year or the year provided in asOfDate.

Note 1: For information about properly using this operation to keep third-party application data synchronized, please see the getData Best Practices documentation.

Note 2: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of 'DONE', retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

To use this API, provide a valid session token and any desired filter criteria. This will initialize the data retrieval and the API will respond with 'buildStatus': 'INIT'. Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either 'buildStatus': 'BUILD', 'buildStatus': 'ERROR', or 'buildStatus': 'DONE'. If buildStatus is DONE, then 'dataObject' will contain the URL where the compiled JSON data object may be retrieved.

Please note: The web service user method and client restrictions for this operation are handled differently from other PrismHR Services API operations. Web service users need to be given explicit access to this API in the Allowed Methods list and they cannot have any client restrictions (similar to SystemService operations).

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: used to check status of and eventually download the compiled YTD data

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: return results for only this client

parameters.name: employeeId
parameters.description: return results for only this employee

parameters.name: voucherId
parameters.description: return results for only this voucher

parameters.name: asOfDate
parameters.description: the method will return year-to-date payroll data starting from January first of the year provided and ending in this date. This value is ignored if you enter a voucherId

post.description:
Use this operation to generate the Payroll Allocation Report for download as a CSV file. This report details payroll costs distributed across multiple cost centers, which you can specify in the sort parameters. You must provide a client ID and either a payroll number or a date range.

The sort parameters (primarySort, secondarySort, and tertiarySort) define how the report data is structured. If you use multiple sort parameters, they must all be unique. The Boolean options can further refine the output.

Note: This operation does not use any report parameters configured in the PrismHR UI. All report parameters must be passed in the API call.

To use this operation, you must have an existing PrismHR user account with the same User ID as your Web Service User. For more information, please see Using the API > PrismHR and Web Service Users on the API documentation site.

Calling this API will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". get.description: This operation returns a list of completed payroll batches for a given client, for the specified batch types and calendar year. It can also return details of a specified payroll batch broken out by an employee, which is the default option, or by pay code, position, department, location, division, shift, or project. To retrieve a specific breakout of a payroll batch data: pass a batchId, set includeDetails to true and specify the appropriate sort value.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: calendar year (YYYY). Must be an existing year not greater than the current year and will default to the current year if no value is passed. Required if no batchId is passed. If both year and batchId are passed, the year value will be ignored

parameters.name: batchType
parameters.description: one or more type of payroll batches separated by a comma to return: A=All Types is the default option; R=Scheduled; S=Special; J=Adjustment; V=Reversal; M=Manual. If you pass A then you cannot pass any of the other values

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: valid payroll batch identifier for the selected client. If both year and batchId are passed, the year value will be ignored

parameters.name: includeDetails
parameters.description: can only be true if a batchId is passed. true will return the details of all the payroll vouchers for the given batchId in conjunction with sort. false will return only the payroll history

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: specify the sort details to return for the list of payroll vouchers for the given batchId. You can only use this parameter if includeDetails is set to true. Only one of the following values is allowed: PAYCODE, POSITION, DEPT, LOC, DIV, SHIFT, PROJ and EMPLOYEE (default value)

get.summary: Get a payroll voucher for clientId and voucherId
get.description:
This operation returns an employee payroll voucher for the specified client and voucher. Employee vouchers display details of the employee's earnings, deductions, taxes, and so on.

By default, this operation masks certain personally identifiable information (PII) in its response, such as direct deposit account numbers. Please refer to the API documentation article Unmasking PII to learn how to unmask this data.

Note for prismhr-api and API 1.30: To exclude directDeposit from the response, append #NODIRECTDEPOSIT to this endpoint in the Allowed Methods for your web service user. Example: PayrollService.getPayrollVoucherById#NODIRECTDEPOSIT.

Please Note (prismhr-api only) In prismhr-api, this operation also supports option-level security, which limits the specific options the API user can request. This feature does not apply to API 1.30; you must call the prismhr-api version of this endpoint if you want it to use option-level security. Additionally, the "Disable Method Restrictions" flag will override all method and option-level restrictions defined in the Web Service User Allowed Methods table (however, any unmasking or masking options will still be applied). For more information, refer to the API documentation article "Option-level Access Control"

The options table lists all the data attribute classes.
OptionDescription
EmployerContributionthe return object will contain an array of objects showing the code, description, and amount for employer contributions
Retirementthe return object will contain retirement information for voucher
GLDatathe return object will contain accounting data from that voucher
ASOClientAccountingthe return object will contain ASO client accounting data from that voucher
Initializedthe return object will contain initialized payroll vouchers instead of completed ones
TaxFilingStatusthe return object will contain employee tax filing information (Form W-4 information), including tax authorities and the associated filing statuses, allowances, and calculation overrides
WCInformationthe return object will contain Worker's Compensation information from that voucher
Arrearsthe return object will contain Arrears Data

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: a string containing zero or more of the keywords in the options table

get.description:
This operation retrieves pay schedule information for a specified client, pay group, and date range.

Calling the endpoint will initialize the data retrieval process, and the endpoint will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the compiled JSON data object may be retrieved.

Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this operation. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this operation again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

The JSON object obtained at the URL in dataObject will have the following structure:

{

payScheduleData:

{

payGroup: string,

payDateStart: string,

payDateEnd: string,

payScheduleDetails:[

  {

    payDate: string,

    payDay: string,

   periodStart: string,

  periodEnd: string,

   period: string,

  remoteCutoffDate: string,

  batchNumber: string,

  deliveryDate: string,

  shipDate: string

}

]

}

}

parameters.description: client ID associated with the payGroup

parameters.description: start of report date range (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: payDateEnd
parameters.description: end of report date range (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

post.description:
Use this operation to finalize (post) a payroll batch.

This initializes the asynchronous posting process; the API responds with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. It will return either "buildStatus": "WARN", "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, the batch has posted.

If the system encounters payroll warnings, finalization is halted and warnings are returned in the warning array. When this occurs, review the warnings and fix any issues. If warnings exist and you want to finalize anyway, set bypassWarnings to true and call the endpoint again.

If useApprovals is true, finalization is sent to the Approvals Pending form in PrismHR. This feature requires a corresponding PrismHR user (with the same user ID as the web service user) to exist in the system.

Note: In order for a Web Service User to call this endpoint, you must include it in the Allowed Methods list for that user.

Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this operation. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," and then, if necessary, invoke the operation again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429.

useApprovals.description: if set to true, payroll finalization must pass through approvals process; a corresponding PrismHR user is required for approvals

bypassWarnings.description: if set to true, the system ignores any payroll warnings; payroll errors are still returned
