get.description:
The payroll/reprintCheckStub method generates a PDF check stub for the specified employee ID and voucher ID and returns a redirect URL which downloads the PDF check stub.
If the PDF already exists on the server, this operation will return a status of DONE and a redirect URL to download the PDF check stub.
If the PDF does NOT already exist on the server, calling payroll/reprintCheckStub will initiate the PDF generation process and return a status of BUILDING or PENDING. The method should then be called repeatedly until either the status is DONE or errorCode is not zero (0). Once the status is DONE, the redirect URL may be used to download the PDF check stub.

post.description:
Use this operation to write employee PTO balances from an external source. Employee PTO data can be broken out into PTO plan descriptions (up to 20 per employee), where each plan description is associated with PTO balance, accrued, used, and carryover amounts.

This endpoint is intended for clients that are set up to use external PTO balances only. The client must have the External PTO used option enabled on the Other tab of the Client Details form. Typically, enabling this option means that PTO accrual and management occur in a separate application, such as a time system.

Note: This operation does not support appending data unless the existing data is also present in the request. You must send the complete PTO payload. Any data left off the input will be deleted.

You can write PTO data on batches that are in any of the following statuses:

Status Description
TS.READYPayroll is ready for time sheet entry
TS.ENTRYTime sheet entry in progress
TSOKCOMPTime sheet entry complete
TSOKAUTOAuto payroll ready to calculate
TS.REMOTERemote time sheet entry in progress
EXTCOMPRemote time sheet entry complete
IMPTRECDTime Sheet data uploaded
INITIALPayroll calculation in progress
INITOKPayroll calculation completed
INITPENDCalculation pending authorization
INITWARNPayroll calculation completed with warning
INITFAILPayroll calculation completed with errors
AP.PENDCalculation pending approval
AP.READYPayroll calculation results approved by client
AP.FAILPayroll calculation results rejected by client
INITCOMPPayroll calculation completed; payroll is ready to finalize
WT.PENDWire Transfer Pending

post.description:
This operation changes a Prism user's type from (E)mployee to (M)anager or vice versa. If changing from E to M, then the userRole and dataSecurity arrays are required. If changing from M to E, then these arrays should be omitted from the request. Use PrismSecurityService.getUserDetails to obtain the required checksum and, if changing user type to M, PrismSecurityService.getUserDataSecurity to obtain a data security object shell for any clients you wish to grant access.

Along with entity access, you can also use this endpoint to set up Manager/PTO approver access. To set it up, pass only one value for the entityCode attribute. Allowed values are MANAGERDIRECTREPORTS, PTOAPPROVERDIRECTREPORTS, MANAGERHIERARCHY or PTOAPPROVERHIERARCHY. The entityName attribute will auto-populate.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of employees associated with the specified client and accessible to the specified PrismHR user. You can also filter and paginate the response, if necessary.

Use employeeId, firstName, and lastName to filter the response by employee name or ID. The API matches these values against the beginning of the employee name or ID. For example, if you specify "Jo" in the lastName field, the API would return any employees with surnames that begin with those characters, such as Johnson or Jones. If you enter a value in more than one field, the API will only return employees who meet all the filter criteria.

Note: The firstName, lastName, and employeeId parameters are not case-sensitive.

Use startpage and count to return a paginated response. count specifies the number of employees to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the employee list. The API returns these attributes in the response object, along with the total number of employees.

Use this method to redirect any user type for inbound single sign-on from a third-party product to PrismHR, or Employee Portal. This method may also be used for outbound single sign-on using a PrismHR user ID into any SSO service defined on the account. The SSO service must be marked as "Outbound" under "Service Destination" in the SSO Services form.

To call this endpoint, a web service user must have it listed in their Allowed Methods.

Use prismSecurity/getUserDetails to get a list of all the process IDs that a specific user can access in the Prism Administrative Portal. To direct trusted advisors to the employee portal use componentId EMPLOYEEPORTALAPI. To direct managers to the employee portal enter the userType = E with no componentId entered.

post.description: This operation enables single sign-on to PrismHR Employee Portal. The client specified must be a PrismHR client, and the employee must be employed by that client. If the employee has more than one employer, all of the employing clients must also be PrismHR clients. The return value depends on the user's registration: If this employee is already registered (has a user ID) then the existing userId is returned, along with a flag isNew set to false. If not already registered, a new userId is automatically assigned and returned, along with the flag isNew set to true. It is not possible to assign a specific user ID, nor to assign a password. A user registered by this endpoint will work only through single sign-on (see the redirectUrlByEmployee and redirectUrlByUser endpoints) until the password reset feature is used by the individual employee.

post.description:
This method adds more filters to the subscription, which in turn allows a single subscription to return events from multiple object classes. The 'excludes' parameter is an array. Even if you only have one attribute name, you must pass it as an array of string with a single element. The 'clientId' parameter is optional only when the user parameter is configured without a restriction on the client. See the Authentication and Authorization section of the online documentation for further detail. The 'userStringId' parameter was designed so that multiple subscriptions could be created that share the same string identifier, and this identifier can be used to retrieve a list of matching subscriptions.
You cannot use both the includes and excludes attributes when creating or appending a subscription. You also cannot append a new subscription to an existing subscription if one uses the excludes attribute and the other uses the includes attribute.

subscriptionId.description: ID of the subscription to append the filter to

excludes.description: array of names of the attributes to ignore when retrieving events

includes.description: array of names of the attributes to include when retrieving events

post.description:
Use this method to create a new event subscription and its initial filter. There are some important notes and restrictions regarding the input parameters. The 'excludes' parameter is an array. Even if you only have one attribute name, you must pass it as an array of string with a single element. The 'clientId' parameter is optional only when the user parameter is configured without a restriction on the client. See the Authentication and Authorization section of the online documentation for further detail. The 'userStringId' parameter was designed so that multiple subscriptions could be created that share the same string identifier, and this identifier can be used to retrieve a list of matching subscriptions.
To create a subscription that uses webhooks, you must provide at least one valid webhook URL. Before creating the subscription, the API tries to validate the provided URL(s) by sending an HTTP GET request with a validationToken query parameter. If the URL responds with a 200 status code and the value of validationToken, the event subscription is created. If the URL fails to respond or does not provide a valid response, the event subscription is not created. For more information, see the API webhooks documentation.
You cannot use both the includes and excludes attributes when creating or appending a subscription. You also cannot append a new subscription to an existing subscription if one uses the excludes attribute and the other uses the includes attribute.

excludes.description: array of names of the attributes to ignore when retrieving events

includes.description: array of names of the attributes to include when retrieving events

clientId.description: client identifier to retrieve events for a specific client

userStringId.description: user-defined keyword string to (exact) match on

webhookUrls.description: A comma separated list of webhook URLs to which event data should be sent. (Example: "https://www.webhookurl1.com/webhook,https://www.webhookurl2.com/webhook")

get.description:
Use this operation to generate an AR transaction report.

This will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the data can be retrieved.

Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

Note: To use this endpoint, it must be listed in the Allowed Methods table of the web service user. Otherwise, it returns HTTP response code 403. If client restrictions are applied to the web service user, you must pass a client id to use this endpoint.

The JSON object obtained at the URL in dataObject will have the following structure:

{
  "data": [
    {
      "reportHeader": "string",
      "customerGroup": "string",
      "arAccountNo": "string",
      "customerName": "string",
      "client": "string",
      "employerId": "string",
      "invoice": "string",
      "invoiceDate": "MM/DD/YYYY",
      "invoiceTot": "string",
      "payDate": "MM/DD/YYYY",
      "payType": "string",
      "receiptAccount": "string",
      "payRef": "string",
      "payAmounts": "string",
      "openingBalance": "string",
      "arTransDetails": [
        {
          "payDate": "MM/DD/YYYY",
          "payType": "string",
          "receiptAccount": "string",
          "payRef": "string",
          "payAmounts": "string"
        }
      ],
    }
  ]
}

Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

This operation is used to retrieve data from PrismHR for use by external programs. The particular data to be returned is specified by the schemaName and className parameters, which are similar to the schemas and classes used when creating event subscriptions. Additional filter parameters may optionally be used to retrieve a subset of the system data.

To use this API, provide a valid schema and class and any desired filter criteria. This will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the compiled JSON data object may be retrieved.

Note: To use this endpoint, it must be listed in the Allowed Methods table of the web service user. Otherwise, it returns HTTP response code 403. Otherwise, it returns HTTP response code 403. The Disable Method Restrictions setting is ignored. They must also be given explicit access to the Schemas and Classes to which they require access. If client restrictions are applied to the web service user, you must pass a client id to use this endpoint.

Also, due to the sensitive nature of the data included in some of these data classes, certain fields will be masked by default. These fields can be unmasked by providing specific option strings following the schema and class.

This is defined using the following syntax:
SystemService.getData#Schema|Class[|Option1[|Option2|[...]]]

Here is an example of this syntax that would provide a web service user access to the Employee schema, Compensation class, without social security number or identity documents masked:
SystemService.getData#Employee|Compensation|NOMASKSSN|NOMASKDOC

Please see the API documentation section on SystemService.getData security restrictions for more information.

The following schemas and classes may be used with this API

post.summary: Determine hire type for given ssn
post.description:
This operation returns the type of hire that should occur for a given social security number, last name, and date of birth of a prospective hire (see the hire types table below).
In addition, if a validation error occurs that could affect the hire process, information about this is returned also (see the validation codes table below).

Note: To use this endpoint, it must be listed in the Allowed Methods table of the web service user. Otherwise, it returns HTTP response code 403. The Disable Method Restrictions setting is ignored.

Note: The firstName parameter is optional. If you include firstName in your request, the system validates that it matches the employee's first name. If you leave firstName empty, these validations do not occur.

Please note: this endpoint is meant for service provider/admin level system access and not meant for client/manager users. A client or manager user should never be given information about other clients for which an employee may work.

Hire Types

Type Code Type Description Next Actions
NEW_HIRE The SSN provided is brand new to the employer. Call NewHireService.importEmployees to hire the employee.
CROSS_HIRE The SSN provided is employed by another client. Call NewHireService.importEmployeesAllowingCrossHire with the provided employeeId to hire the employee.
NEW_OR_CROSS The SSN provided is employed by another client, and may be either new hired OR cross-hired. Call NewHireService.importEmployees to new hire the employee or call NewHireService.importEmployeesAllowingCrossHire with the provided employeeId to hire the employee.
REHIRE The SSN provided was employed by the provided client and currently terminated. Call EmployeeService.rehireEmployee with the provided employeeId to rehire the employee.
ONBOARDING The SSN provided is currently in onboarding for the provided client. N/A
ACTIVE_EMPLOYEE The SSN provided is currently an active employee with the provided client. N/A
UNKNOWN An error occurred which prevented hire status being determined. Correct errors and retry this call.

Validation Codes

Validation Code Validation Description
LAST_NAME The last name associated with this social security number has changed.
FIRST_NAME The first name associated with this social security number has changed.
FIRST_NAME_LAST_NAME The first name AND last name associated with this social security number do not match those provided.
DOB The date of birth associated with this social security number does not match the date of birth provided.
DOB_LAST_NAME The date of birth AND last name associated with this social security number do not match those provided.
DOB_FIRST_NAME The date of birth AND first name associated with this social security number do not match those provided.
DOB_FIRST_NAME_LAST_NAME The date of birth, first name, AND last name associated with this social security number do not match those provided.
NO_REHIRE Employee was terminated from this client with Rehire Okay status set to false.

firstName.description: first name; leave blank to bypass first name validations

get.description:
Use this operation to retrieve a list of the existing positive pay files you can recreate by calling SystemService.recreatePositivePay. You can enter a checking account name (if the positive pay file was created for a single account) or a file stub name (if the file was created for multiple accounts). You can also filter the response using either the single dateCreated parameter or a date range (you cannot use both). To return only the most recently created file for a given checkingAcct, set mostRecent to true.

Note: To use this endpoint, it must be listed in the Allowed Methods table of the web service user. Otherwise, it returns HTTP response code 403. The Disable Method Restrictions setting is ignored.

This operation also returns paginated results when more than 5000 files match the request criteria. Use the count and startpage query parameters to navigate through the list of positive pay files. count specifies the number of files to return per page, and startpage indicates the starting position in the file list. The operation also returns these values in the response object along with the total number of positive pay files.

get.description:
Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

Use this operation to return benefit adjustments that have not yet been billed. You can also filter the response by adjustment period, employee status class, and client termination status.

Call this operation with any desired filter criteria. This will initialize the data retrieval and the API will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the compiled JSON data may be retrieved.

Note: To use this endpoint, it must be listed in the Allowed Methods table of the web service user. Otherwise, it returns HTTP response code 403. The Disable Method Restrictions setting is ignored.

Note: This operation respects any client access security settings configured on the Web Service Users form. By default, the download only includes data from clients that meet these criteria. All other client data is excluded.

The response data consists of one or more unbilledBenefitAdjustments objects, each containing an employeeId, a clientId, and one or more benefitAdjustments objects. Below is the complete structure of the JSON data, with descriptions:

{ "unbilledBenefitAdjustments": [{ "employeeId": employee identifier, "clientId": client identifier, "benefitAdjustments": [ {"benefitPlan": benefit plan associated with the adjustment, "period": benefit plan period in YYYYMM format, "billAmount": amount to bill the client, per pay cycle, for this adjustment, "eeContribution": amount to deduct from the employee pay check per cycle, "cycles": number of future payroll cycles where this adjustment will be applied, "startDate": start date of the period when this deduction takes effect (in YYYY-MM-DD format), "insuranceCost": the premium cost associated with this adjustment,"refNumber": adjustment reference number, "cyclesBilled": number of cycles billed so far, "netInvEffect": net amount billed (billAmount minus eeContribution), "brAdjAmount": the benefits reconciliation adjustment to apply during the benefits reconciliation process, "retroEnroll": whether the adjustment applies to a retroactive enrollment, "comment": descriptive comments about this adjustment, "checksum": checksum value to use for data updates } ] } ] }

parameters.description: identifier used to check status of / download data

parameters.description: use this option to limit the response to one or more client IDs

parameters.description: adjustment period filter start date (in YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: adjustment period filter end date (in YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: includeTermClient
parameters.description: whether to include terminated clients in the response. Terminated clients are excluded by default.

parameters.name: statusClass
parameters.description: use this option to restrict the response based on employee status class. Allowed values are T (terminated), A (active), and L (on leave).

This will initialize the data retrieval and will respond with "buildStatus": "INIT". Subsequent calls to this API should be formatted exactly as the initial call, with the addition of the downloadId returned by the initial call. They will return either "buildStatus": "BUILD", "buildStatus": "ERROR", or "buildStatus": "DONE". If buildStatus is DONE, then "dataObject" will contain the URL where the data can be retrieved.

Note: Web Service Users cannot call multiple concurrent instances of this method. Please wait until the first instance returns a buildStatus of "DONE," retrieve your download link, and then, if necessary, invoke this method again. If you try to call a second instance before the first one completes, the system will return HTTP response code 429 and you must complete the previous instance using the downloadId provided before initiating a new instance.

Note: To use this endpoint, it must be listed in the Allowed Methods table of the web service user. Otherwise, it returns HTTP response code 403. The Disable Method Restrictions setting is ignored.

post.description: This operation uploads the pay import data into a temporary holding area and performs validations against the data. The response identifies those records that did not pass validation. This operation can be called repeatedly, and it will overwrite the previous upload. This allows the client application to look at the response, correct problems, and then upload again. Note that it also returns an uploadId, which is used for the TimesheetService.reject and TimesheetService.approve operations.

The system uses this date to calculate the number of months that the employee has worked for the client. The default value is the employee's last hire date

percentageLevel.description: the percentage level of the employees' retirement base earnings.

safeHarbor.description: empty, Y, N: whether the layer is a Safe Harbor Match (Type 1),. This overrides the value set in Classify as Safe Harbor Match.

effectiveDate.description: date when the match rules go into effect

matchLogicType.description: (T)raditional, (L)ayered, (S1) Safe Harbor 1, (S2) Safe Harbor 2: logic to use for match calculations. (T)raditional calculates a match based on the employees contributions and limits the match to a flat amount or percentage of employees' earnings. (L)ayered matches a different percentage for various levels of the employees' contributions. (S1) Safe Harbor 1 uses match rates for contributing employees only. (S2) Safe Harbor 2 uses match rates for both contributing and non-contributing employees.

comments.description: descriptive notes about the retirement match plan rules

regularEmployerMatch.description: the regular employer match (if no maximum, leave blank)

safeHarbor1RateOverride.description: override amount to use if the client uses a retirement plan that mirrors Safer Harbor 1 rules, but uses another rate or percentage.

safeHarbor2RateOverride.description: override amount to use if the client uses a retirement plan that mirrors Safer Harbor 2 rules, but uses another rate or percentage.

safeHarbor2FlatRateOverride.description: amount to use for the calculated match. This overrides the Safe Harbor Type 2 Match.

traditionalCompanyMatch.description: the company's matching contribution, equal to the % of the employee's elective contribution to this retirement plan.

traditionalMaxCompanyMatchPct.description: the maximum contribution to be made by the company, equal to the % of the employee's retirement basis earnings.

traditionalMaxCompanyMatch.description: maximum contribution to be made by the company (flat amount).

traditionalBasisMax.description: (V)oucher, (Y)TD, (S)heltered Earnings, (VY) Voucher %/YTD Flat Amount: basis for calculating the maximum matching contribution. The options are (V)oucher earnings (default setting), (Y)ear-to-date earnings, (s)heltered earnings, or (VY) voucher percent divided by the year-to-date flat match.

classifySafeHarborMatch.description: whether this rule is a Safe Harbor Match (Type 1).

maxMatchingContributionPerWeek.description: maximum matching contributions per week, if there is a weekly limit on the calculated match.

calcSH2NEMatchInAddition.description: whether to calculate the Safe Harbor 2 Non-Elective Match. If false, the employer matching contribution is used.

nonElectiveRate.description: rate typically used for profit sharing that accrues per pay period.

calculatePeoMatch.description: whether to calculate an additional employer matching contribution, funded by the PEO.

vestingCode.description: the code used for vesting options. Vesting codes were defined when the retirement plan and its reporting parameters were set up.

vestingCodeProfShare.description: the code for profit-sharing vesting options.

suppressMatchPrintOnCheck.description: whether to prevent the retirement match from printing on pay stubs.

excludeCatchUpContribFromMatchCalculatio.description: whether to exclude employees' catch-up contributions when the system calculates the matching contribution.

employeeStatusClass.description: classification assigned to the currentEmployeeStatus: "A" (Active), "L" (On Leave), or "T" (Terminated).

stabilityStartDate.description: start of stability period, which determines whether the employee receives Form 1095-C (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

acaType.description: employee type from the perspective of the Affordable Care Act: Ongoing ("O", default) or New Hire ("N").

acaOfferOfCoverage.description: whether the system has offered the employee health insurance coverage in accordance with the Affordable Care Act guidelines; N or null = No, Y = Yes

count.description: number of employees returned per page

items.description: info messages

isPaid.description: indicates whether the time off was paid

accruedThruDate.description: date through which time has accrued

absenceJournal.description: list of absenceJournals for a employee under particular client

total.description: total number of absence journal records returned

count.description: number of absence journal records returned per page

status.description: enrollment status must be one of: 'E' (Eligible Unenrolled), 'A' (Active Enrollment), 'T' (Terminated Enrollment), 'C' (COBRA Enrollment), or 'W' (Waived Enrollment)

deductionStart.description: starting date of payroll deduction for employee's contribution

deductionEnd.description: stop date for payroll deduction for employee's contribution

cobraTermFlag.description: "1" indicates that this was a COBRA termination. In other words, the plan status was changed from "C" to "T". An empty value indicates that the status was changed from some other value to "T".

section125.description: 'true' if the employee has elected this benefit as part of a Section 125 Cafeteria plan

items.description: group term life voucher numbers

reportedToCarrier.description: 'true' if coverage has been reported to the insurance carrier

doctorId.description: doctor ID to report to insurance carrier

seenByDoctor.description: indicates whether the person has been seen by the doctor

alternateNetworkId.description: alternate network ID to use when calculating premiums

carrierEmployeeId.description: number the insurance carrier uses to identify this employee

waiveReason.description: reason the employee waived the benefit plan

overrideGTLStart.description: benefit start date for the year-to-date group term life taxable calculation; overrides the coverage start date for the plan

reportedToCarrier.description: indicates whether the dependent's coverage has been reported to the carrier

doctorId.description: doctor identifier to report to the insurance carrier

seenByDoctor.description: indicates whether the dependent has been seen by the doctor

coverageStart.description: date on which dependent benefits go into effect

coverageEnd.description: date on which dependent benefits coverage ends

overrideCoverageEnd.description: date used for downloads to report a different end date to the insurance carrier

gtlTaxYear.description: tax year in which taxable benefits accrued against the plan

gtlAccruedYTD.description: year-to-date taxable benefits accrued against the plan for the tax year

effectiveDate.description: effective date of the coverage details

coverage.description: amount of insurance coverage, 0 if coverage amount cannot be defined for the plan

spouseCoverage.description: for life insurance only, coverage amount elected for employee's spouse

dependentCoverage.description: for life insurance only, coverage amount elected for employee's dependent(s)

rateGuarantyStart.description: This is the start of the guaranty period, and is the date used for Age and Rate. If the plan is an ongoing five-year guaranty plan, ensure the list includes as many five-year periods that can possibnly apply. Once the employee is out of guaranty periods, the system resumes using the current date for all transactions.

rateGuarantyEnd.description: After the final rate guaranty end date is passed, the system uses the current Age and Rate for any calculations.

plan.description: list of benefit plans available for given employee under specific client

planName.description: description (name) of the group benefit plan

status.description: employee's current enrollment status: 'A' (active), 'E' (eligible), 'W' (waived), or 'T' (terminated)

inputElements.description: elements required to enroll employee in plan

items.description: elements required to enroll employee in plan

downloadId.description: identifier used to check status of / download data

buildStatus.description: data build status (INIT, BUILD, ERROR, DONE)

dataObject.description: URL where data object may be retrieved

enrollmentType.description: type of benefit enrollment; values include Benefits Enrollment (BE), Life Event Enrollment (LE), Open Enrollment (OE), and Anytime Enrollment (AE)

enrollmentStatusDesc.description: description of the enrollment status code

payeeId.description: payee identifier of the applicable benefit provider

hdhpFlag.description: 'Y' indicates this is a high deductible health plan that makes enrolled employees eligible to participate in a health savings account

offerTypeCode.description:
offer type for including benefit plan in enrollments (PrismHR Benefits Enrollment only)
'MED' medical,
'VIS' vision,
'DEN' dental,
'VOL' voluntary benefits,
'LIF' life-basic,
'GTL' group term life ,
'LTD' long term disability,
'STD' short term disability,
'GAP' gap insurance,
'ADD' accidental death and dismemberment,
'LIS' spouse only basic life,
'LIC' child only basic life,
'ANC' ancillary,
'CRI' critical illness,
'CAN' cancer benefits,
'MDP' domestic partner medical,
'DDP' domestic partner dental,
'VDP' domestic partner vision,
'ACC' accident benefits,
'LDA' additional ltd,
'SDA' additional std,
'BLX' basic life extra,
'HOS' voluntary hospitalization,
'IDT' identity theft,
'LGL' legal,
'CRL' critical illness as life,
'TEL' telehealth,
'WLI' whole life

contributionMethod.description: contribution method. (P)ercentage, (F)lat Amount, (FP) Fixed EE - Percent Depn, (PF) - Percent EE - Fixed depn

contributionAmount.description: contribution amount towards the premium. It will be either percentage or flat amount depending on the contribution method

depContributionAmount.description: employee contribution amount toward the portion of the premium allocated to dependent coverage

BasicContributionRule.description: basic contribution rule. Basic contribution rule is used for Long term, short term and life insurance plans.

method.description: contribution method: 'P' (Percentage), 'F' (Flat Amount), 'FP' (Fixed EE, Percent Dep), or 'PF' (Percent EE, Fixed Dep)

companyEEBill.description: contribution to employee coverage if paid by client

employeeEEBill.description: contribution to employee coverage if paid by employee

companyDepBill.description: contribution to dependent coverage if paid by client

employeeDepBill.description: contribution to dependent coverage if paid by employee

multiplierPayBasis.description: Multiplier pay basis. code for the basis pay to use when calculating life insurance coverage. empty assumes annualized pay

payMultiplier.description: pay multiplier. multiplier to apply to the employee annual base pay to arrive at the coverage amount for the benefit plan. Enter '0' if flat amount applies

roundBeforeAfter.description: Round Before/After. 'B' to Round up basis pay before multiplier to determine life insurance coverage. (A) or empty will round up after applying multiplier

coverageMaximum.description: coverage maximum. Maximum amount of insurance coverage allowed under the plan

coverageAmount.description: coverage amount. flat amount of coverage

addToCalculatedCoverage.description: add to calculated coverage. flat amount which will be added to the calculated coverage amount

coverage.description: benefit level coverage at this level

groupPlanId.description: identifier for the group benefit plan, or employee ID if the rule is an employee-specific override

billingRateGroup.description: billing rate group (not used for benefit rules, obsolete)

items.description: employment status

effectiveDate.description: effective date for the plan

ruleAmtMadeBy.description: indicates who makes the contribution for the benefit defined by this rule: 'C' (company) or 'E' (employee)

eligDays.description: minimum number of days of service required to be eligible

takeOnEmpExempt.description: take on exempt. Valid inputs are (Y)es, (N)o or empty

altContributionPlan.description: alternate contribution plan id. If contribution calculations are to be based on an alternate plan's premium billing rates, enter the alternate Plan ID here. Otherwise, leave empty.

altRateGroup.description: alternate contribution rate group. If contribution calculations are to be based on another rate group other than that assigned on the Company Benefits record, enter that Rate Group ID here or leave empty

minimumAge.description: minimum age required to be eligible for the benefit

minDayOrMonth.description: Eligible days or months. Valid inputs are (D)ays or (M)onths

eligDaysFrom.description: Eligibility days from. Valid values are (H)ire date or (S)tatus date.

eligDateUsed.description: Eligibility date used. O-if calculated date is 1st of month use that date else use 1st day of followingmonth. F-1st of month after calculated date. C-use calculated eligibility date

employmentType.description: employment type required to be eligible for benefits. If no requirement leave as empty

items.description: employment type required to be eligible for benefits. If no requirement leave as empty

exemptOrNonExempt.description: the required FLSA status to be eligible for this benefit. If no requirement leave this field blank

checksum.description: the checksum retrieved from BenefitService.getBenefitRule operation used for updates

yearsOfService.description: years of service with the company

payMultiplier.description: pay multiplier based on years of service

employeeName.description: name of the employee specified by employeeId

value.description: data value assigned to the corresponding method

planClass.description: benefit plan classification: 'G' (Group Benefit), 'R' (Retirement), 'F' (Flexible Spending), 'M' (Employer Match), or 'H' (HSA Match)

status.description: status of client's benefit plan: 'A' (active plan) or 'T' (terminated plan)

startDate.description: date on which plan becomes active

tpaPlanIdOvr.description: client-level TPA plan identifier override; not typically used

useBenefitGroups.description: If the eligibility data should be housed on the Benefit Group, enter (Y)es. Valid values are (Y)es , (N)o or empty

benefitRateGroup.description: billing rate group for the plan

pendingRateGroupEffDate.description: date on which pending rate group becomes effective

benefitTemplateId.description: identifier of benefit rules template used to calculate eligibility, coverage, and employee contributions in absence of client/plan specific rule

benefitPrepay.description: indicates whether to bill the client and deduct amounts from the employees for the next month during the current month; for example, bill and deduct for July coverage in August

prePayOffset.description: indicates whether the system should check for and use any new rates and rules for the upcoming month

useBillingWashRules.description: indicates whether the system applies a billing wash rule to the group benefit plan, for any new hires or terminated employees

washRuleOnBeforeDate.description: last day of the month when a wash rule can be applied. Valid values are 10 for the 10th day of the month, or 20 for the 20th day of the month. In order to use this field, useBillingWashRules must be set to true

yearlyDeductions.description: the annual periods, which can be 48 or 52, determine the calculation for deduction amounts taken from employee paychecks each pay period

benefitCoverageEnds.description: indicates how coverage ends when an employee is terminated; a value is required when creating or updating a client group benefit plan; allowed values: 'T' if benefit coverage ends on termination date, 'E' if benefit coverage ends at the end of the month, or 'D#' if benefit coverage ends on a specific day of the month where # is the number of the day (1 for first of the month, 2 for second of the month, and so on)

benefitCafeEligibility.description: indicates whether the benefit plan is eligible for the client's cafe plan; for example, if the client offers $1500 to cover certain benefit plans and this plan qualifies

benefitBillingFreq.description: determines the billing frequency for the plan: 'P' or unspecified (pay period), 'M' (monthly), 'M2' (monthly, start deduction period 2), 'M3' (monthly, start deduction period 3), or 'M4' (monthly, start deduction period 4)

deductCycle.description: to override employees' normal pay period payroll deduction frequency, specify one of: 'P' or unspecified (pay period; this is standard), 'M' (monthly), 'M2' (monthly, start deduction period 2), 'M3' (monthly, start deduction period 3), or 'M4' (monthly, start deduction period 4)

overMonth.description: use only if instructed by PrismHR Support; overrides month for which to calculate benefit premiums

overDay.description: use only if instructed by PrismHR Support; overrides day for which to calculate benefit premiums

networkSelectRule.description: for future development; do not use

pendPremRateGrp.description: pending rate group. Must be used with custom feature code PENDING-BILL-RATE-GLOBAL for all clients or PENDING-BILL-RATE-CLIENT for a single client.

pendPremRateGrpDate.description: date the pending rate group will become effective. Must be used with custom feature code PENDING-BILL-RATE-GLOBAL for all clients or PENDING-BILL-RATE-CLIENT for a single client.

defaultNetworkId.description: default network plan ID to use for employees who enroll in the plan

benefitAutoEnroll.description: indicates whether automatic enrollment is enabled

suppressOEAutoTerm.description: for future development; do not use

planSuppBenAdj.description: indicates whether to suppress benefit adjustments that would normally be created due to payroll timing if an employee is terminated

ruleDateToUse.description: rule date to use for take-on. Enter a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format or leave empty.

earliestPremiumRateDate.description: earliest premium rate date. Enter a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format or leave empty. Enter premium rate date only if updating benefit plan setup. Leave empty when using createBenefitPlanSetup

earliestBillingRateDate.description: earliest billing rate date. Enter a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format or leave empty. Enter billing rate date only if updating benefit plan setup. Leave empty when using createBenefitPlanSetup

fringePayCode.description: valid fringe benefit pay code to add to regular vouchers during payroll initialization

addtoRetirementPay.description: indicates whether to include the pay code in retirement wages when calculating retirement benefits

hiMedicalBasePlan.description: plan ID for another benefit plan that should be used as the 'base plan' in Hawaii medical (1.5 percent) calculations

includeExclude.description: applies only to retirement plans and indicates whether to include or exclude the codes specified in payCodes as part of retirement earnings: 'I' (include) or 'E' (exclude)

eligStatus.description: employment status classification(s) required to be eligible for benefits: 'A' (Active), 'L' (On Leave), 'T' (Terminated), or blank if no specific status(es) required

items.description: employment status classification(s) required to be eligible for benefits: 'A' (Active), 'L' (On Leave), 'T' (Terminated), or blank if no specific status(es) required

eligType.description: employment type(s) required to be eligible for benefits (types defined by service provider), or blank if no specific type(s) required

items.description: employment type(s) required to be eligible for benefits (types defined by service provider), or blank if no specific type(s) required

eligAge.description: minimum age required to be eligible

eligDayMonth.description: indicates whether eligibility should be based on minimum months or days of service, if appropriate

eligDaysFrom.description: eligibility days from. Valid values are empty, (H)ire Date, (S)tatus date

eligHours.description: minimum annual hours required to be eligible

eligDays.description: minimum number of days of service required to be eligible

eligMonths.description: minimum number of months of service required to be eligible

eligDateUsed.description: date used to measure eligibility;a value is required when creating or updating a client retirement plan; allowed values: 'C' (Calculated Eligibility Date), 'F' (First of Month After Calculated Date), 'Q' (First of Quarter After Calculated Date), or 'O' (If Calculated Is First of Month Use That, Else Next First of Month)

autoEnroll.description: overrides automatic enrollment setting at the plan level. Valid values are (Y)es, (N)o or empty.

autoEnrollPercent.description: deferral percentage at which employee is automatically enrolled

hsaAltMatch.description: alternate health savings account match method: 'T' (Tiered), 'S' (Scheduled), or 'F' (Fixed)

hsaMatch.description: amount to be matched by the company to any employee with the health savings account

hsaMatchFreq.description: frequency of company's match for health savings accounts: 'O' (One-Time Match), 'P' or blank (Pay Period Match),

hsaAltFixedOneTime.description: if hsaAltMatch is (F)ixed, this indicates whether it is a one-time match amount. Valid values are (Y)es, (N)o or empty.

riskFactor.description: risk factors if required for group benefit plan

hi15Rule.description: details of Hawaii's Prepaid Health Care Act 1.5% health insurance premium rate

renewalMonth.description: benefit plan renewal month for the client; with renewalDay, this field overrides the date specified on the Group Benefit Plans form. Possible values: 1 through 12.

renewalDay.description: benefit plan renewal day for the client; with renewalMonth, this field overrides the date specified on the Group Benefit Plans form. Possible values: any allowed dates for the renewalMonth.

takeOnExemptFromMin.description: if true, imported employees are exempted from the minimum service requirement

scorp.description: if true, the client-paid portion of the benefit is only treated as a fringe benefit for S-Corp Principal employees; note that affected employees must have the client-paid portion assigned to a defined fringe benefit pay code

autoEscalator.description: if true, retirement plan contributions will automatically escalate by 1 percent each year until reaching the autoEscalatorMax value; to use this field, autoEnrollment must be true

autoEscalatorMax.description: if autoEscalator is true, this field defines the maximum escalation limit for the retirement plan contribution percentage; the value can have up to two decimal places and can range from 10.00 to 15.00

hsaContribApplies.description: specifies the employees to which HSA contributions apply; possible values are empty, CONTRIB-EMPLOYEES, or ALL-HDHP. If empty, any employee with an HSA account in their elections for the current plan year will receive the employer contribution. If CONTRIB-EMPLOYEES, this feature only applies to employees who contribute more than $0.00. If ALL-HDHP, contribution applies to all high-deductible health plan employees and a value can be set for acctTypes

acctTypes.description: indicates the Flex Spend Account Type associated with the HSA contribution for this employee; this field can only be modified if hsaContribApplies = ALL-HDHP

displayEmployerAmtOnlineEnrollment.description: whether to display the employer contribution amount during benefit enrollments, allowing employees to view the amount their employer contributes to the plan.The default value will be true

checksum.description: checksum to use for updates

hiMedCalc.description: 'Y' if Hawaii 1.5% rule applies to this plan

Hi15Rule.description: details of Hawaii's Prepaid Health Care Act 1.5% health insurance premium rate

hsaEffDate.description: effective date of the HSA (health savings account) plan

premRiskFactorDate.description: date on which the premium risk factor goes into effect

adminSurcharge.description: The functionality for this field has been removed. Values passed for this field will be ignored.

premRiskFactor.description: premium risk factor to use as a multiplier when calculating benefit premiums

premRiskExtFactor.description: extended precision risk factor can have any number of decimal places

RiskFactor.description: risk factors if required for group benefit plan

startDate.description: date plan starts

template.description: use to calculate eligibility, coverage, and employee contributions if there is no client- or plan-specific rule

groupRules.description: benefit group and benefit rule effective date

items.description: benefit group and benefit rule effective date

terminationReason.description: one or more strings describing possible reasons for termination of COBRA coverage. For example: OVERDUE PREMIUMS or ELIGIBILITY PERIOD EXPIRED.

items.description: one or more strings describing possible reasons for termination of COBRA coverage. For example: OVERDUE PREMIUMS or ELIGIBILITY PERIOD EXPIRED.

qualifyingEventCode.description: description of a COBRA qualifying event. For example: TERMINATION, REDUCTION IN HOURS, or DIVORCE.

monthsOfCoverage.description: number of months of coverage for the COBRA qualifying event

appliesTo.description: indicates who is covered under the qualifying event. Possible values are 'E' (employee), 'S' (spouse), 'D' (dependent), and any combination of these three.

items.description: COBRA-associated benefit plans

billOnDay.description: day of month for COBRA plan billing. If blank, the default is day 1 of the month

overridePercent.description: this value represents a special administrative fee rate for this employee, different from the global fee percentage. If blank, the global fee is used

cobraTermReason.description: termination reason that led to COBRA coverage

cobraStatus.description: COBRA enrollment status: P (pending), A (active), D (declined), E (expired)

cobraCoverageEnds.description: date when the first premium payment is due from the beneficiary, usually 45 days after the election date

noticeTwoDue.description: date when the second COBRA election notice is due

noticeThreeDue.description: date when the third COBRA election notice is due

premiumReceipt.description: date when the first COBRA premium payment was received from the participant

electionNoticeSent.description: date when the first COBRA election notice was sent

noticeTwoSent.description: date when the second COBRA election notice was sent

noticeThreeSent.description: date when the second COBRA election notice was sent

transaction amount
months billed for COBRA coverage
additional COBRA payment notes

termNoticePrinted.description: date when enrollee termination notice was printed

other COBRA identifier or identifiers
other client identifier or identifiers

reactivated.description: whether the employee was later reactivated

arraNoticePrinted.description: date when one of the COBRA notices specified by the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act was printed

checksum.description: Checksum value to use for data updates

spouse.description: indicates whether the dependent is the employee's spouse

tobaccoUser.description: indicates whether the dependent uses tobacco products

relation.description: dependent relationship code; these are defined by the service provider

fullTimeStudent.description: indicates whether the dependent is a full-time student

ftStudentCertDate.description: date on which the dependent was certified as a full-time student

ftStudentCertExp.description: date on which the dependent's certification as a student ends

relationType.description: type of dependent relation: 'D' (Dependent) or 'B' (Beneficiary only)

benefitPercent.description: percentage of the insurance proceeds to which the beneficiary is entitled

benefitPrecedence.description: order of precedence to receive benefits if there is more than one beneficiary

status.description: dependent's status: 'A' (Active), 'I' (Inactive), or 'P' (Pending)

doctorId.description: identifier for doctor to report to insurance carrier

reportedToCarrier.description: indicates whether the dependent's coverage has been reported to the insurance carrier

seenByDoctor.description: indicates whether the dependent has been seen by the doctor

statusDate.description: date the status (A, P, or I) went into effect

relationToInsured.description: for beneficiaries, this is the relationship to the insured employee

beneficiaryIsATrust.description: indicates whether the beneficiary is a trust

isDisabled.description: indicates whether the dependent has a disability

ssnAppliedFor.description: indicates whether the dependent requires a Social Security Number: if 'N' (default), the ssn field contains a valid social security number; if 'Y', ssn is not required and if a value is passed for ssn in this case, the system automatically changes this field to 'N'.

relationshipCodeType.description: relationship type code; Possible values: CH (children), SP (spouse), PA (parent), DP (domestic partner) or DPC (domestic partner children)

percent.description: coverage percentage for this state code

offerType.description: benefit plan offer type: STD is short-term disability, LTD is long-term disability

increments.description: number of dollars separating each coverage level

guaranteeIssueDefaultPercent.description: maximum amount an employee can receive without filing an EOI (if applicable to this plan), represented as a percentage of the employee's salary

lateEntrantGIAmt.description: maximum amount a late entrant employee can receive without filing an EOI; the employee is required to submit an EOI to receive further coverage

lateEntrantGIDftPercent.description: maximum amount a late entrant employee can receive without filing an EOI (if applicable to this plan), represented as a percentage of the employee's salary

state.description: state-level coverage overrides; percentage is taken from employee salary

planType.description: type of flex plan (HSA or FSA)

checksum.description: checksum to use for data updates

hawaiiMax15Amount.description: If the employee's resident state is Hawaii, the calculated contribution amount that does not exceed 1.5% of the employee's monthly wage.

participantRequirement.description: percentage associated with the plan's participant requirement

planApplication.description: URL for the carrier plan application that employees can complete

proxyAcknowledgeQuestion.description: text that displays next to the proxy acknowledgement checkbox
