acknowledgeResponseEmpDeclination.description: text of the employee declination message

acknowledgeResponseProxyAffirm.description: text of the proxy affirmation message

acknowledgeResponseProxyDeclination.description: text of the proxy declination message

checksum.description: Checksum value to use for data updates

field.description: benefit plan detail field, such as deductible or copay

refNumber.description: system-generated reference number for the reimbursement

planYear.description: FSA plan year associated with the reimbursement

accountType.description: the type of flexible spending account

accountTypeDesc.description: description of the account type code

reimburseAmt.description: amount of the FSA plan reimbursement

pendingReimburse.description: pending FSA plan reimbursement amount, if any

annotation.description: additional user comments or documentation for this reimbursement

electAmount.description: the amount the employee has committed to funding the flexible spending account

deductAmount.description: deductions that were taken from the employee's pay check

companyMatch.description: match amount for the employee's company

reimburseAmount.description: company match for the employee's reimbursement amount

deductOverrideAmt.description: the non-standard Deduction Override to deduct each pay period, if the employee changed pay cycles, or was not enrolled for the entire year

payPeriodMatch.description: the non-standard Match Override contributed by the company each pay period

annualMatch.description: amount that the company commits to match for the employee annually

forfeitAmount.description: amount that the employee will forfeit, if not used by end of the year. Any value provided for this parameter will be ignored during setFlexPlan

period.description: the alternate deduction period schedule when the deduction and match override amounts apply, instead of applying them to all deduction periods

stopDate.description: the date on which to end payroll deductions for this FSA plan

overDate.description: the pay date on which this override applies. If left blank, the system applies the override amount for all pay dates. Override amounts will be used for all pay dates if the overDate field is left blank

startDate.description: the date on which to begin payroll deductions for this FSA plan

peoMatchHSA.description: an HSA PEO match override amount if you want to override the match set at the system level in the back end

carryForwardFlag.description: indicates whether the funded balance for the account can be carried forward into the next year; if it is of 'Y' (Yes) or 'A' (Automatically carry forward on first payroll of the year) it will be true else false

fundedBalance.description: Funded balance. Any value provided for this parameter will be ignored during setFlexPlan

electedBalance.description: Elected balance. Any value provided for this parameter will be ignored during setFlexPlan

accountsType.description: flex spending account type code. Any value provided for this parameter will be ignored during setFlexPlan

overrideStart.description: date to start deducting for the account

overrideEnd.description: date to stop deducting for the account

hdhpNotRequired.description: whether the employee has a Health Savings Account (HSA) but is not enrolled in a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP). Usually, HDHP enrollment is a requirement

peoMatchOverride.description: An HSA PEO Match Override amount if you want to override the match set at the system level

suppressContributionLimits.description: Whether to ignore the HSA Maximum Annual Contributions when calculating deductions for this employee

checksum.description: checksum to use for updates to a record (if no record, then accept zero, 0, or empty)

minReducedCov.description: the minimum amount of coverage offered for the age specified

carrierPlanId.description: carrier plan ID if different than the plan ID referenced by the insurance carrier

carrierGrp.description: carrier-specific group code to use for tracking

carrierPolicyId.description: policy ID number for the carrier

carrierSubDiv.description: carrier-specific sub-division code to use for tracking

carrierBranch.description: carrier-specific branch code to use for tracking

carrierZipFile.description: zip file name used by the benefit plan carrier

famPlanNoIncrement.description: number to increment the family plan number from the employee plan number

extRiskFactors.description: whether to enable extended precision for the risk factors. Extended precision enables you to enter more than two decimal places for the factor. If you do not select this option, the risk factors are fixed at four decimal places

rfAppliesTo.description: indicates how the system aplies risk factors: 'P' (Premiums Only), 'B' (Billing Only), or 'PB' (Both Premiums and Billing)

items.description: carrier code information

carrierPlanDetails.description: carrier information for the benefit plan

planNo.description: internal plan number, which relates to the specific insurance carrier's plan number, account number, etc.

extRiskFactor.description: risk factor, which is the amount applied to the calculated benefit premium

corpDebitAcct.description: account to expense for this benefit plan

corpCreditAcct.description: account that this benefit plan credits with the deduction amount. Typically, this is an accrued liability account payable to a third party

eeCovStart.description: employee starting coverage amount for life insurance plan

spCovStart.description: spouse starting coverage amount for life insurance plan

depCovStart.description: dependent starting coverage amount for life insurance plan

eeCovEnd.description: employee ending level of life insurance coverage (if not using multiplier)

eeSalaryMultiplier.description: employee salary multiplier (if not using end level)

eeCovInc.description: employee increment amount for life insurance coverage

spCovEnd.description: spouse ending level of life insurance coverage

spCovInc.description: spouse increment amount of life insurance coverage

spElectPerc.description: percentage of employee election to limit maximum spouse amounts

spOnlyElig.description: indicates whether eligibility for the spouse is independent of the employee

depCovEnd.description: dependent ending level of life insurance coverage

depCovInc.description: dependent increment amount for life insurance coverage

depElectPerc.description: percentage of employee election to limit maximum dependent amounts

dpOnlyElig.description: indicates whether eligibility for dependents is independent of the employee

reducePremiumAlso.description: whether both the coverage and premium amounts are reduced

dependentReductionProvision.description: contents here are displayed to the employees in online Benefits Enrollment when dependents are selected for coverage

dependentReductionProvSpanish.description: contents here are displayed to the employees in online Benefits Enrollment when dependents are selected for coverage; some spanish character may not return correctly

depState.description: the states for which state level override(s) for Dependent Age Limits on the Group Benefit Plan setup exist

depAgeLimit.description: the dependent age limit set for the state level override(s)on the Group Benefit Plan setup for the corresponding state

depAgeCalculation.description: the dependent age calculation method used for the the corresponding state. Allowed values are D (DOB), E (End of DOB year) and M (End of DOB month)

disabledDep.description: "Y (yes) indicates that the dependent is disabled. "N" (no) indicates the dependent is not disabled.

disabledAltAge.description: the alternate age limit for the disabled dependent for the corresponding state

frMaxCalcD.description: family-rated plan:maximum individuals counted in age range

effectiveDate.description: effective date from when Percentage of Gross Wages is set as the employee contribution towards a medical plan (employee premium only)

percentGrossWages.description: the Percentage of Gross Wages set as the employee contribution towards a medical plan (employee premium only)

insClass.description: Insurance classification: If offerTypeCode is not 'VOL', the system ignores the any value passed and automatically sets the insurance class based on the offer type. If offerTypeCode='VOL', you can pass any of the following in this field: 'M' (Medical), 'N' (Dental), 'V' (Vision), 'L' (Life), 'D' (Long-Term Disability), 'S' (Short-Term Disability), 'B' (Bond), or 'O' (other).

payeeId.description: payee identifier of the applicable benefit provider

costBasis.description: cost period associated with any premiums and contribution amounts: 'M' (Monthly), 'Q' (Quarterly), or 'Y' (Yearly)

manualCalc.description: manual calculation: 'Y' (coverage and premiums must be entered manually), 'C' (requires entry of coverage, but has rates for calculating the premium), or 'N' (fully automatic calculations)

autoAdd.description: Indicates whether employees are auto-enrolled in the plan if eligible: 'Y (Yes), 'N' (No), or 'C' (Company-Level Decision)

carrierEligMgmt.description: "true" indicates that the service provider is responsible for updating carrier eligibility information such as enrollments, terms, coverage modifications, or other changes which may affect carrier eligibility; otherwise "false" (default)

peoMasterPlan.description: "true" indicates whether this is a PEO master plan

ediFileIndicator.description: "true" indicates that the benefit plan is in the EDI file feed for reporting and tracking purposes, otherwise "false" (default)

prDednCode.description: payroll deduction code for the benefit plan

billCode.description: code used for billing; controls accounting and invoicing to clients for the benefit

offerTypeCode.description: offer type for including benefit plan in enrollments (PrismHR Benefits Enrollment only) 'MED' medical, 'VIS' vision, 'DEN' dental, 'VOL' voluntary benefits, 'LIF' life-basic, 'GTL' group term life , 'LTD' long term disability, 'STD' short term disability, 'GAP' gap insurance, 'ADD' accidental death and dismemberment, 'LIS' spouse only basic life, 'LIC' child only basic life, 'ANC' ancillary, 'CRI' critical illness, 'CAN' cancer benefits, 'MDP' domestic partner medical, 'DDP' domestic partner dental, 'VDP' domestic partner vision, 'ACC' accident benefits, 'LDA' additional ltd, 'SDA' additional std, 'BLX' basic life extra, 'HOS' voluntary hospitalization, 'IDT' identity theft, 'LGL' legal, 'CRL' critical illness as life, 'TEL' telehealth, 'WLI' whole life, 'BOND bond, 'PET pet benefits

section125.description: 'Y' if this is a section 125 plan

cobraElectable.description: 'Y' if benefit can be elected for COBRA coverage, otherwise 'N'

hdhpFlag.description: 'Y' indicates this is a high deductible health plan that makes enrolled employees eligible to participate in a health savings account

dpPlanId.description: plan identifier for associated domestic partner plan

clientSponsored.description: 'Y' indicates that clients sponsor this plan

premRateGroups.description: 'Y' indicates whether premium rates are maintained separately for each rate group

singleCoverageGrossWages.description: indicate if the benefit plan is employee-only. When this option is selected, the employee contribution must be defined as a percentage of the employee's earnings during setup of the benefit rules. Valid values are (Y)es, (N)o or empty

stateContinuation.description: identifies the state under which the plan is domiciled for state continuation purposes

disallowEEContrib.description: if true, selected Group Benefit Plan does not allow employee contribution and is client paid only. So when Benefit Rules are set for this Group Benefit Plan, this flag tells the client to not enter Employee Contributions for this Group Benefit Plan, else it will return an error

allowGrossWagePercentContrib.description: if true then the Percentage of Gross Wages is set as the employee contribution towards a medical plan (employee premium only)

useWorkState.description: 'Y' indicates to use work state instead of residential

stateIncExl.description: include or exclude states offering the selected group benefit plan. Allowed values: I=include or E=exclude

statesOfferedDetails.description: states where the plan is offered

planNetworks.description: networks in which the group benefit plan is offered

checksum.description: checksum to be used for updates

eeEligDays.description: initial eligibility days required to determine a late entrant enrollee

eeNewElig.description: guaranteed maximum level of life insurance coverage for newly eligible enrolles

neSalaryMultiplier.description: salary multiplier to use instead of a flat amount for newly eligible enrollees

eeOeEnroll.description: guaranteed maximum level of life insurance coverage for currently enrolled

oeSalaryMultiplier.description: currently enrolled salary multiplier instead of flat amount (whichever is less)

ceEeStepAmt.description: currently enrolled amount of step increase allowed, if any, for the employee

eeLeEnroll.description: guaranteed maximum level of life insurance coverage for late entrant eligible enrollees

leSalaryMultiplier.description: late entrant salary multiplier instead of flat amount (whichever is less)

giRounding.description: rounding method for guaranteed insurance limits: 'H' (next highest thousand/hundred/ten - auto-decide), 'L' (next lowest thousand/hundred/ten - auto-decide), 'HT' (next highest thousand), 'HH' (next highest hundred), 'HN' (next highest ten), 'TH' (next highest ten thousand), 'HD' (next highest dollar), 'LT' (next lowest thousand), 'LH' (next lowest hundred), 'LN' (next lowest ten), 'TL' (next lowest ten thousand), 'LD' (next lowest dollar), 'NT' (nearest thousand), 'NH' (nearest hundred), 'NN' (nearest ten), 'TN' (nearest ten thousand), or 'ND' (nearest dollar)

spNewElig.description: guaranteed maximum spouse level of life insurance coverage for newly eligible enrolles

spOeEnroll.description: guaranteed maximum spouse level of life insurance coverage for currently enrolled

ceSpStepAmt.description: currently enrolled amount of step increase allows, if any, for the spouse, up to the amount or salary multiplier

spLeEnroll.description: spouse guaranteed maximum level of life insurance coverage for late entrant eligible enrollees

depNewElig.description: dependent guaranteed maximum level of life insurance coverage for newly eligible enrollees

depOeEnroll.description: dependent guaranteed maximum level of life insurance coverage for currently enrolled

ceDpStepAmt.description: currently enrolled amount of step increase allowed, if any, for dependents, up to the amount or salary multiplier

dpLeEnroll.description: dependent guaranteed maximum level of life insurance coverage for late entrant eligible enrollees

familyRatedMed.description: 'Y' indicates this is a family-rated medical, dental, or vision plan

tobaccoBandedRates.description: 'Y' indicates this is a medical, dental, or vision plan that requires tobacco banded billing

genderBandedRates.description: 'Y' indicates this is a medical, dental, or vision plan that requires gender banded billing for the employee

spouseGenderBanded.description: 'Y' indicates this is a medical, dental, or vision plan that requires gender banded billing for the employee's spouse

wellnessBandedRates.description: 'Y' indicates this is a medical benefit plan banded by wellness rates

useWellnessRatesAsDefault.description: 'Y' indicates this is a medical benefit plan banded by wellness rates

ageBandMedicalBill.description: 'Y' indicates the plan requires age-banded billing; applies only to medical, dental, or vision plans

ageCalcMonth.description: age calculation month method used to calculate employees' age for insurance premium calculations: the number of the month or '-2' (calculate as of first of month of employee's birthday), '-1' (calculate as of employee's birthday) '0'  (calculate as first of month after employee's birthday)

ageCalcDay.description: day of the month at which to base employee's age calculation for insurance premium calculations; 0 to calculate first month after birthday

lifeCovOpts.description: coverage options: '1' (Employee Coverage Only), '2' (Employee/Spouse Coverage Only), or '3' (Employee/Dependent Coverage Only)

dependAgeLimit.description: age limit for dependents; any dependents who reach that age before the plan effective date are not eligible for coverage

dependAgeDeterminate.description: value indicates when the dependent age limit becomes effective. valid values are (D)-> On date of birth(DOB), (Y) -> End of DOB year , (M) -> End of DOB month

familyRatedMedDetails.description: details to establish any age band/count combination for covered dependents when family rated premium is selected

disabledDepEligible.description: indicates whether the disabled dependents who are above the age specified in the disabled alt age limit (who would otherwise be ineligible for coverage) are eligible for benefits. Valid values are (Y)es, (N)o or empty

disabledAltAgeLimit.description: value contains disabled alt age limit when disabled dep eligible is selected

zeroBillArrears.description: 'Y' to bill zero to the client on arrears vouchers; allowed only if there is no billing code for the plan

openEnrollDay.description: day of the month that open enrollment begins

flatCoverage.description: fixed amount of coverage for all benefit plan participants, typically used for life insurance plans; this amount overrides any existing rules

ltdStdPrem.description: 'Y' indicates LTD/STD based on salary instead of by coverage

ltdStdSalBand.description: 'Y' indicates LTD/STD rate tables are salary banded

lifeCalcType.description: type of premium calculation used if this is a life insurance benefit plan: 'T' (Rate per Thousand) or 'F' (Flat Amount)

spouseLifeAge.description: 'Y' if the system should use the employee's date of birth to calculate life insurance premiums for the spouse, otherwise the system uses the spouses' date of birth

payRateMonth.description: month in the year at which to base employee's pay rate for insurance coverage calculations

payRateDay.description: day of the month at which to base employee's pay rate for insurance coverage calculations

networkInfo.description: 'Y' to collect network data for this plan, otherwise 'N'

networkRates.description: 'Y' if premium rates are maintained separately for each network, otherwise 'N'

networkBillRates.description: indicate how billing rates are set: 'Y' (Billing rates are set by network), 'N' (Billing rates are set by rate group), or 'B' (Billing rates are set by network and rate group)

newDetailPayRate.description: 'Y' if the system should create new detail records during payroll initialization using the pay date as the effective date, otherwise the system creates detail records using the first of the month

midMonthCov.description: 'Y' if plan allows for mid-month coverage start/stop dates, otherwise coverage always starts at the first of the month and ends on the last day of the month

allowMidMonthCovLifeEvents.description: indicates whether to allow life events to have a mid month start, when the benefit pla begins on the first of the month. Valid values are (Y)es, (N)o or empty

wellnessBandedAssessDays.description: value indicates the number of days before or after the open enrollment effective date when the wellness assessment is due

wellnessAccessDaysMnths.description: value indicates the months before or after the open enrollment effective date when the wellness assessment is due

wellnessAccessBeforeAfter.description: value indicates before or after the open enrollment effective date when the wellness assessment is due

carrierType.description: the carrier type.  You can select Aetna (A), Humana (H), or Other (O). If A is selected, the plan type is specified in the aetnaType field

aetnaType.description: type of Aetna plan. Must be specified if the carrierType is A (Aetna). Values must be (H)MO, (N)on-HMO, (D)isability, (E) -> Dental, (V)ision

ltdStdLimit.description: long- or short-term disability limit (weekly for STD, monthly for LTD) to the salary amount used during calculations, if salary is the basis for the premium calculations

useExtPrecisionRates.description: 'Y' indicates the system uses extended precision (no limit to decimals) for premium and billing rates

depLifeCalcType.description: dependent life calculation type for life insurance: 'T' (Rate per Thousand) or 'F' (Flat Amount)

depLifeAge.description: 'Y' if the life insurance calculation for dependent premiums is age-banded, 'N' if the calculation uses a single rate

directlyCarried.description: 'Y' indicates employees pay the full premiums and coverage over the limit should not be taxed

renewalDay.description: benefit plan renewal day for the selected group benefit plan. Allowed values: any allowed dates for the renewalMonth

renewalMonth.description: benefit plan renewal month for the selected group benefit plan. Allowed values: 1 through 12

stateDependentOverride.description: if true, state level override(s) for Dependent Age Limits on the Group Benefit Plan setup exists

coverageEndsOn.description: the date when the benefit coverage under the selected group benefit plan ends.  Valid values are: D01 - D31 day of the month, "T" indicates employee's date of termination, "E" indicates end of the month following termination date, "X" when employee's term date <= 15th of the month then benefits end 15th of month else end of month,  "EX" when employee's term date <= Xth of month benefits stop end of previous month else end of current month

useBillingWashRule.description: if true, billing wash rule is enabled at the global level for the selected group benefit plan unless there is an override set for the client on the Benefit Plan Setup form

washRuleDate.description: the date on or before which billing wash rule will apply. Allowed value: 10-20 or enter 31 for last date of the month

participationReqDate.description: the date the clients must meet the participation requirement. Please enter date as YYYY-MM-DD format or leave empty

participationReqPerc.description: participation requirement percentage. Must be a value from 1 to 100

networkId.description: identifier for the network service area

zipCodesExist.description: Indicates whether ZIP codes exist for the network. The API does not update this value. If ZIP codes exist in the system for the network ID, Yes is returned. To enter network ZIP codes in PrismHR, select Network Zip Codes in the Actions menu for the Group Benefit Plans form.

networkInactive.description: 'Y' indicates to deactivate the network at the system level

hdhpMaxContrib.description: maximum contribution amount that can be made to the employee's HSA at this level of coverage

hsaMatch.description: annual HSA match amount for the coverage tier

carrierCode1.description: carrier code 1 for tracking the plan

carrierCode2.description: carrier code 2 for tracking the plan

typeObseleteDate.description: date when a plan type expires, if any

spouseDOBForDependent.description: whether to use the spouse date of birth for medical, dental, and vision calculations

useDedBillCode.description: whether to bill using the deduction bill code

skipRpt5500.description: 'Y' to exclude this plan from the Form 5500 Annual Benefit Report, otherwise it is included

excludeEligReport.description: whether to exclude the plan from printing on eligibility reports

excludeBillingReport.description: whether to exclude the plan from printing on billing reports

stubName.description: description of the benefit that will print on employees' check remittance

termDate.description: date on which plan was terminated

reconGroup.description: code to allow multiple benefit plans to be reconciled together to be entered quickly in the Benefit Import Recon

maxDaysPrior.description: maximum number of days prior to the current date that an effective date (enrollment or termination) can be back-dated

commType.description: commission type code that distinguishes this benefit plan for calculating commissions

suppressPrintOnCheck.description: whether to print the benefit plan on pay stubs

allowDescOvr.description: 'N' if the description cannot be overridden at the client level, otherwise description can be changed at the client level

suppArrears.description: valid values are (Y)es, (N)o, don't (B)ill arrears amount either, or blank (""). 'Y' and 'B' will suppress deductions from going to arrears when employee is not paid or has insufficient pay; 'B' also prevents billing arrears amount

bondEPLIAddTipsForCalc.description: whether to include tips in calculations on bond insurance or EPLI (employment practices liability insurance) benefit plans

reportOnW2.description: indicates whether to report value of benefit plan on Form W-2

w2ReportCost.description: 'Y' to report the premium cost, not premium billed, on Form W-2 (using code DD)

riskFactorByNetwork.description: 'Y' if risk factors vary by network

stdLimitRounding.description: whether to calculate short-term disability as long-term disability (rate per hundred), and whether to limit salary rounding during calculation for Life plans

replacementPlan.description: the plan that replaces this one when the termDate is reached

ageRateDateFixedRateGuaranty.description: number of years guaranty for a medical, dental, or vision plan that requires age-banded billing

specOptgYears.description: number of years guaranty for a medical, dental, or vision plan that requires age-banded billing

useCurrentYearForAgeCalc.description: whether to use the current year for employee age calculations

roundSalaryForBasis.description: whether to round up short-term and long-term disability plan calculations

ageCalcOnCoverage.description: whether to use the employee's age at the time of the coverage start date, if it is greater than the age calculated by the plan based on the plan settings

excludeMedLimitCalc.description: 'Y' if the plan is excluded from Hawaii medical contribution calculation

calcDepG.description: whether to calculate imputed income on dependent life coverage. This option must be selected if this is an employer-paid dependent coverage life plan

deMinimusAmt.description: dependent life coverage de minimus amount

subtractDeMin.description: indicates whether to subtract de minimus amount from dependent coverage amount

skipAcaReporting.description: 'Y' indicates that the plan is excluded from ACA (Affordable Care Act) reporting

selfInsured.description: 'Y' indicates that the plan is self-insured

notAcaMec.description: 'Y' indicates that the plan does not meet the ACA minimum essential coverage requirements

notAcaMv.description: 'Y' indicates that the plan does not meet ACA minimum value requirements

reportAcaEmployee.description: whether the medical plan covers employees, for ACA reporting

reportAcaSpouse.description: whether the medical plan covers a spouse, for ACA reporting. You can select (Y)es, (N)o, or (C)onditional

reportAcaDependents.description: whether the medical plan covers employees' dependents

suppressFlatByPlan.description: whether this benefit plan should not be included when billing is based on a flag amount per benefit plan class

suppressFlatByOffer.description: whether to suppress flat billing by offer type

suppressAllOnArrears.description: whether to suppress all processing on arrears vouchers

statesOffered.description: two-character postal code for state where benefit plan is offered

webEnroll.description: 'Y' if this plan can be offered to employees on the web during enrollments, otherwise 'N'

anytimeEnrollWorkflow.description: whether to include this plan in the Anytime Enrollment Workflow type

carrierUrl.description: URL for the insurance carrier's page that provides details about this benefit plan

planDescUrl.description: URL for the description page for this plan

approvalRequired.description: 'Y' enrolls employees in the plan with enrollment status 'P' (pending), which would then be manually changed to 'A' (active) after approval

onHrpDisplayBenType.description: code used for "display groupings" in OnHRP product

collectPcpInfo.description: indicates whether this plan requires employees to enter primary care physician (PCP) information during enrollments; common for HMOs

pcpRequired.description: whether primary care physician information is required during the enrollment

onAttrCode.description: process attributes that apply to the benefit plan

items.description: process attributes that apply to the benefit plan

fromAge.description: The starting age for each line

toAge.description: The upper age limit for each line

wellnessBillAmount.description: The wellness bill amount billed to the client for the plan type and age group

employeeBillPremAmount.description: The billing or premium amount to bill the employee for this plan

dependentBillPremAmount.description: The billing or premium amount to bill the dependent for this plan

employeeTobaccoPremium.description: The amount billed to the client for the plan type and age group for tobacco using employees

employeeNonTobaccoPremium.description: The amount billed to the client for the plan type and age group for non-tobacco using employees

depNonTobaccoPremium.description: cost associated with covering an employee's non-tobacco using spouse for this plan type and age group

depTobaccoPremium.description: cost associated with covering an employee's tobacco using spouse for this plan type and age group

nonWellnessBillAmount.description: The non wellness bill amount billed to the client for the plan type and age group

depWellnessBillAmount.description: cost associated with covering an employee's dependent for this plan type and age group

nonSmokerPremium.description: The amount billed to the client for the plan type and age group for non-tobacco using employees

smokerPremium.description: The amount billed to the client for the plan type and age group for tobacco using employees

smokingSpousePremium.description: The cost for a spouse who uses tobacco products

nonSmokingSpousePremium.description: The cost for covering an employee's non-tobacco using spouse for this plan type and age group

disabilityPremiumAmount.description: premium Rate per ten dollars of coverage (short-term disability) or hundred dollars of coverage (long-term disability)

fromAnnualSalary.description: The From Annual Salary amount. The first From Annual Salary value must be zero.

toAnnualSalary.description: The To Annual Salary amount. Each subsequent value is one cent greater than the To Annual Salary in the previous band.

tobaccoSurcharge.description: The surcharge for tobacco use, if any

ratePerHundred.description: The premium cost for bond insurance expressed as an amount per hundred dollars of employee earnings. The rate relates to the Cost Basis field in the Group Benefit Plans form. For example, if the cost basis is Monthly, the rate represents monthly premium costs

networkId.description: identifier for the network service area

rateGroup.description: rate group for which the rates apply

effectiveDate.description: The date when the rate goes into effect. Please enter date as YYYY-MM-DD format or leave empty

tpaTypeCode.description: third-party type code that corresponds to the billing rate. Valid values are S(ingle), C(ouple), P(arent plus 1 child), Q (Parent plus more than one child), and F(amily)

coverageClass.description: insurance coverage class. Valid values are S(ingle), D(ual), and F(amily)

coverSpouse.description: whether or not this plan covers the spouse: Y(es), N(o), or O(nly covers spouse)

dependentMinMaxType.description: whether the plan can cover the employee's dependents. Valid values are RD (regular dependent), DP (domestic partner children), and B (both)

maxDependent.description: maximum number of dependents to include

minDependent.description: minimum number of dependents to include

spouseRequired.description: whether this plan requires the employee to have a spouse

domesticPartnerRequired.description: whether this plan requires the employee to have a domestic partner

checksum.description: for future development. Checksum to use for update operation.

enrollmentType.description: specifies who can enroll in the plan (employee, spouse, child, etc.)

docRequired.description: whether supporting documents are required for this life event

windowLength.description: the number of days from the effective date during which an employee can complete the life event enrollment

daysToNotify.description: number of days, from the date of the life event itself, when the employee must notify the employer of the life event in order to be eligible for enrollment

initiatedBy.description: who can initiate or assign the life event (C - client, E - employee, B - both, or empty)

sourceOfEffDate.description: what the system uses to determine the effective date for the life event when coverage changes (N - date notified, E - life event date, or R - use benefit rule)

docVerbiage.description: message that informs the user about the required documentation for this event

offerType.description: type of benefit plan offered for the life event (medical, dental, disability, etc.)

offerTypeDescription.description: description of type of benefit plan offered for the life event

allowPlanChange.description: whether this life event permits benefit plan changes

unenrollmentType.description: specifies who can un-enroll from the plan (employee, spouse, child, etc.)

coveredSsn.description: Social Security number of covered dependent

coveredDob.description: date of birth of covered dependent

coveredYearFlag.description: whether the dependent was covered for the full year

coveredMonths.description: the list of months in which dependents were covered

items.description: the list of months in which dependents were covered

offerCode.description: ACA offer code calculated for this month

eeShare.description: employee contribution associated with the lowest cost benefit plan for this employee

safeHarbor.description: ACA safe harbor code calculated for this month

lowestCostPlanId.description: ID of the lowest cost benefit plan for this employee

lowestCostPlanType.description: type of the lowest cost benefit plan for this employee

enrolledInSelfEnsured.description: whether the employee is enrolled in a self-insured benefit plan

acaHoursWorked.description: hours worked by this employee in this month, according to the calculation standards of the ACA

inStabilityPeriodFlag.description: whether this month is a part of the employee's ACA stability period (used for newly hired employees)

statusClass.description: employee status classification (A - Active, L - Leave, or T- Terminated)

activeInMonth.description: whether or not the employee was active in this month

lowestCost.description: contribution amount associated with the lowest cost benefit plan

planYearStart.description: start date of the lowest cost benefit plan

monthlyEmployer.description: employer of this employee in this month

monthlyLocation.description: worksite location of this employee in this month

dailyHours.description: hours of leave taken on the date

LeaveHourDetails.description: details of the requested leave hours

leaveType.description: code indicating the type of leave requested. This corresponds to an absence code in the system

leaveTypeDescription.description: description of the leave type code

status.description: PTO request status ID P (Paid), N (Pending), C (Cancelled), A (Approved), D(Denied)

leaveRequest.description: ID number for this leave request

checksum.description: checksum for this PTO request

startDate.description: start date for PTO request, in YYYY-MM-DD format

endDate.description: end date for PTO request, in YYYY-MM-DD format

comments.description: other comments provided by employee in their request

leaveDates.description: dates to which PTO request applies

items.description: dates to which PTO request applies

vouchers.description: number of the voucher on which the PTO request appears. Value only displays after the leave request is paid

items.description: number of the voucher on which the PTO request appears. Value only displays after the leave request is paid

leaveHours.description: total number of requested leave hours

leaveHourDetails.description: details of the requested leave hours

absenceCodeReason.description: description of the PTO absence code

ptoRegisterTypeCode.description: type code associated with the PTO request

approverId.description: ID of the leave request approver

denyReason.description: reason for leave request denial; note that this may be included in the email notification to the employee .

carryOverHours.description: hours carried over from previous year

accruedHoursYTD.description: PTO hours accrued year-to-date for this register

usedHoursYTD.description: PTO hours used year-to-date for this register

yearEndDate.description: date on which the PTO register year ends

accruedThru.description: date through which the employee has accrued PTO hours

benefitStart.description: date on which the PTO benefit plan begins

carryOverExpires.description: date on which the carried over PTO hours expire

items.description: absence journal identifiers

specialRequirements.description: Use specialRequirements to indicate whether this position requires any special physical or mental requirements. The Americans with Disabilities Act prohibits employers from discriminating against qualified individuals with disabilities. Not including a particular person in the applicant pool for a certain job is only nondiscriminatory if that person does not meet any physical or mental requirements identified as essential functions of the position. Applications for these jobs must be closely monitored for ADA compliance.

indirectTipped.description: indicates whether this position is eligible for indirect tips

dotFlag.description: indicates whether this position has special requirements as set forth by the U.S. Department of Transportation

wcLocationBased.description: indicates whether to calculate workers' compensation accruals for each employee's actual work location; overrides the setting in Client Details/Company Master

flsaExempt.description: indicates whether this position is FLSA exempt

eeoJobGroup.description: EEO position/job group associated with the position classification

eeoJobClass.description: EEO class code associated with the position classification

wcClassResult.description: state-specific W/C classes associated with the position classification;this is for use with positions performed by employees working at locations in those states

validActions.description: human resources action(s) to which reason applies: 'H' (New Hire), 'P' (Pay Rate Change), 'J' (Job Change), 'L' (Leave of Absence), 'E' (Reactivation), 'T' (Termination), 'R' (Rehire), 'S' (Status/Type Change), 'D' (Department Transfer), 'C' (Location Transfer), or 'X' (test)

obsolete.description: whether or not this reason code is obsolete

obsoleteDate.description: date when this reason code is no longer valid

tpaSeparationCode.description: code used by a third-party when your organization reports the action. Use this field if the reason code is for actions (usually terminations).

terminationType.description: type of termination this reason code applies to

regPayCode.description: regular pay code associated with the shift

otPayCode.description: overtime pay code associated with the shift

otPayFactor.description: overtime pay factor for the shift

inclInPayRate.description: indicates whether to add the shift's differential pay to employees' regular pay rate, otherwise it uses a separate pay code

otDiffStraigtPay.description: indicates whether to calculate the differential on overtime pay using the straight pay rate

obsolete.description: indicates whether the status is no longer used

validActions.description: human resources action(s) to which type applies: 'H' (New Hire), 'P' (Pay Rate Change), 'J' (Position Change), 'L' (Leave of Absence), 'E' (Reactivation), 'T' (Termination), 'R' (Rehire), 'S' (Status/Type Change), or 'D' (Department Transfer)

seasonal.description: indicates if this is a seasonal employee type

statutoryEmployee.description: indicates if this employee type is for statutory employees as defined by the IRS

onlineBenefitsElig.description: indicates if this employee type can use Benefits Enrollment

autoTermIneligBenefits.description: indicates if the system should cancel ineligible benefits when employees of this type are terminated

autoEnrollEligBenefits.description: indicates if system can automatically enroll employees of this type in eligible benefit plans

obsolete.description: indicates if this employee type code is no longer used

serviceProviderOnly.description: indicator to hide the Employee Type field from users with the Worksite Manager or Worksite Trusted Advisor user role in any form that requires an employee type

eventDate.description: date on which the event occurs

details.description: any other information about this event

checksum.description: any other information about this event

CompanyEvent.description: events associated with a specific client

companyEvents.description: events associated with a specific client

status.description: current status of client

cityTaxRate.description: tax rate to apply to gross earnings

CityTax.description: special city taxes for this location

eligibleEmployer.description: taxpayer entities/employers associated with this worksite location, if more than one exists

clSutaStart.description: date on which the location-based SUI begins

clSutaEnd.description: date on which the location-based SUI ends

clSutaStateId.description: state ID number for this location

LocationBasedSUI.description: SUTA reporting information for this worksite location if enabled for client

contactName.description: name of contact at worksite location

LocationContact.description: contact information for this client, including name, title, email address, telephone, and fax number.

locationObsolete.description: whether the worksite location is obsolete

geoCode.description: Vertex GeoCode where the worksite is located

addressLine2.description: additional address location for street address (such as floor or suite number)

workCompState.description: state under which the worksite is covered by workers' compensation insurance

remoteLocation.description: whether to treat the employee's location as a remote work location for tax purposes; the worksite GeoCode will be ignored and taxes will be based on the employee's resident GeoCode; Workers' Compensation will also follow the resident GeoCode when enabled on the Benefits tab of Client Details

locationContact.description: contact information for this client, including name, title, email address, telephone, and fax number.

eligibleBenefitPlans.description: information about benefit plans specific to this location.

items.description: information about benefit plans specific to this location.

locationBasedSUI.description: SUTA reporting information for this worksite location if enabled for client

glCode.description: G/L segment code to use as an alternative to the Location Code

glCode2.description: G/L segment code to substitute for EELOC2 in G/L code routines

ovrClientAccting.description: client accounting template to use instead of the one defined at the client level

salesTaxCode.description: sales tax code to charge for employees who have this worksite assigned as their home location

clSutaFein.description: worksite federal EIN if different from client

orTransit.description: applicable type of OR Transit Tax if location is in Oregon

sbTaxPcnt.description: MI SB Tax Percent amount if the location is in Michigan

wcPolicyId.description: workers' comp policy for this location; overrides the client-level policy

addDate.description: date the location was added to the client

workSiteId.description: worksite identifier if required by the state (such as MN); reporting unit number used in 601 record for MasterTax RTS file and for AK-GeoCode

flsaRuleSet.description: FLSA ruleset applicable to this location

unionLocation.description: indicates whether this is a union location; informational only, does not affect union calculations

tipFlsaRuleSet.description: FLSA ruleset for tipped employees at this location

eeoUnitNbr.description: EEO unit number assigned to this location by the EEO Commission

eeoOvrLocn.description: worksite location to use if employees assigned to this location should appear under another location in the alternate EEO download

dfltOvrWorkGeoCode.description: override work GeoCode setting: '' (Use Work GeoCode Listed), 'R' or 'Y' (Override Work GeoCode with Resident GeoCode), 'H' (Override Work GeoCode with Home Location GeoCode), or 'T' (Override Time Sheet GeoCode with Resident GeoCode)

entityId.description: client federal entity ID if different from client level

sbeaInEligibilityPeriods.description: dates when location did not pass the 85% test for certification under SBEA

deptCode.description: default department code for new hires assigned to this location

divCode.description: default division code for new hires assigned to this location

projectCode.description: default project code for new hires assigned to this location

cityTaxes.description: special city taxes for this location

storyCount.description: number of floors in the building

highestFlrOccupied.description: highest floor occupied by the client at this location

yearBuilt.description: year in which the building was constructed

sprinklers.description: 'Y' if the building is equipped with sprinklers, otherwise 'N'

maxCapacity.description: maximum number of employees who can be on site at the same time

adultAge.description: age that this location classifies as adult; employees under that age are considered minors

obsoleteDate.description: date on which this location becomes obsolete

eeo1QuestionD2.description: appropriate answer to EEO-1 question D2 for this location, (Y)es or (N)o. This value populates on the EEO-1 report

payGroup.description: default pay group assigned to this worksite location

subjToOhioSers.description: custom feature: whether or not this location is subject to the Ohio School Employees Retirement System withholding

takeOnFacility.description: indicates whether this is a takeon facility

enableRemoteVerification.description: whether to allow I-9 Approvers to remotely examine a new hire's I-9 supporting documents, using an alternative procedure authorized by the Department of Homeland Security; E-Verify must be enabled for the client and worksite location.

eeoFedContractor.description: whether this client's worksite location is a federal contractor.

eeoUniqueEntity.description: twelve-character business identifier issued by the System for Award Management; this is only used when eeoFedContractor is true; if eeoFedContractor is false and this attribute is set to an empty string, the existing value is cleared. Note: the ID must contain twelve characters and no special characters, but these requirements are NOT validated by the system.

naicsCode.description: NAICS classification code for this worksite location, which is only necessary if this differs from the NAICS code of other client locations; must be an existing NAICS code in PrismHR. Note that the EEO-1 build will fail if this code is marked obsolete.

checksum.description: checksum retrieved from ClientMasterService.getClientLocationDetails operation to use for updates

minRateDate.description: date on which minimum wage rate goes into effect

minWage.description: minimum hourly wage for this location

minCashWage.description: minimum cash wage for this location

minWageMinor.description: minimum hourly wage for minors if different from adults

minCashWageMinor.description: minimum cash wage for minors if different from adults

sbeaFailStartDate.description: starting date of range when location was ineligible under SBEA

sbeaFailEndingDate.description: ending date of range when location was ineligible under SBEA

SbeaInEligibilityPeriod.description: dates when location did not pass the 85% test for certification under SBEA

checkAcct.description: check issuing account from which to draw payroll checks

achAcct.description: ACH issuing account from which to draw direct deposit transactions

garnCheckAcct.description: check issuing account from which to draw garnishment checks

garnEFTCheckAcct.description: ACH issuing account from which to draw garnishment EFT payments

locAchStatus.description: locations ACH status. Valid values are empty, A (active), I (Inactive), N (non-ach)

abaNumber.description: ABA/routing number for the financial institution, used only for split ACH debits

checkSave.description: indicates whether the account is a checking or savings account. Valid values are empty, C or S.

altCostCtr.description: cost center for employees assigned to this alternate employer; if empty, the system defaults to the client's primary cost center

altCheckingAcct.description: payroll checking account used by the employer

altAchAcct.description: ACH account used by the employer

altDisplayName.description: if suppressClientAccess = "N", this name displays during new hire entry to identify the employer as a selectable option

suppressClientAccess.description: "Y" or empty = this employer is not displayed or selectable on the New Hire form, "N" = the employer is selectable on the New Hire form

loanDeductionCodeId.description: deduction code identifier for voluntary or employee loan

billEvtSpecialFrom.description: first date when special rate goes into effect

billEvtSpecialTo.description: last date when special rate expires

billFixedSpecFrom.description: first date when special rate goes into effect

billFixedSpecTo.description: last date when special rate expires

id.description: unique ID code for the client company

costCenter.description: cost center for processing accounting transactions

subCostCenter.description: sub-cost center for processing accounting transactions

serviceType.description: Service provided to client: 'ASO' (Administrative Services Only), 'PEO' (Professional Employer Services), 'PAY' (Payroll Processing Only), 'ASA' (Admin Services/Alt. Billing), 'COR' (Corporate Payroll), or 'HRN' (HR Services, No Payroll).

categoryCode.description: industry in which the client does business

arClientNumber.description: client ID to use for billing, if not this client

divisionRequired.description: indicates whether employees must be assigned to a division for time sheets/labor allocation

departmentRequired.description: indicates whether employees must be assigned to a department for time sheets/labor allocation

shiftRequired.description: indicates whether employees must be assigned to a shift for time sheets/labor allocation

empNumbersUsed.description: indicates whether to assign employees an employee number unique to the client organization

autoEmpNumber.description: indicates whether to generate employee numbers automatically

worksitePayrollApproval.description: determine the payroll approval process for the client.  N (Disabled), Y (Standard) (default), M (Multistep)

projectRequired.description: indicates whether employees must be assigned to a project for time sheets/labor allocation

workGroupRequired.description: indicates whether the workgroup is required

payrollDate.description: first payroll date processed for this client

status.description: client status code,corresponding to one of the following status classes: A (Active), P (Pending), I (Inactive), C (Client Cancelling, Pre-Termination) and T (Terminated)

deliverChecks.description: location to deliver payroll checks 'H' (employees' homes), 'L' (worksite locations), 'M' (main client location), 'P' (paperless), or 'U' (client will pick up the checks)

employerId.description: employer ID to which to assign this client's employees

minCheckAmt.description: minimum check amount that requires validation

maxCheckAmt.description: maximum check amount that requires validation

deliveryMethod.description: method for delivering payroll to client

mainPhoneExt.description: Extension of main company phone number; should just be the extension number, no alpha characters such as 'x' or 'ext'

mainPhone.description: area code and local number for the client's primary telephone number

emailAddress.description: primary email address used to contact the client

groupCode.description: used to allow selection and grouping of clients

tpaDownloadOptions.description: the type of third-party administrator download options used for the client

hoursType1.description: Pay Code 1 in the PrismHR UI

hoursType2.description: Pay Code 2 in the PrismHR UI

hoursType3.description: Pay Code 3 in the PrismHR UI

hoursType4.description: Pay Code 4 in the PrismHR UI

hoursType5.description: Pay Code 5 in the PrismHR UI

hoursType6.description: Pay Code 6 in the PrismHR UI

hoursType9.description: Pay Code 9 in the PrismHR UI

flatType1.description: Pay Code 7 in the PrismHR UI

flatType2.description: Pay Code 8 in the PrismHR UI

extraHeading1.description: Pay Code 10 in the PrismHR UI

corporationType.description: must be one of the following single-character values: 'L' (Limited Liability Corporation), 'S' (S-Corporation), 'C' (C-Corporation), 'I' (Individual/Sole Proprieter), 'P' (Partnership), 'A' (Limited Partnership), 'M' (Limited Liability Partnership), 'R' (Professional Corporation), 'V' (Personal Service Corporation), 'B' (Board Owned), 'J' (Joint Venture), 'T' (Tax Exempt), 'U' (Trust), 'H' (Church Organization), 'N' (Not for Profit), or 'O' (Other).

controlGroupCompany.description: ID of the client that will act as the Master Client ID for the 401(k) Control Group

glClientNo.description: company designation used to build the general ledger account number

billTemplate.description: billing template used to compute client billing

wcPolicy.description: worker's compensation insurance policy that covers the client's employees

wcPolicyEffDate.description: effective date for client's workers compensation insurance coverage

wcLocationBased.description: if true, indicates that the W/C Calculation Option field is set to Time Sheet Location Based; the system associates the employee with their time sheet worksite location during Workers' Compensation calculations

flsaRuleset.description: FLSA ruleset used to process the payroll

flsaWeekEnds.description: Day of the week on which the FLSA work week ends: 1 - Monday, 2 - Tuesday, 3 - Wednesday, 4 - Thursday, 5 - Friday, 6 - Saturday, or7 - Sunday.

satPayOnDay.description: Day of week to adjust pay date if scheduled pay date is a Saturday: 1 - Monday, 2 - Tuesday, 3 - Wednesday, 4 - Thursday, 5 - Friday, or blank - no change; pay date on Saturday.

sunPayOnDay.description: Day of week to adjust pay date if scheduled pay date is a Sunday: 1 - Monday, 2 - Tuesday, 3 - Wednesday, 4 - Thursday, 5 - Friday, or blank - no change; pay date on Sunday.

satPayBefAft.description: indicates whether to pay before or after when the pay date falls on Saturday

sunPayBefAft.description: indicates whether to pay before or after when the pay date falls on a Sunday

contractDate.description: date on which the contract was signed

benefitParentClient.description: ID of another client that acts as the 'parent' to this client, for benefits purposes

payCode.description: pay codes used for this client; leave blank to make all available

deductionCode.description: deduction codes used for this client; leave blank to make all available

annualHours.description: annual hours worked in a year by an employee, typically 2080 (52 weeks x 40 hours)

billBySort.description: Sort order to use for billings, which causes subtotals: 'DV' (Division), 'LC' (Location), 'DP' (Department), 'SH' (Shift), or it can be a combination, concatenated with periods.

billInvBreakField.description: segment of the billBySort that causes an invoice break

consultant.description: ID of the consultant assigned to this client

salesperson.description: ID of the user responsible for sales to the client

payrollRep.description: ID of the user responsible for processing the client's payroll

checkIssueAcct.description: ID of the checking account from which to draw checks to pay employees

checkPrintStyle.description: Code for the special check style to use for the client; if blank, system uses standard check style.

invoiceCopies.description: number of invoices to print for the client during processing

remitCopies.description: number of remittance copies to print during payroll processing

receiptCheckAcct.description: account for ACH or credit card receipts

adjAchDays.description: Number of days (which can be negative) by which to adjust the processing of the ACH. Please note this only avoids weekends, not bank holidays.

garnCheckIssueAcct.description: ID of the checking account from which to draw garnishment checks

directDepositAccount.description: Account from which direct deposit (ACH) amounts are drawn. If left blank, the Payroll Account (checkIssueAcct) is used

manualAccount.description: Account from which manual checks are drawn. A value is required in this field if manual checks are entered with the Pay Check Calculator

onDemandChecksAccount.description: Account from which manual checks are drawn for On Demand Check processing

payCardAccount.description: Account used to pay cards/debit cards

nesOffset.description: Number of days to delay billing the New Employee Setup fees. If used, a termination before this date reverses the NES.

rateOrMarkup.description: indicates whether amount will be a rate or a markup factor for job rate clients

billAddrClientId.description: client ID of the client company whose billing address should be used in place of this client's address (e.g., parent company)

newHireAlert.description: Indicates who should receive the Web New Hire alert message: 'P' (Payroll Representative), 'H' or blank (H/R Consultant), 'S' (Salesperson), or it can be a combination.

clientAccountingCode.description: standard client account to use for the client, unless overridden at location

garnEftIssueAcct.description: ID of the checking account from which to draw CS EFT direct deposits

cutbackCheckAcct.description: ID of the checking account from which to draw cutback checks

broker.description: Broker code for the client. Brokers must be defined in the Internal Staff Codes as a Position Code K.

onboardStatus.description: Deprecated. Instead, please use the attributes in enrollOnboardControls.

nyMctOvrRate.description: Rate based on total company payroll expense. If blank, system uses default rate to calculate the tax.

naicsCode.description: North American Industrial Classification System code

benefitRep.description: ID of the client's benefits representative

riskManager.description: ID of the client's risk manager

handbookId.description: document number or code for the handbook used by the client

aftPostPreMailThreshold.description: invoice total threshold required to place payroll on hold for the client

achHoldThreshold.description: invoice total threshold required to place all ACH credits on hold for the client

taxLimitBasis.description: Determines the taxable limit basis used for client billing: 'E' (Employer) or 'C' (Client). This overrides the flag at the global level.

glTemplateCode.description: G/L template code used by client

nySdiEmployerRate.description: premium rate (per employee/per month) paid by the employer for New York disability insurance

wcPolicySubId.description: memo field indicating a 'sub ID' policy ID for the client

deduct401kOnSupp.description: indicates whether to take a 401(k) deferral on supplemental pay

recomputeOvertime.description: indicates whether the system recomputes overtime when fixed payment amounts such as bonuses or commission are paid in Regularly Scheduled batches

jobRates.description: indicates whether the client's bill rates and pay rates are set by job code (position)

processingSchedule.description: payroll processing schedule assigned to the client

perDiemRateSource.description: Source record of the rate to use for Per Diems calculated using the Percentage Method: 'J' (Job Record), or 'D' or blank (Departments).

clientAccounting.description: Indicates whether this client is getting accounting. If set to Yes, initializations will fail if all revenues are not accounted for.

adjTipShortfall.description: indicates whether to adjust taxes to cover cash shortfall

suppressAutoBenAdj.description: indicates whether to suppress automatic calculation of benefit adjustments

suppressEmpAch.description: indicates whether to suppress the creation of any ACH credit transactions for any of the client's employees

singlePayGroup.description: indicates whether to create separate payroll batches for multiple pay groups that are paid on the same day

elecPayStub.description: Electronic pay stubs are 'N' not used, 'Y' employee may not unenroll, 'E' employee may unenroll

useWcRateTemplate.description: indicates whether to use table-based rate templates instead of the traditional method when calculating worker's comp for this client

calcWcOn1099Emp.description: indicates whether to calculate worker's comp for 1099 employees

wvUseFedMinRate.description: indicates whether the client is subject only to the federal minimum wage; only applies to West Virginia work states

elecW2Form.description: indicates whether all employees will receive electronic W-2 forms

nySdiEmployerCalc.description: indicates whether the system should calculate employer-paid New York disability tax for each employee

pfmlMa1099.description: whether the employee is a 1099 contractor in Massachusetts and therefore subject to paid family and medical leave (PFML) tax withholdings; if true, the system accrues and bills these taxes to the employer

railRoadEmployer.description: whether the client is a railroad employer, which significantly affects tax calculation; see the PrismHR documentation for details

taxGeoCodeOverride.description: indicates the Vertex GeoCode the system will use for tax calculations instead of the default; allowed options are empty string (no override), "R" (Override Work GeoCode with Resident GeoCode), "H" (Override Work Geocode with Home Location GeoCode), "T" (Override T/S GeoCode with Resident GeoCode); see the PrismHR help for details

adjTipsToMin.description: indicates whether the system should adjust reported tips to meet minimum wage level

doNotService.description: indicates whether to disable payroll processing

clientModDiscount.description: indicates whether to use the W/C Accrual Modifiers found at the client level when calculating worker's comp liability

aftPostPreMailHold.description: indicates whether to hold items based on aftPostPreMailThreshold

clientHdhp.description: indicates whether the client maintains HDHP for their employees, and whether to suppress the system's validation when setting up an employee HSA

financialInst.description: indicates whether the client is a financial institution

newHireOnBoard.description: Deprecated. Instead, please use the attributes in enrollOnboardControls. indicates whether new hire electronic onboarding is available

newHireBenEnroll.description: Deprecated. Instead, please use the attributes in enrollOnboardControls. indicates whether electronic benefits enrollment is available

paperlessDelivery.description: indicates whether the client receives hard-copy checks or invoices/reports; must be one of these values: 'N' = Inactive (no paperless delivery; print everything for the client (default value for new clients), 'Y' = All payroll output (client receives all payroll output (invoices, reports, etc.) electronically, therefore do not specify deliveryMethod), 'C' = Checks/advices only (client receives checks and advices electronically, and printed invoices and reports), 'R' = Invoice/reports only (client receives invoices(s) and reports electronically and printed checks and advices), 'D' = All Payroll Output, Delivery Sheet only.

clientAgrmtRecvDate.description: the date when the client agreement was received

invoiceNotes.description: notes to print on each invoice

items.description: notes to print on each invoice

faxBackNotes.description: notes specific to the client that should print on each Fax Back Report

items.description: notes specific to the client that should print on each Fax Back Report

featureCode.description: custom feature codes that apply to the client

items.description: custom feature codes that apply to the client

achStatus.description: indicates the ACH (direct deposit) status for the client: A (active), I (inactive), L (ACH by client location; set up in PrismHR), D (ACH by client division; set up in PrismHR), W (wire transfer client), P (prenote; ACH not yet active), or E (EDI client; specialized usage)

eligibleBenefitsDeterminant.description: indicates whether to make benefits available to an employee based on department (D), division (V), location (L), or benefit group (B). If this field is empty then All Plans are Eligible. Based on this determining factor, the system checks which benefits employees are eligible for.

wcResidentBased.description: if true, indicates that the W/C Calculation Option field is set to Resident State Based; if the employees Worksite Location is marked as a Remote Location, the system associates the employee with their resident GeoCode during Workers' Compensation calculations

relatedCode.description: corresponds to the Related Code field in the Other tab of Client Details

instantPayAccount.description: checking account that is configured to use the ACH originator associated with the Instant Pay format; required if Instant Pay features are enabled for this client

remoteVerification.description: whether to enable Form I-9 remote verification for this client

statusClass.description: client status class, associated with the client status; A (Active), P (Pending), I (Inactive), C (Client Cancelling, Pre-Termination) and T (Terminated)

selfServicePayroll.description: whether the client processes its own payrolls ("Y" or "N"); "Y" is not allowed if worksiteTimeSheetEntry = "Y"

selfServiceRestrictions.description: indicates the payroll actions the client cannot perform; valid values are "1" (Print) and "2" (Finalize and Print); this field can only be updated if selfServicePayroll = "Y"

worksiteTimesheetEntry.description: "Y" if users at the worksite location enter time sheet information; "N" or empty otherwise. "Y" is not allowed if selfServicePayroll = "Y".

allowFirstPeriodHours.description: whether you can enter prorated hours for new hire employees with start dates that fall within the current pay period; the First Period Hours feature must be enabled in System Parameters in order to update this field; allowed values are empty string (use system default), "E" (enabled), and "D" (disabled)

enableInstantPay.description: indicates if Instant Pay feature is enabled for the client

nextEmployeeNumber.description: the next ID number to automatically assign to a new hire for this client; updates are only allowed if autoEmpNumber = "Y"

altEmployer.description: object containing information on alternate employer(s), if any

sdiDedn.description: state disability insurance tax deduction information

reportFee.description: special reports to print for the client, or standard report to omit

i9Approver.description: Id of the user responsible for I9 approval

printMailUser.description: Print/Mail User ID; user must be a Service Provider with Account Management Role PN; in addition, the Separate Print/Ship Functions setting must be enabled at the system level

billPendingLocation.description: worksite location ID for client bill pending

benefitsGoodThroughDate.description: expiration date for the benefit rules set up for the client

achMax.description: the maximum allowable ACH amount to enforce a threshold amount requiring ACH approval

checksum.description: checksum to use for updates

clientStatusChecksum.description: checksum to use for client status updates

mySupportTeamDashboard.description: Custom functionality. Details the client's support team member responsibilities with user-configured field names.

suiSecondaryId.description: secondary state unemployment insurance employer ID for states such as Kansas and Missouri

miscTaxId.description: miscellaneous tax identifier for this state

miscTaxCode.description: miscellaneous tax code associated with the miscTaxId

printOnPayStub.description: rule for printing this code on pay stubs issued by the client; allowed values are 0 (Suppress) or 1 (Print on Pay Stub in All Cases)

worksiteUserSelectable.description: whether the deduction code is available to worksite users; allowed values are Y (yes) or N (no)

glCode.description: system-generated G/L code associated with the miscGLCode

printOnPayStub.description: rule for printing this code on pay stubs issued by the client; allowed values are 0 (Suppress Printing on Pay Stub), 1 (Print on Pay Stub in All Cases), 2 (Print on Pay Stub Unless YTD Dollar Amount is 0), 3 (Print on Pay Stub Unless Current Dollar Amount is 0), and 4 (Print on Pay Stub under Current Earnings but not under YTD Earnings)

commSalesperson.description: user ID of the sales representative associated with the client

commDateFrom.description: date on which the commission level goes into effect

commDateTo.description: date on which the commission level expires

commAmount.description: amount of the commission, either flat or percentage

commFlatPct.description: indicates whether the commission is a flat rate (F) or a percentage (P)

commBasedOn.description: indicates what the commission is based on: 'GW' (Gross Wages), 'ADM' (Admin Fees), 'WC' (Workers Comp), 'AL' (Average Lives), 'GP' (Gross Profit), 'TP' (Tax Profit), 'FG1' (Fixed Amount Group 1), 'FG2' (Fixed Amount Group 2), 'FG3' (Fixed Amount Group 3), 'FG4' (Fixed Amount Group 4), 'FG5' (Fixed Amount Group 5), or 'FPE' (Fixed per Paid Employee).

commBasedOnPlan.description: If the service provider uses a complex commission structure, this is the commission plan ID. Do not use commAmount, commFlatPct, or commBasedOn.

elecBenefitsEnroll.description: whether employees use PrismHR benefits enrollment. "G" denotes employees use PrismHR benefits enrollment

elecOnboarding.description: whether new employees use electronic onboarding. Values are (A)lways, P(rompt), and N(ever)/empty string. If P, the New Hire form prompts users to indicate where onboarding information will be submitted

elecOnboardRehire.description: whether client rehires automatically use PrismHR onboarding. Values are (A)lways, P(rompt), and N(ever)/empty string. If P, the New Hire form prompts users to indicate where onboarding information will be submitted

i9businessAddress.description: whether the system uses the (E)mployer or C(lient) address. If C, the system uses the client's "doing-business-as" (DBA) address

allowUploadDocs.description: whether the system allows employees of this client to upload supporting Form I-9 documents during the I-9 workflow. Values are Y (Enabled), N (Disabled), and empty string (System Default - defaults to the value stored in systemAllowUploadDocs)

systemAllowUploadDocs.description: global equivalent to allowUploadDocs, located on the Onboarding Options form. This determines the system-level logic for I-9 document uploads unless a client-level override exists

completeAllForms.description: whether the system allows employees of this client to be added to a payroll before all onboarding forms are complete (specifically: employee completion of I-9 Section 1 and manager completion of I-9 Section 2). Values are Y (Enabled), N (Disabled), and empty string (System Default - defaults to the value stored in systemCompleteAllForms)

systemCompleteAllForms.description: global equivalent to completeAllForms, located on the Onboarding Options form. This determines the system-level logic for inclusion of employees on payrolls before all onboarding documents are complete

enableBEAfterFinalSubmit.description: whether employees of this client can access their benefit enrollment workflow through Onboarding after submitting all onboarding-related forms. Values are Y (Enabled), N (Disabled), and empty string (System Default - defaults to the value stored in systemEnableBEAfterFinalSubmit)

systemEnableBEAfterFinalSubmit.description: global equivalent to enableBEAfterFinalSubmit, located on the Onboarding Options form. This determines the system-level logic for the accessibility of benefit enrollment workflows after completing onboarding.
