checksum.description: client master checksum; can be obtained by calling clientMasterService.getClientMaster

retire.description: client retirement plans array; can be obtained by calling clientMasterService.getClientMaster

stateCode.description: state associated with the W/C accrual modifier

effectiveDate.description: date on which the accrual modifier takes effect

discountDebit.description: discount or debit rate for this accrual modifier

modifier.description: the actual modifier rate for this W/C accrual

effectiveRate.description: effective modifier rate calculated using the discountDebit and modifier values

wcPolicy.description: worker's compensation insurance policy that covers the client's employees

taxCalcOptions.description: special tax calculation options. Accepted values empty, (Y) Time Sheet Location Based or (R) Resident State Based

wcPolicyEffDate.description: effective date for client's workers compensation insurance coverage

useWcRateTemplate.description: indicates whether to use table-based rate templates instead of the traditional method when calculating worker's comp for this client

calcWcOn1099Emp.description: indicates whether to calculate worker's comp for 1099 employees

wcPolicySubId.description: memo field indicating a 'sub ID' policy ID for the client

clientModDiscount.description: indicates whether to use the W/C Accrual Modifiers found at the client level when calculating worker's comp liability

checksum.description: the checksum retrieved from ClientMasterService.getClientMaster operation to use for updates

clientId.description: the client ID for this transaction

checksum.description: the checksum retrieved from getClientMaster operation to use for updates

billStateCode.description: two-character state postal code for billing address

billZipCode.description: five-digit ZIP code for billing address

billAddrClientId.description: client ID for billing if it should be a different client

serviceType.description: service type 'ASO' (Administrative Services Only),  'STF' (Staffing),  'PEO' (Professional Employer Services),  'PAY' (Payroll Processing Only),  'ASA' (Admin Services/Alt. Billing),  'COR' (Corporate Payroll),  'HRN' (HR Services, No Payroll).

corporationType.description: client's corporation type: 'L' (Limited Liability Corporation), 'S' (S-Corporation), 'C' (C-Corporation), 'I' (Individual or Sole Proprietor), 'P' (Parnership),  'A' (Limited Partnership),  'M' (Limited Liability Partnership),  'R' (Professional Corporation),  'V' (Personal Service Corporation),  'B' (Board Owned),  'J' (Joint Venture),  'T' (Tax Exampt),  'U' (Trust),  'H' (Church Organization),  'N' (Not for Profit),  'D' (B-Corporation), 'O' (Other).

tpaDownloadOptions.description: the type of third-party administrator download options used for the client

divisionRequired.description: indicates whether the client's division required

worksitePayrollApproval.description: determine the payroll approval process for the client.  N (Disabled), Y (Standard) (default), M (Multistep)

processingSchedule.description: payroll processing schedule assigned to the client

paperlessDelivery.description: indicates whether the client receives hard-copy checks or invoices/reports; must be one of these values: 'N' = Inactive (no paperless delivery; print everything for the client (default value for new clients), 'Y' = All payroll output (client receives all payroll output (invoices, reports, etc.) electronically, therefore do not specify deliveryMethod), 'C' = Checks/advices only (client receives checks and advices electronically, and printed invoices and reports), 'R' = Invoice/reports only (client receives invoices(s) and reports electronically and printed checks and advices), 'D' = All Payroll Output, Delivery Sheet only.

payrollAccount.description: ID of the account from which to draw payroll checks (checkIssueAcct getClientMaster)

childSupportEFTAccount.description: ID of the account from which to draw child support garnishments electronically (garnEftIssueAcct from getClientMaster)

receiptsAccount.description: ID of the account to use for ACH or credit card receipts (receiptCheckAcct from getClientMaster)

cutbackAccount.description: ID of the account from which to draw cutback checks (cutbackCheckAcct from getClientMaster)

nextEmployeeNumber.description: the next ID number to automatically assign to a new hire for this client; updates are only allowed if autoEmpNumber = "Y"

allowFirstPeriodHours.description: whether you can enter prorated hours for new hire employees with start dates that fall within the current pay period; the First Period Hours feature must be enabled in System Parameters in order to update this field; allowed values are empty string (use system default), "E" (enabled), and "D" (disabled)

adjTipsToMin.description: whether the system should adjust reported tips to meet minimum wage level

eligibleBenefitsDeterminant.description: whether to make benefits available to an employee based on department (D), division (V), location (L), or benefit group (B). If this field is empty then All Plans are Eligible. Based on this determining factor, the system checks the benefits for which employees are eligible.

relatedCode.description: corresponds to the Related Code field in the Other tab of Client Details

enableInstantPay.description: indicates if Instant Pay feature is enabled for the client

instantPayAccount.description: checking account that is configured to use the ACH originator associated with the Instant Pay format

benefitParentClient.description: ID of another client that acts as the parent to this client, for benefits purposes; integer values only

everify.description: indicates whether the client's new hires should go through E-Verify

remoteVerification.description: whether to enable Form I-9 remote verification for this client

wcCalculationOptions.description: whether Workers' Compensation is calculated based on the employee time sheet location ("Y") or residence location ("R"); these correspond to the wcLocationBased and wcResidentBased fields returned by getClientMaster. Note: this field has major implications for payroll calculation. Only set this value if you fully understand its effects.

selfServicePayroll.description: whether the client processes its own payrolls ("Y" or "N"); "Y" is not allowed if worksiteTimeSheetEntry = "Y"

selfServiceRestrictions.description: indicates the payroll actions the client cannot perform; valid values are "1" (Print) and "2" (Finalize and Print); this field can only be updated if selfServicePayroll = "Y"

worksiteTimesheetEntry.description: "Y" if users at the worksite location enter time sheet information; "N" or empty otherwise. "Y" is not allowed if selfServicePayroll = "Y".

billPendingLocation.description: worksite location ID for client bill pending

invoiceNotes.description: notes to print on each invoice

items.description: notes to print on each invoice

benefitsGoodThroughDate.description: expiration date for the benefit rules set up for the client

achMax.description: the maximum allowable ACH amount to enforce a threshold amount requiring ACH approval. Allowed values - only positive numbers limited to two decimal places

updateMessage.description: message which contains result of operation

items.description: warnings returned while performing operation

validationErrors.description: validation errors returned while performing operation

items.description: validation errors returned while performing operation

effectiveDate.description: effective date of client status

termActiveEmployees.description: whether active employees of the client will be terminated

enrollCobra.description: whether to create COBRA participant records for the terminated employees

okToDeletePendingBatches.description: whether to delete pending payroll batches upon termination

clientStatusChecksum.description: checksum for this client, returned by getClientMaster

newStatus.description: new status code for the client

effectiveDate.description: effective date for the new status; must be within sixty days of todays date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

plannedTermDate.description: if client is terminated, enter the date of termination (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

clientTermReason.description: if client is terminated, enter the reason code for termination (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

termActiveEmployees.description: if client is terminated, indicates whether to also terminate active employees under the client

employeeTermStatus.description: if client is terminated and termActiveEmployees is true, enter the status code to use for terminated employees

employeeTermDate.description: employee termination date, if applicable (format YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to client termination date if value is empty

employeeTermReason.description: reason code for employee termination, if applicable. Defaults to system parameter setting for auto term reason code

enrollCobra.description: whether to create COBRA participant records for the terminated employees

okToDeletePendingBatches.description: whether to delete pending payroll batches associated with the client

checksum.description: checksum to use for updates to the client Tax Info returned from ClientMasterService.getClientMaster

suiState.description: two-character state code for State Unemployment Insurance

ctrStartDate.description: client SUTA reporting start date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

ctrEndDate.description: client SUTA reporting end date (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

suiSecondaryId.description: for PEO clients, this secondary ID represents the client's wages in states that use the employer's rate and require reporting client wages separately (such as Kansas and Missouri)

miscTaxId.description: miscellaneous tax identifier for this state

miscTaxCode.description: miscellaneous tax code associated with the miscTaxId

redirToTaxCode.description: tax deduction code to which redirTaxCode will be redirected

sdiTaxCode.description: indicates the employee-paid tax deduction code for which the client has its own insurance plan, but is withheld from the employee and possibly credited to the client

sdiDednCode.description: deduction code for company-paid disability insurance

federalIdNumber.description: employer federal ID number, typically an Employer Identification Number (EIN) or Social Security Number

taxCalcOptions.description: for future use; this field can be left empty

railRoadEmployer.description: whether the client is a railroad employer, which significantly affects tax calculation; see the PrismHR documentation for details

nySdiEmployerCalc.description: whether the system calculates employer-paid New York disability tax for each employee of this client

nySdiEmployerRate.description: premium rate for NY disability insurance (per employee or per month)

nyMctOvrRate.description: override rate for New York metropolitan commuter transportation mobility tax; if no value is entered, the system uses the default rate of 0.60% for counties in New York City or 0.34% for other counties in the metropolitan area

pfmlMa1099.description: whether the employee is a 1099 contractor in Massachusetts and therefore subject to paid family and medical leave (PFML) tax withholdings; if true, the system accrues and bills these taxes to the employer

taxGeoCodeOverride.description: indicates the Vertex GeoCode the system will use for tax calculations instead of the default; allowed options are empty string (no override), "R" (Override Work GeoCode with Resident GeoCode), "H" (Override Work Geocode with Home Location GeoCode), "T" (Override T/S GeoCode with Resident GeoCode); see the PrismHR help for details

contactId.description: identifier for client contact in PrismHR

contactType.description: type of contact; types are specified by the service provider

comments.description: comments regarding the PrismHR client contact

geolocationCode.description: geolocation code for resolving location conflicts

checksum.description: checksum to use for updates to the client contact
checksum to use for updates to a record

locationObsolete.description: whether the worksite location is obsolete

obsoleteDate.description: the date on which this location becomes obsolete (informational only)

geoCode.description: Vertex GeoCode where the worksite is located

addressLine2.description: additional address location for street address (such as floor or suite number)

workCompState.description: state under which the worksite is covered by workers' compensation insurance

remoteLocation.description: whether to treat the employee's location as a remote work location for tax purposes; the worksite GeoCode will be ignored and taxes will be based on the employee's resident GeoCode; Workers' Compensation will also follow the resident GeoCode when enabled on the Benefits tab of Client Details.

taxEventCodes.description: currently used for Portland Metro tax

locationContacts.description: contact information for this client, including name, title, email address, telephone, and fax number.

eligibleBenefitPlans.description: information about benefit plans specific to this location.

items.description: information about benefit plans specific to this location.

locationBasedSUI.description: SUTA reporting information for this worksite location if enabled for client

eligibleEmployers.description: employer entities associated with this worksite location

adultAge.description: age that this location classifies as adult; employees under that age are considered minors

checksum.description: checksum is required when updating the client's worksite location information and can be retrieved from ClientMasterService.getClientClientLocationDetails

miscGlCount.description: predefined G/L wildcard for this location

miscGlDesc.description: description of the miscellaneous G/L code

miscGlSegment.description: segment value that replaces the miscGLCount wildcard

count.description: number of suta rates returned per page

location.description: optional identifier for a specific location within the state

effectiveDate.description: date when the SUTA billing rate goes into effect

officeBillRate.description: rate for officers if it is different

sdiRate.description: SDI rate if the client pays disability insurance in the state

erMisc1Rate.description: miscellaneous override rates for employer-paid tax (Tax ID 26)

erMisc2Rate.description: miscellaneous override rates for employer-paid tax (Tax ID 28)

erMisc3Rate.description: miscellaneous override rates for employer-paid tax (Tax ID 41)

locRateObsoleteDate.description: last active pay date if this rate is for a specific location that is closing and the code should no longer be used in calculations (YYYY-MM-DD format)

ovrCrBillCode.description: overbill credit back amount (rate), which can be different from the SUTA bill rate

wageBaseOvr.description: wage base override if you want to use a different amount than that specified in the Vertex guide (for example, Michigan has two tiers based on experience)

lockDownFlag.description: Indicate whether to "lock down" the employees working in the state to one of the employer IDs entered in the sutaBillRateDetail array. Specify the employers using lockDownDetail.

lockDownDetail.description: Use to indicate which employers to lock down when lockDownFlag is set to true. The order of the items in this array matches the order of the employers listed in sutaBillRateDetail. The lock goes into effect during payroll calculation and new hire/rehire.

sutaEmpId.description: employer to which billing rate applies

sutaOvrBillCrAmt.description: overbill credit back amount (rate) if it is not the same as the billing rate

code.description: the code to use when redirecting this billing code, based on a Redirection Plan

client.description: the client against which this billing code is redirected

checksum.description: for future development

profitabilityRptColumn.description: indicates the Profitability Report column in which this billing code displays. Possible values: 0 (Not included), 1 (Gross Wages), 2 (Admin Fees), 3 (FICA), 4 (FUTA), 5 (SUTA), 6 (Workers' Compensation), 7 (Insurance), 8 (Misc), ADJ (Adjustments), or WCA (Workers' Compensation Adjustments)

invoiceRevAnalysisRpt.description: indicates the Invoice Revenue Analysis Report column in which this billing code displays. Possible values: 1 (Gross Wages), 2 (Workers' Compensation), 3 (Taxes), 4 (Benefits), 5 (Retirement), 6 (Admin Fees), or 7 (Misc).

txFranchiseReportAccum.description: the accumulator that prints on the Texas Franchise Report for this billing code. The system adds to the accumulator any amounts billed to this code. Possible values: D (Deductible Benefits), P (Total Amount Paid), or B (Both).

obsoleteDate.description: on this date this billing code becomes obsolete (if applicable), in YYYY-MM-DD format

memoClientAcctOnly.description: if true, this bill code does not display on the actual invoice but remains part of the client accounting system. This causes the client record to be out of balance by the amount of the memo entries, unless the client accounting records include a memo offset line. See the online help for more information

salesTax.description: list of states where sales tax applies to this billing code

count.description: number of records returned per page

SalesTax.description: list of states where sales tax applies to this billing code

total.description: total number of client category records returned

count.description: number of client category records returned per page

contactTypeDescription.description: brief description of the contact type

owner.description: whether or not this contact type designates a contact as a business owner (Y is true, any other value is false).

checksum.description: checksum to use for updates to a record

inHouse.description: indicates whether  this course is offered by the company, rather than a third-party vendor. Valid values are True (T) or F (False). The default is false.

costPerStudent.description: any cost associated with the course expressed in 00.00 format

offeredBy.description: the name of the course provider

regScheduled.description: indicates whether the course is offered on a regular basis. Valid values are True (T) or False (F). The default is false.

schedule.description: description of when the course is offered

checksum.description: checksum to use for data updates

deductionType.description: deduction code type; possible values are \"V\" (Voluntary), \"C\" (Section 125), \"P\" (Post Tax Benefit), \"F\" (Flexible Spending Account), \"G\" (Wage Garnishment), \"L\" (Employee Loan Payment), \"K\" (Pre-Tax Retirement Contribution), \"KC\" (Catch-Up Retirement Contribution), \"KE\" (Post-Tax Retirement Contribution), \"KL\" (Retirement Plan Loan Payment), \"KR\" (Roth 401(k) Contribution), \"KCR\" (Roth 401(k) Catch-Up Contribution)

calculationMethod.description: deduction calculation method; possible values are \"F\" (Fixed Amount), \"R\" (Rate x Hours Worked), \"G\" (Garnishment), \"K\" (Retirement Plan), \"PG\" (Percentage of Gross Pay), \"PE\" (Percentage of Gross Earnings), \"PS\" (Percentage of Straight Pay), \"PPR\" (Percentage of Pay Rate), \"PPRD\" (Percentage of Pay Rate Rounded to Nearest Dollar), \"PPRM\" (Percentage of Prior Month Pay Rate Rounded to Nearest Dollar), \"PR\" (Percentage of Retirement Earnings), \"PGD\" (Percentage of Gross Earnings less Deductions), \"PET\" (Percentage of Earnings), \"RC\" (Rate x Certified Job Hours Worked), \"RP\" (Rate x Hours Paid), \"PCE\" (Percentage of Certified Job Earnings), \"U\" (Union Dues Table), \"OH\" (Ohio JEDD Tax), \"OHSERS\" (Ohio SERS), \"RUJ\" (Rate by Union Job Hours), \"RUP\" (Rate by Union Project Hours), \"UF\" (Sum of Union Fringe), \"IO\" (In/Out Deduction), \"RPS\" (Rate x Hours Paid, Selected Pay Codes), \"RT\" (Rate Table Lookup), \"PXG\" (Per Ten-Thousand Gross Pay), \"PXE\" (Per Ten-Thousand Gross Earnings), \"PXS\" (Per Ten-Thousand Straight Pay), \"PXR\" (Per Ten-Thousand Retirement Pay)

mandatory.description: if true, this deduction code represents goods and services that are a mandatory part of employment

printOnPayStub.description: whether to display this code on employee pay stubs; possible values are \"0\", empty string (both represent Suppress Printing on Pay Stub), and \"1\" (Print on Pay Stub in all Cases)

payStubName.description: brief deduction code description that prints on pay stubs and certain reports

thirdPartyRequired.description: voluntary deductions only; if true, this deduction must have a Third Party Payee associated with it; payees are set at the client level

toArrears.description: voluntary deductions only; if true, the deduction can go into arrears when the employee does not have enough pay to cover it

obsoleteDate.description: date after which this deduction code is no longer in effect (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

maximumPeriodEnd.description: whether or not there is a maximum period end date (Monthly period only)

defaultAmt.description: This value varies depending on the Calculation Method. It can be an amount, a percentage, or an hourly rate. You can also override this value at the employee level. If left empty, this value must be set at the employee level.

defaultPeriods.description: the periods during which the system will make this deduction by default; you can override this value at the employee level; accepts any combination of the numbers 1 through 5; for example, \"24\" for deductions during period 2 and 4, or \"12345\" for deductions in all periods

unionRelated.description: if true, this code displays as a default on the Union Codes form

certifiedDesc.description: description that displays on a Certified Payroll Report

timeSheetHeading.description: description that displays on the Fax Back time sheet

allowDescOverride.description: if true, users are allowed to override this deduction code's description at the client level

kpersContrib.description: if true, this deduction code is for contributions to the Kansas Public Employees Retirement System

mtrbContrib.description: if true, this deduction code is for contributions to the Massachusetts Teachers Retirement Board

inPayCode.description: the \"in\" pay code to display on reports for vacation, holiday, and union dues

matchPercent.description: percentage of the match for this deduction, if one exists

matchDesc.description: description of the match for this deduction, if one exists; if no description is provided, the system uses the deduction code ID

formW2Box.description: Form W-2 box in which this deduction prints; possible values are 10, 11, 12, 14

formW2Code.description: code that precedes this deduction amount in Box 12 of Form W-2

jobRateBillCode.description: billing code that will be used if this deduction code is billed on a Job Rate client; if empty, no bill reduction occurs for this deduction

rebateBillCode.description: billing code that will be used to reduce the client's bill amounts, if applicable

deductionCodeList.description: only valid when calculationMethod is PGD (Percentage of Gross Earnings, Less Deductions); list of deduction codes that apply to this calculation method

items.description: only valid when calculationMethod is PGD (Percentage of Gross Earnings, Less Deductions); list of deduction codes that apply to this calculation method

excludedPayCode.description: only valid when calculationMethod is PGD (Percentage of Gross Earnings, Less Deductions); list of pay codes excluded from this calculation method

items.description: only valid when calculationMethod is PGD (Percentage of Gross Earnings, Less Deductions); list of pay codes excluded from this calculation method

payCode.description: only valid when calculationMethod is RPS (Rate x Hours Paid, Selected Pay Codes); list of pay codes that apply to this calculation method

items.description: only valid when calculationMethod is RPS (Rate x Hours Paid, Selected Pay Codes); list of pay codes that apply to this calculation method

periodCode.description: payroll period code that is used as the basis for defining the limit; possible values: are W, B, S, M

limit.description: maximum amount that the system can deduct under this code during a payroll period (two decimal places)

basis.description: time period or type of maximum: \"M\" (monthly, default), \"Q\" (Quarterly), \"A\" (Annually)

maximum.description: maximum amount that the system will deduct under the specified basis (two decimal places)

section125.description: if true, this deduction is part of client-sponsored Section 125 plans

retirement401K.description: if true, this deduction is for client-sponsored 401(k) retirement plans

retirement457.description: if true, this deduction is for contributions to a supplemental retirement plan

fsaDependentCare.description: if true, this deduction is for flexible spending dependent care plans

catchup401K.description: if true, this deduction is for 401(k) catch-up contributions

retirement409A.description: if true, this is for deducting contributions to a 409(a) deferred compensation plan

healthSavingsAcct.description: if true, this deduction is for client-sponsored Health Savings Accounts

retirement414H.description: if true, this deduction is for contributions to a 414(h) tax-deferred government retirement plan

groupMedical.description: if true, this deduction is for client-sponsored medical plans

section132.description: if true, this deduction is for client-sponsored transportation plans

isObsolete.description: whether the code is obsolete (true) or in use (false)

perDiemPercent.description: percentage of pay allocated to non-taxable per diem (when paid with the percentage method)

unionEligibleDays.description: number of days for union eligibility.

checksum.description: checksum returned by getDepartmentCode

isObsolete.description: whether the code is obsolete (true) or in use (false)

checkAcct.description: check issuing account from which to draw payroll checks

achAcct.description: ACH issuing account from which to draw direct deposit transactions

garnCheckAcct.description: check issuing account from which to draw garnishment checks

divAchStatus.description: division's ACH Status. Valid values are empty, A (Active), I (Inactive), N (Non-ACH)

abaNumber.description: ABA/routing number for the financial institution, used only for split ACH debits

checkSave.description: indicates whether the account is a checking or savings account. Valid values are empty, C or S.

eeoClass.description: EEO class code that corresponds to this position group

spanishEthnicDesc.description: Spanish description of EEO ethnic code

englishEthnicDesc.description: English description of EEO ethnic code

reportCode.description: EEO standard ethnic code that will display on the EEO-1 report for employees with this code

events.description: establish codes for the types of events held by the client.

eventClassification.description: describes the type of event, for example, Training.

Events.description: establish codes for the types of events held by the client.

checksum.description: the checksum used when updating the object

dates.description: the list of dates the holiday falls on

items.description: the list of dates the holiday falls on

total.description: total number of NAICS code records returned

count.description: number of NAICS code records returned per page

naicsCode.description: NAICS identifier that identifies the industry, for example, 311221

description.description: the description of the industry, for example, Wet Corn Milling and Starch

obsolete.description: if Y this NAICS code is obsolete; if N or empty this NAICS code is active

payGradeDesc.description: description of the pay grade code

minAnnual.description: minimum pay amount for salaried employees

maxAnnual.description: maximum pay amount for salaried employees

minHourly.description: minimum pay amount for hourly employees, automatically calculated

maxHourly.description: maximum pay amount for hourly employees, automatically calculated

midpoint.description: calculated midpoint annual pay, formula = (((maxAnnual  minAnnual) / 2) + minAnnual)

percentRange.description: calculated midpoint percentage range, formula = (((maxAnnual - minAnnual) / minAnnual) * 100)

state.description: two-character state code associated with the wcTreatment

wcTreatment.description: Workers' Compensation for this pay code and state: Y' (subject to W/C), N (not subject), B (bill only), 'C (bill and credit back), or empty string

GetPaycodeDetailsResponse-StateWCTreatme.description: state-specific Workers' Compensation rules for this pay code; only applies when wcTaxable='T'

checksum.description: checksum to use for data updates

calcMethod.description: calculation method: 'S'   (Standard), 'F'   (Fixed), 'C'   (Calculated), 'P'   (Per Diem), 'E'   (Percentage of Gross Earnings), 'H'   (Rate x Hours Worked), 'K'   (Percentage of 401(k) Earnings), 'HP'  (Rate x Hours Paid), 'HPS' (Rate x Hours Paid (Selected Codes), 'HFW' (Rate x Full Hours Worked), 'HSW' (Rate x Straight Hours Worked), 'HUJ' (Rate x Union Job Hours Worked), 'HUP' (Rate x Union Project Hours Worked).

payDescription.description: description of earning or payroll disbursement

w2FormBox.description: Form W-2 box number where tax year payments on this pay code should print: 8, 11, 12, or 14

w2FormCode.description: code that precedes the amount printed in box 12 or 14 of Form W-2

workCompTaxable.description: indicates whether pay code earnings are used to calculate workers' compensation liability: 'Y' (Yes, this pay code is subject to W/C), 'N' (Not, this pay code is not subject to W/C), 'B' (No, but bill as though the code were subject to W/C), 'C' (No, but bill as if the code were subject to W/C and then credit), 'T' (Yes, this pay code is subject by state).

payReason.description: indicates whether the compensation is for hours (H) or units (U)

compensationType.description: indicates whether the compensation is monetary/cash (C) or non-monetary/non-cash (N)

payClass.description: pay classification: 'E' (Earnings), 'R' (Expense Reimbursement), 'F' (Non-Cash Fringe Benefit), 'RT' (Reported Tips), 'M' (Memo).

flag401k.description: indicates whether amounts paid with this pay code should be used to calculate employees' elective contribution to a retirement plan

obsoleteDate.description: date on which this pay code was no longer used (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

talxPayType.description: download code used for employment verification: R' (Regular), V (Vacation), S (Sick), B (Bonus), E (Severance), H (Holiday), P (Pension), W (Wages), O (Overtime), C (Commissions), T (Tips), M (Miscellaneous), K (Workers Compensation)

productiveWork.description: whether the pay code is used to pay productive work; true if the pay code represents an amount earned for productive labor; false if the pay code is used for some other purpose, like vacation or sick time

excludeACACalc.description: whether to exclude this pay code from calculations for certain Affordable Care Act reports, like the Large Employer Test Report and the ACA Eligibility Report

printOnStub.description: specifies how to display the pay code on employee pay stubs: 1' (Yes, in All Cases), 0 (No, Suppress Printing on Pay Stub), 2 (Yes, unless YTD dollar amount is 0, YTD earnings only), 3 (Yes, unless current dollar amount is 0, Earnings Detail only), '5' (no option selected)

billCode.description: billing code to use for this pay code; empty if the organization does not re-bill clients for this pay code, such a Section 125 expense reimbursement

billCodeJobRate.description: billing code to use if clients use job rates; empty if the organization does not re-bill clients for this pay code

nonCashRebateBill.description: billing code for pay codes classified as Non-Cash Fringe Benefits or Reported Tips; empty if the organization does not re-bill clients for this pay code

cashWageForTippedEmpl.description: whether this pay code is used to pay cash wages for tipped employees, usually at the minimum cash wage required by law

chargedTips.description: indicates this pay code is for compensating employees for charged tips. This is valid only when the Pay Class is Earnings

includeHoursPaidForOT.description: whether to include hours worked/amounts paid under this pay code in overtime calculations

useHoursPaidForOT.description: If includeHoursPaidForOT is true, this can be set; if true, hours paid are used in these calculations instead of hours worked; note that this only applies to scheduled batches and requires client-level setup of an FLSA ruleset

includeAmtPaidOnlyinOTCalc.description: if true, only the amount paid is used in the overtime calculation

addToOTInLieuOfThreshold.description: if true, hours paid under this pay code are added to overtime hours; if false, they are added to the overtime threshold calculation; this is only necessary if the FLSA ruleset is configured to report overtime hours separately

roundToPayPeriodIfSalaried.description: if true, time sheet pay under this code will be rounded to total period pay in cases where the employee is salaried and total hours paid equals their standard hours

shiftDiffPayCalculation.description: whether to include premium hours paid under this pay code when calculating the number of shift differential/longevity pay premium hours to be paid

chargeExpenseAdmin.description: whether this pay code represents an expense reimbursement; if true, it is subject to the same administrative fees as a regular earning

thirdPartyAdmin.description: pay code used to report this pay type to a third-party administrator, usually an unemployment claims processor

fundVoluntaryDed.description: whether cash from this expense reimbursement pay code can be used to fund voluntary payroll deductions

excludeOTRecalc.description: whether to exclude this pay code when recalculating payroll batch overtime; typically, when this is true, the pay code is used in conjunction with a separate half-time pay code

includeCertPayRpt.description: whether to include a non-earning pay code in the Detail section of the Certified Pay Report

includeCertPayFringeRpt.description: whether to include any amounts paid under this pay code in the Fringe/Contribution Summary section of the Certified Pay Report

certPayRptFringeClass.description: fringe class to assign to this pay code if it is included in the Certified Pay Report as a fringe benefit: 1' (Health & Welfare), 2 (Pension & Retirement), 3 (Apprentice & Educational), 4 (Vacation), 5 (Holiday), 6 (Unemployment), '7 (Other)

pinnaclePayType.description: Pinnacle pay type for discrimination testing against earning codes: B' (Bonus), C (Commission), 'O (Other)

allowDescriptionOverrides.description: whether to allow pay code Description overrides

timeSheetHeading.description: heading for the Fax Back Time Sheet and Summary Time Sheet

customOption.description: custom option string which enables special processing associated with a custom feature

collectTipsOnTS.description: whether to include a Tip Sales time sheet column next to the pay code's column (only allowed if payClass=RT); this is a memo field for reporting purposes, to record the sale amount associated with the tip; default value is false

ptoWages.description: whether this pay code is used to compensate employees for PTO; this value will be counted as hours worked on the California Pay Data report

totalCompCategory.description: indicates whether the compensation displays on the Total Compensation dashboard under Direct ('D') or Indirect ('I'), or not at all (empty string)

conditionalFlatSumCalc.description: whether to include non-discretionary bonus pay in the payroll calculation

conditionalOTPaycode.description: overtime pay code used for non-discretionary bonuses in overtime calculation

items.description: state limiter for non-discretionary bonuses; equivalent to employee home worksite location

conditionalPayrollWarnFlag.description: whether to assign a warning message to the conditional rule pay code

factor.description: pay rate multiplier, up to two decimal places; this is multiplied by the pay rate to arrive at the actual rate used for earnings calculation

defaultAutoHours.description: whether to automatically associate employees' standard hours worked with this pay code; typically set to "true" for salaried pay codes

altPayRate.description: alternate employee pay rate to use on the timesheet

methodRateAmt.description: represents different values depending on the calculation method: if calcMethod='F', this is the default pay amount; if calcMethod='C', this is the hourly or unit rate; if calcMethod='E', H', or 'X, this is the Percent/Rate per hour

perdiemMethod.description: method used to calculate this per diem pay code: P' (Percentage), D (Per Day), or 'M (Mileage)

perdiemTaxablePayCode.description: pay code used for the taxable wages portion of the total wages entered (when using percentage per diem method)

perDiemNonTaxablePayCode.description: pay code to use for the non-taxable wages portion of the total wages entered (only when calcMethod and perdiemMethod both equal 'P')

otherPerDiemTaxablePayCode.description: additional pay code for the non-taxable wages portion of total wages entered (only when calcMethod and perdiemMethod both equal 'P')

items.description: additional pay code for the non-taxable wages portion of total wages entered (only when calcMethod and perdiemMethod both equal 'P')

maxCalHrsperMaxPercentGross.description: maximum amount the system should use on a single pay voucher when calculating an amount based on hours worked, hours paid, and so on; enter up to two decimal places

fringeCalcPayCodes.description: only used when calcMethod='HPS'; list of pay codes for which the system accumulates fringe hours, which are used to calculate the fringe benefit amount

items.description: only used when calcMethod='HPS'; list of pay codes for which the system accumulates fringe hours, which are used to calculate the fringe benefit amount

stateWCTreatment.description: state-specific Workers' Compensation rules for this pay code; only applies when wcTaxable='T'

checksum.description: checksum to use for data updates

eeoPositionGroup.description: the EEOC-designated position group that corresponds to this class

eeoPositionClass.description: the EEOC-designated position class that corresponds with the eeoPositionGroup

specialRequirements.description: whether this position class involves special physical or mental requirements that would qualify it for monitoring under the Americans with Disabilities Act

flsaExempt.description: whether this position class is exempt from the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act, which defines the workers who must be paid for overtime.

flsaType.description: the FLSA type that best describes this position (only if flsaExempt is true). The three types are Standard Duties Test (returns 'S' for positions that satisfy this test or are subject to the standard salary test); Exempt Executive Duties (returns 'H' for positions that satisfy this test); or Exempt Professional Duties (returns 'E' for positions that are exempt from the duties and salary tests, e.g. teachers, doctors, and lawyers).

state.description: two-letter abbreviation for the Workers' Compensation state

wcClassCode.description: Workers' Compensation classification code associated with this position class and state

MaterialCodes.description: codes for hazardous materials people in this position encounter; service providers define hazardous material codes for each client

miscGLCount.description: predefined General Ledger wildcard in the following format: EEMJB01 through EEMJB99; any other value will cause an error

miscGLDesc.description: reference-only description for miscGLCount; note that these descriptions affect all positions in the active client

miscGLSegment.description: GL segment that replaces the miscGLCount wildcard

positionCode.description: unique code that identifies the position/job

flsaExempt.description: whether or not the position is exempt from the minimum wage and overtime provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act.

eeoPositionGroup.description: (if applicable) the equal employment opportunity group to which this position belongs

eeoPositionClass.description: (if applicable) the equal employment opportunity class to which this position belongs

positionDesciption.description: position description; include the character #|;# to indicate a carriage return (new line)

supervisory.description: indicate whether this is a supervisory position

unionCodeOveride.description: union code to override code specified on employee record; service providers define union codes for each client

hierachyTier.description: For future development: Does not currently impact the functionality of the product.

prChauffeurTaxApplies.description: indicate whether this position is subject to Puerto Rico chauffeur's tax and the primary work location is Puerto Rico

payGrade.description: default pay grade for new hires assigned to this position; service providers define pay grades for each client

indirectlyTipped.description: indicates whether this a tipped position that receives tips indirectly; for example, a busboy, cook, or service bartender

specialRequirements.description: Use specialRequirements to indicate whether this position requires any special physical or mental requirements. The Americans with Disabilities Act prohibits employers from discriminating against qualified individuals with disabilities. Not including a particular person in the applicant pool for a certain job is only nondiscriminatory if that person does not meet any physical or mental requirements identified as essential functions of the position. Applications for these jobs must be closely monitored for ADA compliance.

codeOfAlaska.description: enter Alaska Position Code sent to masterTax for quarterly tax reporting to the state of Alaska, if appropriate

probationDays.description: number of days from hire that a new employee is considered to be on probation

prevailingWage.description: prevailing wage for the position, which can print on pay stubs as a pay detail field

salesPosition.description: indicate whether this is a sales position

priceCode.description: price code to override the Bundled Rate for any employee assigned to this position

tippedPosition.description: indicate whether this is a tipped position

perDiemPercent.description: amount to allocate to non-taxable per diem when paid using the percentage method

requirementsFromDOT.description: indicate whether this job code has special requirements as set forth by the U.S. Department of Transportation

wcTimeSheetLocBased.description: indicate whether to calculate workers' compensation accruals for each employee's actual work location; this overrides the setting in Client Details or Company Master

generalLedgerSegmentCode1.description: segment 1 code to use as G/L account number segment in place of Position Code

generalLedgerSegmentCode2.description: segment 2 code to use as G/L account number segment in place of Position Code

generalLedgerSegmentCode3.description: segment 3 code to use as G/L account number segment in place of Position Code

obsolete.description: indicate whether this position is no longer used

benefitGroup.description: ID of the benefit group to which employees are assigned when hired to this position

socCode.description: Standard Occupational Classification code. Enter only numbers (no dashes). This information replaces the positionDescription value in the MasterTax RTS file and the Employer and Client LA quarterly files. If nothing is entered here, the value in positionDescription is used.

inSeasonEECode.description: two-digit code for seasonal employees in Indiana. This is required for Indiana SUI electronic filing.

suppressWorkStateTax.description: if true, employees are subject to taxes in their residence state rather than their work state. During calculations, the system uses the employee's residence as the basis for state taxes. If false, the system uses their work state as the basis for state taxes.

agriculturalWorker.description: 'Y' indicates that the employee is an agricultural worker whose income is reported on IRS Form 943 instead of Form 941. Otherwise, 'N' or '' (empty string).

materialCodes.description: codes for hazardous materials people in this position encounter; service providers define hazardous material codes for each client

reviewDateADA.description: date on which the position was last reviewed for compliance with ADA standards

reviewerNameADA.description: name of the person who performed the ADA review

costBillMaintenance.description: position code cost and bill rates associated with this position

equivalentHoursWorked.description: equivalent hours worked information for this position if any pay codes used to pay employees will pay by units instead of hours

miscGLSegments.description: predefined wildcards and corresponding GL segments for the position code; to preserve existing values in the array, pass the complete array of existing values plus any additions or do not pass the array; to clear all existing values, pass an empty array.

positionCode.description: employee position code associated with this certified project

positionTitle.description: employee position title associated with this certified project

Do not use this option if you want to include employees in the file (this is typical, and the value in the CA XML file will be false for this option)

checksum to use for updates to a record

retirement401K.description: if true, this deduction is for client-sponsored 401(k) retirement plans

calcMethod.description: calculation method: 'S'   (Standard), 'F'   (Fixed), 'C'   (Calculated), 'P'   (Per Diem), 'E'   (Percentage of Gross Earnings), 'H'   (Rate x Hours Worked), 'K'   (Percentage of 401(k) Earnings), 'HP'  (Rate x Hours Paid), 'HPS' (Rate x Hours Paid (Selected Codes), 'HFW' (Rate x Full Hours Worked), 'HSW' (Rate x Straight Hours Worked), 'HUJ' (Rate x Union Job Hours Worked), 'HUP' (Rate x Union Project Hours Worked).

payReason.description: indicates whether the compensation is for hours (H) or units (U)

payClass.description: pay classification: 'E' (Earnings), 'R' (Expense Reimbursement), 'F' (Non-Cash Fringe Benefit), 'RT' (Reported Tips), 'M' (Memo).

flag401k.description: indicates whether amounts paid with this pay code should be used to calculate employees' elective contribution to a retirement plan

excludeACACalc.description: whether to exclude this pay code from calculations for certain Affordable Care Act reports, like the Large Employer Test Report and the ACA Eligibility Report

printOnStub.description: specifies how to display the pay code on employee pay stubs: '1' (Yes, in All Cases), 0 (No, Suppress Printing on Pay Stub), 2 (Yes, unless YTD dollar amount is 0, YTD earnings only), 3 (Yes, unless current dollar amount is 0, Earnings Detail only), '5' (no option selected)

chargedTips.description: indicates this pay code is for compensating employees for charged tips. This is valid only when the Pay Class is Earnings

useHoursPaidForOT.description: If includeHoursPaidForOT is true, this can be set; if true, hours paid are used in these calculations instead of hours worked; note that this only applies to scheduled batches and requires client-level setup of an FLSA ruleset

includeAmtPaidOnlyinOTCalc.description: if true, only the amount paid is used in the overtime calculation

addToOTInLieuOfThreshold.description: if true, hours paid under this pay code are added to overtime hours; if false, they are added to the overtime threshold calculation; this is only necessary if the FLSA ruleset is configured to report overtime hours separately

roundToPayPeriodIfSalaried.description: if true, time sheet pay under this code will be rounded to total period pay in cases where the employee is salaried and total hours paid equals their standard hours

paidAmount.description: amount that the employee paid back on this loan to date, in NN.NN format

glOverrideAccount.description: code of the account to which this deduction is credited

deductionCode.description: Unique ID for the deduction, defined by the service provider. Allowed values for this method are deduction codes of type Employee Loan Payment (L).

employeeLoanDetail.description: list of loans for this client - employee combination

paymentDate.description: date the loan payment was made, in YYYY-DD-MM format

paymentVoucherId.description: voucher number associated with the payment

paymentAmount.description: the amount of this payment, in NN.NN format

docketNumber.description: docket number associated with this garnishment

category.description: garnishment type, corresponding to the garnishmentType input parameter. Possible values are C (Child Support), SP (Spousal Support), I (IRS Tax Levy), B (Bankruptcy Order), S (State Tax Levy), FTB (Franchise Tax Board), O (Credit Wage Garnishment) and SL (Student Loan)

receiptDate.description: date the garnishment was received from the issuing authority

stateId.description: state-specific alternative to the docketNumber, if required

startDate.description: start date for payroll deductions for this garnishment

stopDate.description: end date for payroll deductions for this garnishment

payee.description: ID of recipient of garnishment payments

garnishmentFee.description: fee deducted from employee's pay whenever this garnishment is processed

portionInArrears.description: amount to withhold for this garnishment in order to cover the arrearage amount

overrideAmt.description: temporary override amount for this garnishment

suppressVoucherType.description: Whether to suppress garnishment deductions on vouchers of a certain type. Possible values are R (regular), S (supplemental) and V (vacation)

suppressUnscheduledPayrolls.description: whether to deduct the garnishment on unscheduled payrolls

overrideGLAcct.description: general ledger account to credit during the override period

flatAmount.description: Flat dollar amount (with two decimal places) to withhold from employee pay, for this garnishment. This applies to all garnishment types except IRS Tax Levy, Student Loan garnishments and Child support

withholdAmt.description: Child Support garnishments only. Amount to withhold each pay period for the child support garnishment order. Equal to the sum of current and past due amounts

exemptAmt.description: IRS Tax Levy only. Amount of wages exempt from the tax levy. The amount levied will be equal to employee disposable income minus the exempt amount

percentNet.description: percent of wages to garnish, instead of deducting a flat amount

percentOf.description: Whether to garnish a percent of G (gross wages), N (net wages), or S - starting net wages, which are gross wages minus taxes and not including any other garnishment deductions, even if those deductions take priority in the processing logic. Review the garnishments documentation for details about processing order

monthlyLimit.description: IRS Tax Levy and Bankruptcy Order garnishments only. Maximum monthly garnishment amount in dollars (two decimal places)

studentLoanExemptAmt.description: Amount of wages exempt from the state tax levy. The amount levied will be equal to to the disposable income minus the exempt amount

payPeriodLimit.description: Bankruptcy Order, Creditor Wage Garnishment, and Student Loan garnishments only. Used in conjunction with the percentage amount to establish a maximum garnishment limit per pay period

percentDisposable.description: Franchise Tax Board garnishments only. Percent of employee's post-deduction earnings to garnish, instead of a flat rate

nonConsumerGarnishment.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Whether this is a judgment or non-consumer credit garnishment. The system applies the state-specific rules for the specified type

headOfHousehold.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only: whether the employee is considered the head of their household for tax purposes. If true, the system uses the maximum percentage amount set up in the State Garnishment Rules record for that state. If no percentage exists in that record, the system uses the standard maximum percent of disposable or gross pay

maxPercent.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Overrides the state-level maximum garnishment percentage

maxPercentPayType.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Overrides the state-level setting for the type of employee wages to garnish: D (Disposable), G (Gross)

minWageRateMultiplier.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Override for the number of hours to multiply by the employee's minimum wage to calculate the maximum disposable earnings that the creditor can garnish

minWageRateSource.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Source to use for minimum wage standards. Possible values are 1 (federal minimum hourly rate), 2 (state minimum hourly rate), or 3 (use higher of federal and state rates)

hoursCalcMethod.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Whether to calculate minimum net pay for semi-monthly or monthly pay periods under CCPA rules. Possible values are F (factored) or A (annualized). See the Creditor Wage Garnishment documentation in the PrismHR online help for more information

maxMonthlyFee.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Maximum garnishment processing fee to collect from the employee per month

reduceLimitByFee.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. Whether to reduce the limit by the value of the state's administrative processing fee. Possible values are Y (yes) and N (no)

additionalDispDeduct.description: Creditor Wage Garnishment only. One or more codes for any additional gross earnings  deductions that must occur to determine the employee's disposable income, for the purpose of calculating the garnishment. Possible values: M (medical), D (dental), L (life insurance), N (disability), R (retirement), U (union dues), A (court-order medical), and P (court-ordered medical dependent)

studentLoanType.description: Type of student loan garnishment. Possible values are: F (apply federal limits), FM (apply federal limits minus medical), S (apply state and federal limits), and SM (apply state and federal limits minus medical)

docketNumber.description: docket number assigned to this garnishment

checkNum.description: number on the check used to pay the garnishment to the payee

voucherId.description: voucher identifier paid against the garnishment

achRefId.description: reference for the ACH transaction used to pay the garnishment to the payee

amountDue.description: garnishment amount due as calculated on the voucher

checksum.description: checksum of the whole deduction record which is required for update

loanId.description: loan number assigned by PrismHR. Enter NEW to create new loan.

checksum.description: checksum to use for updates to a record

loanAmount.description: amount of loan, value must be greater than zero

paymentAmount.description: amount deducted automatically from each paycheck, in format NN.NN

paymentFreq.description: the frequency of the payroll deduction; value M = once per month or P = once per payroll period or A = all payroll types.

paybackAmount.description: the amount required to consider the loan paid in full, which is the amount of this loan plus interest, in format NN.NN

loanReason.description: reason why the loan was taken

startDate.description: date on which payroll deductions to pay back the loan begin, in YYYY-DD-MM format

stopDate.description: date on which payroll deductions stop, in YYYY-DD-MM format

loanDate.description: date of the loan in YYYY-DD-MM format

paidAmount.description: amount that the employee paid back on this loan to date, in NN.NN format

glOverrideAccount.description: code of the account to which this deduction is credited

deductionCode.description: Unique ID for the deduction, defined by the service provider. Allowed values for this method are deduction codes of type Employee Loan Payment (L).

period.description: periods when this deduction is taken from the employee's net earnings after payroll taxes.

limit.description: maximum amount system can deduct in a payroll period

maximum.description: maximum amount system can deduct per month, quarter, year, or lifetime, as specified in basis parameter; maximum cannot be set for basis 'P' (pay period)

basis.description: basis for maximum amount: 'M' (monthly), 'Q' (quarterly), 'A' (annually), 'L' (lifetime), or 'P' (pay period); if basis is 'P', maximum is not set or used

benefitPlanId.description: ID of the company's benefit plan

trackArrears.description: indicates whether the deduction tracks to arrears

startDate.description: date on which deduction starts (if it is for a limited period of time)

stopDate.description: date on which deduction stops (if it is for a limited period of time)

mandatory.description: indicates whether the deduction is for goods or services provided to the employee that are a mandatory part of employment

matchMethod.description: matching method used to calculate the match: 'F' (flat) or 'P' (percent)

matchAmount.description: matching amount, either a flat amount or a percentage (depending on the setting in matchMethod)

matchDescription.description: description of match that prints on the Batch Match Code Summary report

cutbackPayeeCode.description: ID of the third-party payee receiving the deduction

achOption.description: direct deposit account associated with the deduction; to set this field, the VOLUNTARYDEDACH Custom Feature Code must be enabled; allowed values are DED1, DED2, and DED3 and each value can be set only once per employee

checksum.description: checksum of the deduction which is required for update

status.description: enabled/disabled status

items.description: applicable user roles

ClientList.description: list of clients the user can access

docRestricted.description: indicates whether there is a document restriction

userType.description: user type: 'I' (Internal User (service provider)), 'C' (Worksite Manager), 'A' (Worksite Trusted Advisor), or 'E' (Employee)

clientRestricted.description: indicates whether there is a client restriction

clientList.description: list of clients the user can access

empRestricted.description: indicates whether there is an employee restriction

permissions.description: A list of permissions for the document

items.description: A list of permissions for the document

items.description: employee ID and the pending change to employee's status (Active or Terminated)

scope.description: document scope; possible values are PUBLIC, CLIENT, EMPLOYEE, and APPLICANT

documentType.description: document type code; call DocumentService.getDocumentTypes to get a complete list

isNew.description: indicates whether the user is new

valid.description: indicates whether the user is valid

userType.description: user type for this transaction: 'I' (Internal User (PrismHR)), 'C' (PrismHR Worksite Manager, or PrismHR Worksite Trusted Advisor), and 'E' (Employee)

employeeId.description: employee identifier associated with the user if user type is worksite manager or employee

clockNumber.description: employee's time clock number as defined by time clock product

employeeNumber.description: employee number as defined by client

officeScopeContext.description: context to keep Office Scope settings

effectiveDate.description: date of the event (YYYY-MM-DD format)

actionDate.description: date when further action should be taken (YYYY-MM-DD format)

employeeEventLog.description: employee events such as training, certifications, and apprenticeships, are recorded in the employee event logs

newEffectiveDate.description: new value for the updated effective date

employerStartDate.description: date on which the employee started with the service provider (same as peoStartDate)

deleteStatus.description: it allows deletion of a status if DELETESTATUS is entered in this field. If the field is null or any other value, the status will not be deleted. If the employee has only one status date, then the status will not be deleted.

checksum.description: checksum value for data updates

warnings.description: any warnings / information messages when available

items.description: any warnings / information messages when available

status.description: employee's status in benefit plan: 'E' (Eligible), 'A' (Active Enrollment), 'T' (Terminated Enrollment), 'C' (COBRA Enrollment), or 'W' (Waived Enrollment)

status.description: deposit account status; allowed values are "P" (Prenotification), "D" (Deposit Active), or "I" (Deposit Inactive)

method.description: indicates how to calculate the direct deposit amount (always set to "F" - Fixed)

bankName.description: bank name corresponding to transitNum and accountNum

accountType.description: For updates, you can only specify 'C' , 'S' or 'IP'. Types that can be returned are 'C' (checking account or pay card), 'S' (savings account), and IP (instant pay).

method.description: must be one of: 'F' (fixed), 'P' (percentage), 'FS' (fixed, skip if can't take full amount), 'PN' (percentage of net after fixed), or 'B' (remaining balance; can be used for only one of a specific voucher type (R, V, or S) that is set to Deposit Active)

amount.description: precision 2 (##.##); mandatory for all methods except 'B', for which it must not be specified

limit.description: precision 2 (##.##); permissible only when method is 'P'

status.description: must be one of: 'P' (Pre-notification), 'D' (Deposit Active), or 'I' (Deposit Inactive)

voucherTypeOverride.description: must be a subset of the voucherType attribute, or else empty/unspecified

autoInsurancePolicyExpDate.description: date on which the insurance policy expires

planAmt.description: amount contributed to employee cafeteria plan

employeeStatus.description: employee's current status; statuses are defined by the service provider

hawaiiMedWaivers.description: object containing medical waiver information for Hawaii residents

firstHireDate.description: date on which employee was first hired into the company

lastHireDate.description: date on which employee was most recently hired

flsaExempt.description: indicates whether the position is FLSA exempt

seniorityDate.description: date to use for calculating benefits; can be different from last hire date to give employee more seniority to make eligible for different benefits

officer.description: indicates whether the employee is an officer with the company; this can affect workers' compensation insurance premium calculations

workCompOfficer.description: indicates whether the employee should be considered an officer for the purpose of workers' compensation insurance premium calculations; this overrides the officer setting only if it is blank

scorpOwner.description: indicates whether the employee is an S-corp owner

businessOwner.description: indicates whether the employee is an owner of the client.

termReasonCode.description: termination reason code; these are defined by the service provider

lastStatusChangeDate.description: date of most recent status change

lastJobChangeDate.description: date of most recent change to employee's position/job

newHireReportDate.description: date employee was reported as new hire

employee1099.description: indicates whether the employee is a 1099 contractor

clientEmployeeId.description: employee identifier assigned by client (found in Employee Details|Work|Employee Number)

clockNum.description: employee number for time clock product

primaryEmailSource.description: whether an employee's primary email is their personal (P) or work (W) email, or empty if neither is assigned

benefitEmail.description: email address to use when communicating with employeeduring online benefits enrollment; employee must choose to make this email address active for benefits communications

rehireOk.description: indicates whether the employee can be rehired: 'Y' (OK to rehire), 'N' (do not rehire), or empty string (no preference)

returnDate.description: date on which employee is scheduled to return from leave, if applicable

workPhone.description: work telephone number, not including extension

courtOrderMedical.description: indicates whether employee is paying a premium for court-ordered medical insurance, which affects calculation of child support garnishments: 'N'  (no), 'Y'  (yes; medical deduction reduces base pay for garnishment), 'YD' (yes; dependent medical deduction reduces base pay), 'M'  (yes; medical deduction reduces garnisment amount), 'MD' (yes; dependent medical deduction reduces garnishment amount)

childSpouseSupport.description: indicates whether the employee supports another spouse or child; used for calculating maximum child support

childSpouseArrears.description: indicates whether the employee is late by 12 weeks or more in making obligated support payments

addressLine1.description: address line 1 from alternate mailing address

addressLine2.description: address line 2 from alternate mailing address

zip.description: ZIP code from alternate mailing address

handbookMailDate.description: date on which employee handbook was sent

handbookRecvDate.description: date on which employee confirmed receipt of handbook

unionDate.description: date on which employee started with the labor union

electronicOnboard.description: indicates whether the employee was electronically onboarded

electronicOnboardDate.description: date on which the employee was electronically onboarded

reportsTo.description: maps to PTO Approver in Prism. Value must be a valid employeeId for the client

onboardInProgress.description: indicates whether the employee's onboarding is in progress

backgroundTest.description: indicates whether the background test was completed

workersCompExempt.description: indicates whether the employee is Workers Comp Exempt

preferredPronoun.description: pronoun that the employee prefers to use (for example, she/her/hers and they/them/theirs)

clientChecksum.description: client checksum to use for updates

homeLocation.description: the employee's new or current home Location

homeDivision.description: the employee's new or current home Division

homeDepartment.description: the employee's new or current home Department

workShift.description: the employee's new or current Work Shift

projCostCenter.description: the employee's new or current Project Cost Center

workGroupCode.description: the employee's new or current Work Group

benefitGroup.description: the employee's new or current Benefit Group

retirementBenefitGroup.description: the employee's new or current Retirement Benefit Group

electronic1095C.description: whether the employee elected to receive an early Form 1095-C in Employee Portal. Valid values are (Y)es and (N)o.

manager.description: the employee's manager. Value must be a valid employeeId for the client

selfIdDisabilityForm.description: indicates how the employee replied to the Self ID Disability Form; valid values are empty string (no selection), 'Disabled', 'NotDisabled', or 'DeclineToAnswer'

payGroup.description: pay group to which employee belongs; the system uses the employee pay group assignment and data entered in the Pay Date Control Record to determine which employees to pay on a given pay date

payPeriod.description: pay period associated with the payGroup

payMethod.description: method by which employee is paid: 'S' (salary), 'H' (hourly), 'C' (commission), or 'D' (driver)

allocationTemplateId.description: identifier for the labor allocation template for this employee. This template specifies how to allocate time sheet hours for employees who work in several parts of the company

standardHours.description: standard hours per pay period (for example, 40.00 if 40 hours per week)

salary.description: pay rate associated with the pay period when payMethod set to S

paidThruDate.description: date through which benefit contributions have been deducted from this employee's pay

eicFileStatus.description: filing status to use for calculating Advance EIC Payments: 'S' (single or head of household (a)), 'W' (married without spouse filing certificate (b)), or 'M' (married with both spouses filing certificate (c))

fedFilingStatus.description: federal filing status: must be one of SS (Single or Married Filing Separately), MJ (Married Filing Jointly), H (Head of Household)

fedWithholdAllowance.description: number of federal withholding allowances (or exemptions) claimed by employee

fedOverrideType.description: code for the type of override to perform when calculating the amount to withhold for income taxes: 'A' (add to withholding), 'F' (fixed amount), 'B' (block withholding), or 'P' (percentage)

fedOverrideAmt.description: amount for fedOverrideType (A, F, or P only)

fedTaxCalc.description: code for alternate tax calculation to use when calculating this employee's federal income tax: 'A' or blank (annualized) or 'C' (cumulative)

fedMultipleJobs.description: whether or not the employee has multiple jobs at the same time, or is married filing jointly with a spouse who also works (federal level)

fedDependents.description: credits claimed for the employee's dependents (federal level)

fedOtherIncome.description: any other income, such as interest, dividends, or retirement income (federal level)

fedDeductions.description: deductions claimed apart from the employee's standard deduction (federal level)

hourlyPayRate.description: pay rate for the designated hourlyPayPeriod basis

hourlyPayPeriod.description: pay rate basis for hourlyPayRate value. Can be (H)ourly, (W)eekly, (B)i-weekly, (S)emi-monthly, (M)onthly, (Y)early

deliverCheckHome.description: indicates whether to mail the employee's to their residential or alternate mailing address

autoAcceptTimeSheet.description: indicates whether to automatically accept the time sheet hours

lastChangePct.description: change percentage between previous and current pay rate

lastChangeAmt.description: change amount between previous and current pay rate

lastPayDate.description: indicates the most recent day on which the employee received pay

familyMemberMI.description: indicates whether the employee is a family member of the client/business owner and works in the state of Michigan for state tax reporting purposes

activeDutyBadgeVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as an active duty badge veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

recentlySeparatedVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as a recently separated veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

serviceMedalVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as a service medal veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

overrideType.description: must be one of: 'A' (Add to Withholding), 'F' (Fixed Amount), 'B' (Block Withholding), 'P' (Percentage), or empty / undefined (no override)

overrideAmount.description: override amount. Sets overrideType to A.

reduceAddlWithholding.description: Enter a negative withholding amount. Sets overrideType to A. getEmployee with the Compensation option returns the withholding amount in the overrideAmount field. You must use the reduceAddlWithholding field to make any updates to this value

fixedWithholding.description: Fixed dollar amount for employee withholding. Sets overrideType to F. getEmployee with the Compensation option returns the withholding amount in the overrideAmount field. You must use the fixedWithholding field to make any updates to this value

alternateCalc.description: must be one of 1 to 5, 8 to 14, 16, 17, 19, 20

nonResCertYear.description: the year the non-residential certification was filed

fatal.description: indicates whether the injury was fatal or whether the employee's condition is not known

claimFiled.description: indicates whether the employee has filed for workers' compensation

effectiveDate.description: date on which this status/type change took effect

status.description: employee status code, such as "Active". Service providers define status codes

reactivationEmploymentType.description: employee type code that has reactivation as an allowed H/R action (E)

status.description: rehire employment status, such as active; service providers define status codes

type.description: rehire employment type, such as full time; service providers define employment types

rehireDate.description: effective date of the employee's return

reason.description: code for the reason that best describes the rehire; service providers define reason codes

ignoreOkayToRehireFlag.description: 'true' to rehire the employee regardless of the setting of the Okay to Rehire flag, otherwise 'false'. If set to true and the employee is set to No for rehire, then the system hires the employee and changes the Okay to Rehire flag to Not Specified. If set to false and the employeeis set to No for rehire, the system does not allow the employee to be rehired. If set to false and the employee is set to Yes or Not Specified for rehire, then the system hires the employee.

stopPreviousVoluntaryDeductions.description: 'true' to stop any voluntary deductions on the employee record from previous employment; the system adds the rehire date as the stop date for the recurring deductions. 'false' or null will leave previous deductions as they were, if any.

stopPreviousDirectDeposit.description: 'true' or null to stop any ACH entries previously set for the employee and set any direct deposit accounts to inactive. 'false' to leave the ACH settings as they were (active or inactive).

autoEnrollBenefits.description: 'true' to automatically enroll the employee in benefit plans for which they are eligible, otherwise 'false' or null to not auto-enroll the employee in benefits

seniorityDate.description: date to use in place of the rehire date when determining employee's eligibility for benefit plans

onboarding.description: whether or not the rehire should be sent to PrismHR Onboarding. Default is false.

everify.description: whether the employee is flagged to go through the E-Verify process. if everify flag is set, the employee will be flagged appropriately according to the client and location settings.

doNotLaunchBEWorkflow.description: whether to launch a Benefits Enrollment workflow for the rehired employee. If the value is empty or false, the system launches the workflow if available. If the value is true, no Benefits Enrollment workflow is launched

location.description: code for employee's work location; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Location option to get a list of the company's worksite locations

position.description: code for employee's job or position; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Job option to get a list of jobs/positions

benefitGroup.description: benefit group to which the employee belongs

retirementBenefitGroup.description: retirement benefit group to which the employee belongs

department.description: company's code for employee's department; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Department option get a list of the departments

shift.description: code for employee's shift assignment; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Shift option to get a list of the company's shifts

project.description: company's code for employee's project; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Project option to get a list of the projects

workGroup.description: work group to which the employee belongs; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Workgroup option to get a list of work groups for the company

unionCode.description: code for union to which employee belongs

If flag is set to false, the termination would follow the approval policies set for managers. Please note that an approval policy must exist for this to function without error.

addHrsToCurrentPayroll.description: 'Y' will apply the available hours to the current timesheet. 'N' (default) will not apply the available hours to the employee's payout.

achVoucher.description: information on accounts to which deposits are made; this is best described as the employee's direct deposit record

employee1099.description: indicates whether the employee is a 1099 contractor. If the employee has vouchers for the current year you will not be able to modify the 1099 contractor flag and will need to contact service provider for help.

scorpOwner.description: indicates whether the employee is s-corp owner.

businessOwner.description: indicates whether the employee is an owner of the client.

officer.description: indicates whether the employee is a company officer.

onboardingInProgress.description: indicates whether the employee's onboarding is in progress. You can turn off the onboardingInProgress flag using EmployeeService.updateEmployeeFields but this is not recommended. Unflagging an employee during the onboarding process does not complete onboarding and onboarding must be completed whether this flag is unchecked or not. Never do this before the I9 section 2 has been completed.

backgroundTest.description: indicates whether the background test was completed

rehireOk.description: indicates whether the employee can be rehired: 'Y' (OK to rehire), 'N' (do not rehire), or empty string (no preference)
