preferredPronoun.description: the pronouns the employee prefers to use (for example, she/her/hers or they/them/theirs)

lastName.description: employee's family name; cannot include a comma

birthDate.description: employee's date of birth; cannot be in the future or more than 100 years in the past

gender.description: the employee's gender: M, F, X or D

ethnicCode.description: the employee's ethnic code; must be a valid code defined by the service provider

homePhone.description: employee's primary home telephone number; must be ten digits in length

smoker.description: 'Y' if employee is a tobacco user, 'N' if they are not, and '' (blank) if value not selected.

handicapped.description: indicate the employee's disabled status under the ADA: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)'

blind.description: 'Y' if employee is legally blind and 'N' if they are not.

veteran.description: indicate the applicant's status as a United States veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)

vietnamVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as a Vietnam veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D'(declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

disabledVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as a disabled veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

serviceMedalVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as a service medal veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

recentlySeparatedVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as a recently separated veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

otherProtectedVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as a protected veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

activeDutyBadgeVet.description: indicate the applicant's status as an active duty badge veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

driverLicenseExpireDate.description: date on which the employee's driver's license expires

driverState.description: two-character state postal code that issued the employee's driver's license

driverLicenseClass.description: classification of the employee's driver's license

preferredLanguage.description: three-letter code for employee's preferred language. Enter (ENG)lish, (SPA)nish, (FRE)nch, (GER)man, (ITA)lian, (POL)ish, or a custom language if applicable.

electronic1095C.description: whether the employee elected to receive an early Form 1095-C in Employee Portal. Valid values are (Y)es and (N)o.

manager.description: the employee's manager. Value must be a valid employeeId or valid trusted advisor prism user id

autoPolicy.description: object containing vehicle insurance policy information

taxCreditEmp.description: whether an employee is a tax credit employee

selfIdDisabilityForm.description: indicates how the employee replied to the Self ID Disability Form; valid values are empty string (clears any existing value and indicates no selection by the employee), 'Disabled', 'NotDisabled', or 'DeclineToAnswer'

autoAcceptTimesheet.description: whether or not the time sheet automatically populates with a default number of hours

updateTimesheetHours.description: whether to update the time sheet hours for a salaried employee that exists in a current payroll batch. Time sheet hours are updated to the defaultHours provided in the input. Time sheet hours will only be updated if payMethod is "S" and defaultHours has been changed and is greater than zero, otherwise updateTimesheetHours is ignored.

secondaryAllowance.description: must be numeric integer value range 0 to 99

overrideType.description: must be one of: 'A' (Add to Withholding), 'F' (Fixed Amount), 'B' (Block Withholding), 'P' (Percentage), or empty / undefined (no override)

overrideAmount.description: override amount. Sets overrideType to A.

reduceAddlWithholding.description: Enter a negative withholding amount. Sets overrideType to A. getEmployee with the Compensation option returns the withholding amount in the overrideAmount field. You must use the reduceAddlWithholding field to make any updates to this value

fixedWithholding.description: Fixed dollar amount for employee withholding. Sets overrideType to F. getEmployee with the Compensation option returns the withholding amount in the overrideAmount field. You must use the fixedWithholding field to make any updates to this value

alternateCalc.description: must be one of 1 to 5, 8 to 14, 16, 17, 19, 20

eicFileStatus.description: must be one of: 'S' (Single or Head of Household (a)), 'M' (Married Without Spouse Filing Certificate (b)), 'W' (Married with Both Spouses' Filing Certificate (c)), or empty / undefined (not filing for EIC)

translationTable.description: ID of the translation table in PrismHR; this can be an empty string but is required and must be included as a parameter

useGlobalNewHire.description: Flag to override new hire required fields validation based on client settings. When this flag is set to true, PrismHR global settings will be used for new hire required fields validation

ignoreNewHireOptionalFields.description: Flag to ignore validation for new hire optional fields. Please use this with caution, as these fields are required for appropriate processing of a payroll, calculation of taxes, benefits assignments, and so on

maritalStatus.description: the employee's marital status: 'S' (single), 'M' (married), 'D' (divorced), 'W' (widowed), 'C' (civil union), 'O' (other), or blank (not specified)

smoker.description: 'Y' if the employee uses tobacco products, also can be 'N' or empty

addressLine2.description: second line of the street address, if needed

handicapped.description: indicates the employee's disabled status under the ADA: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)'

blind.description: 'Y' if the employee is legally blind, also can be 'N' or empty

vietnamVeteran.description: indicates the employee's status as a Vietnam veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D'(declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

disabledVeteran.description: indicates the employee's status as a disabled veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified); note that you cannot set this to 'Y' unless veteran is set to 'Y'

emergContactName.description: name of the employee's emergency contact

emergContactPhone.description: telephone number for the employee's emergency contact

emergContactRelation.description: relationship of the emergency contact to the employee

ssn.description: new hires Social Security Number or Alien Registration Number; if the new hire is a contractor, this field also accepts an employer identification number (EIN format: xx-xxxxxxx)

employeeStatusCode.description: employee's status code (status usually indicates active, on leave, or terminated); use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Status option to get a list of statuses

employeeTypeCode.description: employee's type code (type usually indicates full- or part-time employment); use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Type option to get a list of types

workLocationCode.description: code for new employee's work location; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Location option to get a list of the company's worksite locations

jobCode.description: code for new employee's job or position; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Job option to get a list of jobs/positions

origHireDate.description: original date of hire within company (YYYY-MM-DD format)

lastHireDate.description: previous hire date within the organization (YYYY-MM-DD format)

peoStartDate.description: date on which the employee started with the service provider (YYYY-MM-DD format)

employeeNumber.description: employee number assigned by the company or organization

mailAddressLine2.description: second line of mailing address, if needed

mailCity.description: city or town of mailing address

mailZip.description: five-digit ZIP code for mailing address

shiftCode.description: code for new employee's shift assignment; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Shift option to get a list of the company's shifts

payMethod.description: pay method for employee must be one of: S' (salary), H' (hourly), 'C' (commission) or 'D' (driver)

payRate.description: pay rate (###.#### format). Must be hourly value with payMethod H

eicFileStatus.description: EIC (earned income credit) filing status: 'S' (Single or Head of Household (a)), 'W' (Married without Spouse Filing Certificate (b)), 'M' (Married with Both Spouses Filing Certificate (c)), or blank (employee is not filing for EIC)

fedFileStatus.description: Federal filing status: must be one of SS (Single or Married Filing Separately), MJ (Married Filing Jointly), H (Head of Household)

hsFileStatus.description: resident state filing status; use TaxRateService.getStateW4Params to get a list of allowed values for the resident state

wsFileStatus.description: work state filing status; use TaxRateService.getStateW4Paramsto get a list of allowed values for the work state

officer.description: indicates whether the employee is an officer at the client company

defaultDeptCode.description: company's code for employee's department; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Department option get a list of the departments

terminateReason.description: reason code for termination of employment

benefitsGroup.description: benefit group to which the new employee belongs

userField1.description: value for user-defined field; use EmployeeService.getUserDefinedFields to get a list of the custom fields

hsAlternateCalc.description: resident state alternate calculation if employee lives in Arizona

wsAlternateCalc.description: work state alternate calculation if employee lives in Arizona

flag1099.description: indicates new employee status as a 1099 contractor, if appropriate

payGroup.description: valid pay group for the client company; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the PGroups option to get a list of the pay groups

defaultDivisionCode.description: company's code for division; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Division option get a list of the divisions

defaultProjectCode.description: company's code for employee's project; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Project option to get a list of the projects

autoPay.description: whether pay hours should default to a specified value; Y (yes) or N (no)

autoPayHours.description: defines the auto pay hours if autoPay is Y: ###.## format

hsExemptAmt.description: resident state exempt amount; used only in specific states (#####.## format)

hsSecondaryAllowance.description: number of secondary allowances for resident state: integer

hsSupplementalAmt.description: resident state supplemental tax amount; used only in specific states (#####.## format)

wsExemptAmt.description: work state exempt amount; used only in specific states (#####.## format)

wsSecondaryAllowance.description: number of secondary allowances for work state: integer

wsSupplementalAmt.description: work state supplemental tax amount; used only in specific states (#####.## format)

payPeriod.description: pay period (basis) to which the pay rate applies for payMethod (S)alaried. Valid options are (H)ourly, (W)eekly, (B)i-Weekly, (S)emi-Monthly, (M)onthly, and (Y)early. Those employees set as (H)ourly payMethod will always have a pay rate basis of hourly

veteran.description: indicates the applicant's status as a United States veteran: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)

newlySeparatedVeteran.description: indicates whether the employee recently left the U.S. armed services: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)

serviceMedalVeteran.description: indicates whether the new employee is a U.S. veteran who was presented witha service medal: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)

otherProtectedVeteran.description: indicates whether the employee is a U.S. veteran covered by Department of Labor: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)

activeDutyBadgeVet.description: indicates whether the employee is a Active Duty Badged Vet: 'Y' (yes), 'N' (no), 'D' (declined to answer), or blank (not specified)

i9IdentDocTitle.description: Title of the primary identity document used for Form I-9. Use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes to get a list of I-9 documents and use the document's code value.

i9IdentDocId.description: document number on primary identity document used for Form I-9

i9IdentIssueAuth.description: Authority that issued the primary identity document used for Form I-9; use ClientMasterService.GetClientCodes with the I9docs option to get a list of documents and the associated issuing authorities.

i9IdentExpireDate.description: expiration date of primary identity document used for Form I-9 (YYYY-MM-DD format)

i9EligDocTitle.description: Title of the document used for Form I-9 to prove employment eligibility. Use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes to get a list of I-9 documents and use the document's code value.

i9EligDocId.description: ID number on eligibility document used for Form I-9

i9EligIssueAuth.description: Authority that issued eligibility document used for Form I-9; use ClientMasterService.GetClientCodes with the I9docs option to get a list of documents and the associated issuing authorities.

i9EligExpireDate.description: expiration date of elibility document used for Form I-9 (YYYY-MM-DD format)

ficaExempt.description: 'true' if the employee is exempt from FICA taxes, otherwise 'false'

workGroupCode.description: work group to which the new employee belongs; use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes with the Workgroup option to get a list of work groups for the company

unionCode.description: code for union to which employee belongs

supervisor.description: maps to PTO Approver in Prism. Value must be a valid employeeId for the client

benefitThruDate.description: date through which benefit contributions have been deducted from this employee's pay (YYYY-MM-DD format); typically same as hire date unless importing an employee who's been with the company for a while and is just being imported

agricultureWorker.description: whether the new employee is an agricultural worker

newHireReportDate.description: used to populate the report date to prevent reporting the employee again on the next download

mailCheckHome.description: indicates whether to mail paychecks to the employee's home

w2AddressLine1.description: first line of address for sending Form W-2

w2AddressLine2.description: second line of address for Form W-2, if needed

w2City.description: city or town for Form W-2

w2ZipCode.description: five-digit ZIP code for Form W-2

scorpPrincipal.description: indicates whether the employee is an S-Corp Principal

electronicPayStub.description: indicates whether the employee receives an electronic pay stub

electronicW2Form.description: indicates whether the employee receives the Form W-2 electronically

allocJob1.description: job or position code for allocation 1

allocJob2.description: job or position code for allocation 2

allocJob3.description: job or position code for allocation 3

allocJob4.description: job or position code for allocation 4

allocJob5.description: job or position code for allocation 5

allocPercent1.description: allocation 1 percentage in format ###.##; all must total 100%

onboarding.description: indicates whether the new employee will complete onboarding process electronically

handbookRecvDate.description: date on which the new employee received the company handbook: YYYY-MM-DD format

lastReviewDate.description: date of the most recent review (YYYY-MM-DD format)

nextReviewDate.description: date of the next review (YYYY-MM-DD format)

benefitEmailOptIn.description: indicates whether the employee opted to receive benefit information by email

useAddedI9Values.description: the system always treats this as true and adds the following Form W-4, Form W-5, and Form I-9 data to the system

i9FromOnboard.description: indicates whether the Form I-9 was originally from onboarding

i9RenewDate.description: date on which to renew the Form I-9 information: format YYYY-MM-DD

i9LastName.description: new employee's family name from Form I-9

i9SocSecNum.description: Social Security number from Form I-9

i9BirthDate.description: date of birth from Form I-9 (YYYY-MM-DD format)

i9Elig2Document.description: Form I-9 identity 2 document. Use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes to get a list of I-9 documents and use the document's code value.

i9Elig2AuthName.description: Form I-9 identity 2 issuing authority. Use ClientMasterService.GetClientCodes with the I9docs option to get a list of documents and the associated issuing authorities.

i9Elig2DocExpDate.description: Form I-9 identity 2 document expiration date (YYYY-MM-DD format)

i9Elig3Document.description: Form I-9 identity 3 document. Use ClientMasterService.getClientCodes to get a list of I-9 documents and use the document's code value.

i9Elig3AuthName.description: Form I-9 identity 3 issuing authority is true. Use ClientMasterService.GetClientCodes with the I9docs option to get a list of documents and the associated issuing authorities.

i9Elig3DocExpDate.description: Form I-9 identity 3 document expiration date (YYYY-MM-DD format)

citizenStatus.description: employee's citizenship status. Allowed values can be obtained by calling ClientMaster.getClientCodes with 'I9Docs' option, see citizenshipStatusCodes field. Empty value allowed too.

alienRegExpDate.description: alien registration expiration date: format YYYY-MM-DD

nonResAlien.description: indicates whether employee is non-resident alien

backgroudTestDone.description: indicates whether the background test was completed

formC112Signed.description: indicates whether the employee signed the Ohio Form C-112

crossCompanyEid.description: employee's existing ID when hiring that employee into another company; required when using NewHireService.importEmployeeAllowingCrossHire for that purpose, otherwise leave blank

fedMultipleJobs.description: whether or not the employee has multiple jobs at the same time, or is married filing jointly with a spouse who also works (federal level)

fedDependents.description: credits claimed for the employee's dependents (federal level)

fedOtherIncome.description: any other income, such as interest, dividends, or retirement income (federal level)

fedDeductions.description: deductions claimed apart from the employee's standard deduction (federal level)

wsMultipleJobs.description: whether or not the employee has multiple jobs at the same time, or is married filing jointly with a spouse who also works (work state level)

wsDependents.description: credits claimed for the employee's dependents (work state level)

wsOtherIncome.description: any other income, such as interest, dividends, or retirement income (work state level)

wsDeductions.description: deductions claimed apart from the employee's standard deduction (work state level)

hsMultipleJobs.description: whether or not the employee has multiple jobs at the same time, or is married filing jointly with a spouse who also works (home state level)

hsDependents.description: credits claimed for the employee's dependents (home state level)

hsOtherIncome.description: any other income, such as interest, dividends, or retirement income (home state level)

hsDeductions.description: deductions claimed apart from the employee's standard deduction (home state level)

seniorityDate.description: date on which the employee's seniority is based (YYYY-MM-DD format). Used to determine benefit details

everify.description: whether the employee is flagged to go through the E-Verify process. if everify flag is set, the employee will be flagged appropriately according to the client and location settings. If employee is going through prism onboarding, then the everify flag will be ignored.

preferredPronoun.description: pronoun that the employee prefers to use

okToRehire.description: indicates whether a terminated, imported employee can be rehired. Valid values are "Y", "N", and empty string

retirementBenefitGroup.description: retirement plan benefit group to which the employee belongs. If no value is provided, the system automatically populates the value stored in benefitGroup, as long as that group is not set as benefit-only

preferredLanguage.description: three-letter code for employee's preferred language.

manager.description: employee ID of the person to whom the employee will report

clockNum.description: clock number, which is the employee's time clock ID

grossPay.description: calculated gross pay for the manual check

deductions.description: calculated standard and voluntary deductions for the manual check

taxes.description: calculated taxes for the manual check

netPay.description: calculated net pay for the manual check

checkDate.description: the check date, must be after the last pay date (YYYY-MM-DD)

bankAccountCode.description: bank account code, must be a valid bank account code registered in Prism

checkNumber.description: check number that the client issued to the employee

tipGrossReceipts.description: the amount of tip gross receipts to record if you require allocated tip calculations

payPeriod.description: the pay period to use in calculating taxes for the pay amount: (W)eekly, (B)iweekly, (S)emi-monthly, (M)onthly, (Q)uarterly, or (A)nnually

deductionPeriod.description: the deduction period for which the system should calculate standard deductions and benefits: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 0 (deductions will not be calculated)

workShift.description: the work shift applicable to the payroll voucher

reference.description: reference number to view an existing entry. This is a unique internal identifier, and not the same as the check number.

checksum.description: manual check record checksum

status.description: status of the check: (PEND)ing, (INIT)ialized, or (POST)ed

payrollNumber.description: the payroll number that the check is posted in, if any

payCodesTotal.description: the total of all pay code amounts

deductionCodesTotal.description: the total of all deduction code amounts

payCode.description: pay code

hoursWorked.description: hours worked, defaults to either the same as the hours paid or zero, depending on whether the pay code is used to pay productive work

payAmount.description: the default pay amount based on the calculation rules for the pay code

location.description: assigned worksite location for pay code wage allocation

department.description: assigned department for pay code wage allocation

division.description: assigned division for pay code wage allocation

position.description: assigned position for pay code wage allocation

checkDate.description: the check date, must be after the last pay date (YYYY-MM-DD)

bankAccountCode.description: bank account code, must be a valid bank account code registered in Prism

checkNumber.description: check number that the client issued to the employee

tipGrossReceipts.description: the amount of tip gross receipts to record if you require allocated tip calculations

payPeriod.description: the pay period to use in calculating taxes for the pay amount: (W)eekly, (B)iweekly, (S)emi-monthly, (M)onthly, (Q)uarterly, or (A)nnually

deductionPeriod.description: the deduction period for which the system should calculate standard deductions and benefits: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 0 (deductions will not be calculated)

workShift.description: the work shift applicable to the payroll voucher

sessionId.description: deprecated, use the appropriate sessionId header parameter instead

calculationOnly.description: indicates whether the calculated manual check should be saved; default is true

optionalTaxCalculationOverrides.description: an array of tax codes and override amounts. Tax amounts are calculated automatically by the system and should only be overridden if there is a legitimate business purpose.

batchWritten.description: indicates if payment written to batch

progress.description: the current batch progress as percent

errorDetail.description: an array containing batch errors, if any

items.description: an array containing batch errors, if any

warning.description: an array containing batch warnings, if any

items.description: an array containing batch warnings, if any

description.description: description to identify the special or manual payroll batch

payDate.description: pay date for the payroll in the format YYYY-MM-DD; must be today or a future date, not a date in the past

employee.description: the employee(s) to include in a manual payroll batch

payGroupList.description: the pay group(s) to include in a special payroll batch

weeksWorked.description: the number of weeks worked during the pay period

deductPeriod.description: the deduction period(s) for the pay period so the system will take the appropriate standard payroll deductions for the employee

payGroup.description: pay group included in payroll batch

weeksWorked.description: the number of weeks worked during the pay period

deductPeriod.description: the deduction period(s) for the pay period so the system will take the appropriate standard payroll deductions for the pay group

payPeriodNumber.description: number for this pay period. The default populates based on the periodStart date

items.description: payroll notes

scheduleCode.description: unique identifier for the payroll schedule; this cannot be changed after the schedule is first created

payPeriod.description: one of the valid pay period types: 'D' (daily), 'W' (weekly), 'B' (biweekly), 'S' (semimonthly), 'M' (monthly), 'MDNO' (monthly: find Nth occurrence of day of week in month), 'MDNW' (monthly: find the day of week in the Nth week of month), 'MDLW' (monthly: find last occurrence of day of week in month), 'MDAD' (monthly: find the day of week after a date in month), or 'MDBD' (monthly: find the day of week before a date in month)

payDay.description: For daily, weekly, or biweekly schedules, enter the day of the week on which employees receive their pay: '1' (Monday), '2' (Tuesday), '3' (Wednesday), '4' (Thursday), '5' (Friday), '6' (Saturday), '7' (Sunday), or '0' (only for daily pay period).

payPeriodEnd.description: This value works in conjunction with periodEndBefAft, indicating when the pay period ends (some number of days relevant to the payday).

periodEndBefAft.description: In conjunction with payPeriodEnd, specifies when the pay period ends relevant to payDay value: 'A' (after payday), 'B' (before payday), 'O' (for monthly schedules only: on day of month before payday), or 'OA' (for monthly schedules only: on day of month after payday).

firstPayDay.description: For semimonthly schedules, enter the day of month for first payday; for example, 1 or 15.

firstPeriodEnds.description: For semimonthly schedules, this value works in conjunction with firstPeriodEndBefAft to indicate when the pay period ends (some number of days relevant to the payday).

firstPeriodEndBefAft.description: For semimonthly schedules, enter 'A' (after pay date), 'B' (before pay date), 'O' (on day of month before firstPayDay), or 'OA' (on day of month after firstPayDay).

secondPayDay.description: For semimonthly schedules, enter day of month for second payday; for example, 15 or EOM (end of month).

secondPeriodEnds.description: For semimonthly schedules, this value works in conjunction with secondPeriodEndBefAft to indicate when the pay period ends (some number of days relevant to the payday).

secondPeriodEndBefAft.description: For semimonthly schedules, enter 'A' (after pay date), 'B' (before pay date), 'O' (on day of month before secondPayDay), or 'OA' (on day of month after secondPayDay)

monthlyOccurs.description: For specific monthly schedules, occurrence of the day (MDNO) or week (MDNW) in the month: 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5.

dayOfWeek.description: For monthly schedules that find a day, specify the day of the week on which employees receive pay: '1' (Monday), '2' (Tuesday), '3' (Wednesday), '4' (Thursday), '5' (Friday), '6' (Saturday), or '7' (Sunday).

dayOfMonth.description: For monthly schedules that find a day of the week before or after a day in the month, specify the day of the month (integer between 1 and 31).

checksum.description: checksum to use for updating payroll schedules; leave blank when creating a new schedule

netPay.description: net pay for this payroll batch

taxWithholding.description: tax withholdings for this payroll batch

employerContribution.description: employer contributions for this payroll batch

employerTaxes.description: employer taxes for this payroll batch

providerFee.description: provider fees for this payroll batch

total.description: invoice total for this payroll batch

ApprovalSummaryResponseAmounts.description: invoice total for this payroll batch

deductionCategory.description: the type of deduction, such as (V)oluntary, (P)ost Tax Benefit, (F)lexible Spending Account, Wage (G)arnishment, (C) Section 125 Plan, (L) Employee Loan Payment, (K) Pre-Tax Retirement Contribution, (KC) Catch-Up Retirement Contribution, (KE) Post-Tax Retirement Contribution, (KL) Retirement Plan Load Payment, (KR) Roth 401(k) Contribution, or (KCR) Roth 401(k) Catch-Up Contribution

batchStatus.description: processing status of the payroll batch

deliveryDate.description: date payroll checks should be delivered

payGroupId.description: pay group included in payroll batch

weeksWorked.description: weeks worked, used for FUTA and SUTA

deductPeriod.description: deduction period for standard payroll deductions

payPeriod.description: pay period number

batchList.description: list of all payroll batches within specified date range and/or pay group

payGroupId.description: pay group included in payroll batch

payPeriodStartDate.description: start date of the pay period for this batch

payPeriodEndDate.description: end date of the pay period for this batch

payDate.description: pay date associated with this batch

batchStatus.description: the processing status of the payroll batch

payGroup.description: Pay group information

availableBatches.description: List of payroll batches available for approval.

items.description: List of payroll batches available for approval.

name.description: name of the employee to be paid

payCode.description: pay code for the payment. Must have a fixed calculation method (such as bonuses, sales commissions, or expense reimbursements).

suppressAllocation.description: indicate whether to suppress the allocation. If Yes, the system allocates the line only to the employee's home data fields, instead of basing it on the allocation rules.

addToRetirement.description: indicate whether to take the amount as an extra retirement deduction. Options are Yes, No, or Yes-FICA (subtracts the FICA percentage from the retirement deduction).

BatchPayment.description: list of batch payments for selected payroll number

payDate.description: pay date for the selected payroll

batchPayment.description: list of batch payments for selected payroll number

status.description: the batch status

batchStatus.description: processing status of the payroll batch

deliveryDate.description: date payroll checks should be delivered

paidEmployees.description: employees in this pay group who were paid

items.description: employees in this pay group who were paid

zeroVoucherEmployees.description: employees in this pay group who were paid $0 in this batch

items.description: employees in this pay group who were paid $0 in this batch

paidEmployeeCount.description: number of employees who were paid in this pay group

employeeCount.description: number of employees in this pay group

totalHoursWorked.description: summation of hours worked for each voucher in this pay group

totalHoursUnits.description: summation of hours units for each voucher in this pay group

billCode.description: billing code; service providers define their billing codes

totBillAmt.description: total billing amount for this billCode in the payroll

billCost.description: total billing cost for this billCode in the payroll

billCode.description: billing code; service providers define their billing codes

totBillAmt.description: total billing amount for code in the payroll

billCost.description: total billing cost for code in the payroll

BatchTotalWithCost.description: totals for the specified payroll batch with costs included

billCode.description: billing code; service providers define their billing codes

totBillAmt.description: total billing amount for code in the payroll

BatchTotals.description: totals for the specified payroll batch

batchTotals.description: totals for the specified payroll batch

batchTotalWithCost.description: totals for the specified payroll batch with costs included

items.description: employee identifier

sort.description: string that corresponds to invoice sort settings

billCode.description: billing code associated with this sorting rule

billCodeDescription.description: description associated with the billing code

billAmt.description: total amount billed under the billing code

billingRuleNum.description: unbundled billing rule identifier; to create a new rule, enter 'NEW'

description.description: description of the unbundled billing rule

rate.description: billing rate is used in conjunction with basedOn

basedOn.description: Amount on which to base the rate: 'U' (units), 'H' (hours worked), 'P' (Percent of wages), 'C' (amount per check; once per voucher), 'F' (flat amount), 'FI' (flat amount per invoice), 'FPE' (flat amount per paid employee), 'FPEIMIN' (determines) an invoice minimum based on a flat amount per employee), 'FPC' (flat amount per benefit plan class), 'M52' (monthly rate per 52 weeks), 'M48' (monthly rate per 48 weeks), 'EMIN' (employee minimum), 'EMINNO' (employee minimum, no credit on overbills), 'EMAX' (employee maximum), 'IMIN' (invoice minimum), 'IMAX' (invoice maximum), 'IMIN0' (invoice minimum, including zero invoice), 'PEPM' (per employee per month), 'PB' (percent of listed benefit), 'PBN' (percent of listed benefit net billed to client), 'PRM' (percent of retirement match amount), 'PNSBFF' (percent to not shelter benefit plan from FICA), 'FB' (flat amount based on benefit rule), 'PWCB' (percent of workers' comp billed), 'PFUTAB (percent of FUTA billed), 'PFUTAW' (percent of FUTA wages billed), PSUTAB (percent of SUTA billed), 'PSUTAW' (percent of SUTA wages billed), 'PTIPTC (percent of tip tax credit over min; special calculation), 'T' (tax-code based rule; uses taxCriteriaEE and taxCriteriaER), 'TCPEPPP' (tiered cumulative peremployee per pay period), 'TPEPPP' (tiered per employee per pay period), 'FBOC' (flat amount based on count), 'FBOCP' (flat amount based on count per tier), 'W2BASE' (annual W-2 production fee), 'W2EE' (annual fee per W-2), or 'WCMIN' (minimum bill for code 005; anything below bills to this). NOTES: If you have rules based on the EMIN, EMINNO, and EMAX, the system uses only one rule per voucher. If you have rules with IMIN and IMAX, the system uses only one for a payroll.

startDate.description: date on which the rule begins if it is for a specific date range

endDate.description: date on which the rule stops if it is for a specific date range

voucherTypeRegular.description: indicates whether regular pay vouchers are included in the unbunded billing rule

voucherTypeVacation.description: indicates whether vacation pay vouchers are included in the unbundled billing rule

voucherTypeSupplemental.description: indicates whether supplemental pay vouchers are included in the unbundled billing rule

voucherTypeArrearage.description: indicates whether arrearage pay vouchers are included in the unbundled billing rule

voucherTypeAdjustment.description: indicates whether adjustment pay vouchers are included in the unbundled billing rule

employeeId.description: employee identifier if unbundled billing rule applies to that one employee

batchTypeRegular.description: indicates whether regular payroll batches are included in the unbundled billing rule

batchTypeSpecial.description: indicates whether special payroll batches are included in the unbundled billing rule

batchTypeManual.description: indicates whether manual payroll batches are included in the unbundled billing rule

employeeType.description: employee type to which the unbundled billing rule applies, if any (employee types are for settings such as full time, part time, and seasonal)

payGroup.description: pay group to which the unbundled billing rule applies, if any

deductionPeriod.description: Deduction period to which the unbundled billing rule applies, if any (1, 2, 3, 4, or 5); if employees are paid during the period, the system assesses the fee for the billing rule. If you specify a deduction period, you must specify a pay group unless basedOn is FPC (flat amount per benefit plan class).

position.description: employee position to which the unbundled billing rule applies, if any

payPeriod.description: pay period to which the unbundled billing rule applies, if any

homeLocationCode.description: Worksite location code if unbundled billing rule applies to only one location; If the unbundled billing rule should apply to most, enter DEFAULT-ALL; DEFAULT-ALL is often used when there are exception rules. For example, if all locations are charged $100 except CORP, which is charged $40, then there would be two billing rules: one with the DEFAULT-ALL location code and one with the CORP location code.

specialRate.description: special rate for a specified period

specialRateStart.description: date on which the special rate begins

specialRateEnd.description: date on which the special rate stops

billingCode.description: Billing code the system should use; typically, this is 006, but you can assign another code to use instead of this standard administration fee.

benefitPlan.description: Benefit plan to use when calculating administrative fee; only affects calculations when the unbundled billing rule is basedOn is PB (percent of listed benefit) or PBN (percent of listed benefit net billed to client. Service providers define group benefit plan IDs.

benefitPlanClass.description: one benefit plan class if basedOn is set to FPC (flat amount per benefit class): 'M' (medical), 'N' (dental), 'V' (vision), 'L' (life insurance), 'D' (long-term disability), 'S' (short-term disability), 'O' (other), 'B' (bond/EPLI), or 'R' (retirement)

payClassEqualTo.description: If appropriate, one or more pay classes if the billing rule only applies to some.  (If it applies to most with only some exceptions, use payClassNotEqualTo.). Pay classes are 'E' (earnings), 'R' (expense reimbursement), 'F' (non-cash fringe benefit), 'RT' (reported tips), or 'M' (memo).

items.description: If appropriate, one or more pay classes if the billing rule only applies to some.  (If it applies to most with only some exceptions, use payClassNotEqualTo.). Pay classes are 'E' (earnings), 'R' (expense reimbursement), 'F' (non-cash fringe benefit), 'RT' (reported tips), or 'M' (memo).

payClassNotEqualTo.description: Pay classes to which the billing rule does not apply, if any: 'E' (earnings), 'R' (expense reimbursement), 'F' (non-cash fringe benefit), 'RT' (reported tips), or 'M' (memo)

items.description: Pay classes to which the billing rule does not apply, if any: 'E' (earnings), 'R' (expense reimbursement), 'F' (non-cash fringe benefit), 'RT' (reported tips), or 'M' (memo)

payCodeEqualTo.description: If appropriate, one or more pay codes if the billing rule only applies to some (if it applies to most with only some exceptions, use payCodeNotEqualTo). Service providers define pay codes; use client/getClientCodes(Pay) to get available codes.

items.description: If appropriate, one or more pay codes if the billing rule only applies to some (if it applies to most with only some exceptions, use payCodeNotEqualTo). Service providers define pay codes; use client/getClientCodes(Pay) to get available codes.

payCodeNotEqualTo.description: Pay codes to which the billing rule does not apply, if any. Service providers define pay codes; use client/getClientCodes(Pay) to get available codes.

items.description: Pay codes to which the billing rule does not apply, if any. Service providers define pay codes; use client/getClientCodes(Pay) to get available codes.

benefitPlanTypeEqualTo.description: One or more benefit plan types to use for billing rule, if basedOn is set to PB (percent of listed benefit), PBN (percent of listed benefit net billed to client), or FB (flat amount based on benefit rule). (If only some plan types are excluded, use benefitPlanTypeNotEqualTo.) Plan types are: 'M' (medical), 'N' (dental), 'V' (vision), 'L' (life insurance), 'D' (long-term disability), 'S' (short-term disability), 'O' (other), or 'B' (bond/EPLI).

items.description: One or more benefit plan types to use for billing rule, if basedOn is set to PB (percent of listed benefit), PBN (percent of listed benefit net billed to client), or FB (flat amount based on benefit rule). (If only some plan types are excluded, use benefitPlanTypeNotEqualTo.) Plan types are: 'M' (medical), 'N' (dental), 'V' (vision), 'L' (life insurance), 'D' (long-term disability), 'S' (short-term disability), 'O' (other), or 'B' (bond/EPLI).

benefitPlanTypeNotEqualTo.description: One or more benefit plan types to exclude from billing rule, if basedOn is set to PB (percent of listed benefit), PBN (percent of listed benefit net billed to client), or FB (flat amount based on benefit rule): 'M' (medical), 'N' (dental), 'V' (vision), 'L' (life insurance), 'D' (long-term disability), 'S' (short-term disability), 'O' (other), or 'B' (bond/EPLI).

items.description: One or more benefit plan types to exclude from billing rule, if basedOn is set to PB (percent of listed benefit), PBN (percent of listed benefit net billed to client), or FB (flat amount based on benefit rule): 'M' (medical), 'N' (dental), 'V' (vision), 'L' (life insurance), 'D' (long-term disability), 'S' (short-term disability), 'O' (other), or 'B' (bond/EPLI).

skipWeekends.description: 'Y' to skip weekends; any count that crosses a weekend goes back two additional days. 'N' to include weekend days. For example, if the cutoff is 5 days before the pay date and the pay date is a Tuesday, then the cutoff day is the previous Tuesday (5 days back, skipping the two weekend days). If the schedule does not skip weekends, the cutoff day would be Thursday (5 days back, including the weekend).

suppressACH.description: whether to suppress the generation of direct deposit transactions. Employees receive paper checks instead

achEarnTypeLimiter.description: specifies the voucher types to be processed as ACH transactions. This can be some combination of (R)egular checks, (V)acation checks, and (S)upplemental checks. Any types not specified will be processed as paper checks

suppressEarnings.description: whether to suppress payment of other earnings. Valid values are empty or (O)ther

suppressDeductions.description: what payroll deductions, other than payroll taxes, to suppress for this batch. Valid values are (S)tandard, (O)ther, (A)ll, (FO)rce other, scheduled (R)etirement, (RO) all except retirement

suppressArrears.description: whether to prevent the deduction of any amounts in arrears

suppressBenefitsCalc.description: whether to suppress any benefit deductions and accruals/arrears calculations

suppressBenefitsUpdate.description: whether to suppress the benefit update step that updates benefit-related deduction amounts on employee standard deduction records.

suppressBenefitAdjust.description: whether to prevent the processing of any benefits adjustments

suppressClientApproval.description: whether to except the payroll batch from the approval process

suppressClientBillPending.description: whether to suppress client bill pending for this batch

suppressLoanPayments.description: whether to suppress loan payments from calculating and processing for this batch

suppressManualChecks.description: whether to prevent a manual check from processing in the next regularly scheduled payroll

deliveryMethod.description: delivery method to use for shipping paychecks and other batch documents (such as postal mail or UPS)

fedTaxRateSupplementalPay.description: rate to use as the federal tax percentage rate for all supplemental pay. This overrides the aggregate method

stateTaxRateSupplementalPay.description: state tax rate to use for all supplemental pay. This overrides the rate for all states

fsaOverrideCalcDate.description: for manual and unscheduled batches. Date the system uses as the scheduled pay date for FSA calculations

benefitCalcDate.description: date to override the actual pay date as the basis for benefit calculations that us an "as of" date

forceRetirementToZero.description: whether to set all retirement deductions to zero for employees in this batch

showFutureDatedChecksOnEss.description: whether employees can view future-dated paychecks in this payroll on Employee Portal

recalculateOvertime.description: whether the payroll batch should recalculate overtime rates.

entityCode.description: system identifier associated with the type of user security either entity, manager or PTO approver access when the user is set up for entity security. Possible values returned from getUserDataSecurity are either MD (Manager Direct Reports) or MH (Manager Full Hierarchy) if the user is set up for manager approver access; either PD (PTO Approver Direct Reports) or PH (PTO Approver Hierarchy) if the use is set up for PTO approver access. For Manager or PTO approver access the typeCode and typeDesc will be returned as null. To apply manager or PTO approver access to a manager or trusted advisor user, allowed values are MANAGERDIRECTREPORTS, PTOAPPROVERDIRECTREPORTS, MANAGERHIERARCHY or PTOAPPROVERHIERARCHY
